title: AI Video Ad Editor (Veo / Sora) – Remote –
description:
AI Video Ad Editor Remote



We are looking for a video editor who knows how to edit real ads and also knows how to work with AI video tools like Veo and Sora.



This is not a beginner role.







 This is for someone who understands editing, pacing, and how ads are actually built.



What you will be doingEdit short video ads, usually 15 to 45 seconds

Use Adobe Premiere and CapCut for real editing

Cut clips, time voiceovers, control pacing, add captions, hooks, and CTAs

Use AI video models like Veo or Sora to generate clips

Combine AI generated clips with manual editing

Create multiple versions of the same ad

Improve ads based on feedback





Most ads will use voiceovers, not on camera talking.



Tools you must knowAdobe Premiere

CapCut

At least one AI video model such as Veo or Sora





If you only know AI tools but cannot edit properly, this is not a fit.



Who this role is forYou already edit videos confidently

You understand pacing, timing, and attention

You have experience making ads, not just cinematic videos

You know when to use AI and when to edit manually

You have at least 6 months experience doing both

You can follow instructions and move fast

You want a stable remote role

What you will learnHow AI video fits into real ad workflows

How high volume ad teams operate

How to improve ads through feedback

How to balance speed and quality





This role is designed to grow over time.



How to apply



Important



We care more about clean editing and clear thinking than fancy effects.



If you know how to edit ads and you actually know AI video tools, apply.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
About the Company

We are a fast-growing Australian non-bank lender specialising in real estate-backed private credit.

We provide structured lending solutions to property developers and business owners across Australia.

We operate with institutional funding partners and manage complex loan structures across multiple entities and trust accounts.

We are scaling and building institutional-grade finance operations.

________________________________________

The Role

This is a high-accuracy finance operations role focused on loan account integrity.

You will ensure that all loan accounts, repayments, and balances are 100?curate at all times.

This role is critical to maintaining financial control as the loan book grows.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

• Reconcile borrower repayments against bank statements

• Maintain accurate loan balances in our loan management system

• Track principal, interest, arrears, and adjustments

• Identify and resolve discrepancies

• Prepare:

• Loan statements

• Interest statements

• Payout / discharge figures

• Reconcile trust accounts

• Assist with month-end reporting

• Maintain documentation for audit readiness

• Support internal reporting requirements

________________________________________

Required Experience

• 4+ years experience in loan servicing, loan accounting, or payment reconciliation

• Experience working with Australian lenders or finance firms preferred

• Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills

• High attention to detail

• Strong written English

• Comfortable working Sydney business hours

Experience in non-bank lending, mortgage servicing, or private lending is highly regarded.

________________________________________

Who We’re Looking For

• Detail-obsessed and structured

• Proactive and accountable

• Calm under pressure

• Independent worker

• Long-term mindset

This role will grow as the company scales.

________________________________________

What This Role Is NOT

• Not sales

• Not credit assessment

• Not settlement coordination

• Not collections enforcement

________________________________________

Compensation

• PHP 65,000 to PHP 85,000 per month

• Long-term full-time position

• Performance reviews

• Opportunity to grow into senior finance operations role

________________________________________

Application Instructions

To apply:

1. Write “Loan Integrity” in your subject line

2. Briefly describe your experience with loan reconciliations

3. Confirm your expected salary in PHP

4. Confirm your available working hours (Sydney time)

Shortlisted applicants will complete an assessment prior to interview.

title: Social Media Manager VA (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
Social Media Manager VA |  $1,000 – $2,000 USD/month

Schedule: Full-time



We’re looking for a creative and motivated Social Media Manager VA who wants to grow into a high-level content and strategy role.



This position is ideal for someone who genuinely loves social media, understands trends, and wants to learn how viral content is planned, created, and scaled. You don’t need years of experience — we care more about creativity, curiosity, and your ability to understand what makes content resonate online.



You’ll work closely with our team to help build and manage social media pages that people actually want to follow, while learning proven strategies behind high-performing content.



What You’ll Be Doing:

1. Assisting in creating and managing social media content

2. Brainstorming content ideas and creative strategies

3. Learning and applying viral content frameworks

4. Editing short-form videos using CapCut (training provided)

5. Supporting day-to-day social media management tasks

6. Applying feedback to continuously improve content quality



What We’re Looking For:

1. Strong English communication skills (written and spoken)

2. A creative eye and strong attention to detail

3. Curiosity about trends and viral social media content

4. Enthusiasm, reliability, and a positive work attitude

5. Willingness to learn and grow in a fast-moving environment

6. Experience is a plus, but not required. Passion and creativity matter more.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:

- Fully remote, work from anywhere

- No micromanaging — we trust our team

- Supportive, encouraging work culture

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid time off

- Long-term stability and growth opportunities



How to Apply:

Please submit the following

- A 1–2 minute creative video introduction explaining why you’d be a great fit for this role

- Your portfolio (this can include personal or casual social media content)

- Include the word “Awesome” in the title of your application



Important Notes (Please Read Carefully):

Applications without a video introduction will not be reviewed

Low-effort or generic introductions will not be considered

Incomplete applications will be automatically disqualified



This role is best suited for someone who is excited to learn, loves social media, and wants to build a real career in content creation and management.



If this sounds like you, we’d love to see your application.

title: Full-time Social Media Manager
description:
Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term

42 hours/week | 6 days/week

$1,000 – $1,400 USD/month (based on experience)



Who This Role Is For:



This role is for someone who genuinely loves social media and understands how Instagram works today (trends, formats, timing, and why certain posts go viral)



You don’t need years of professional experience!

What we care about most is your passion for content creation and your understanding of what makes content trend and perform well.



If you’re the type who notices patterns on your feed, saves posts for “content inspo,” or can explain why a Reel popped off then this role will be a great fit.



Your responsibilities include:

- Posting content daily across multiple Instagram accounts

- Writing captions and stories that feel natural and engaging

- Monitoring post performance (reach, saves, shares, engagement)

- Making smart posting decisions based on data and patterns

- Spotting trending formats and adapting them quickly

- Reviewing content carefully before posting to avoid mistakes

- Sharing insights with the content team on what’s working and what’s not



You’ll be trained on how to analyze metrics, understand posting patterns, and improve performance over time.



What We’re Looking For:

- Strong interest in social media and content creation

- Good understanding of social media trends and viral content

- Attention to detail and strong judgment

- Comfortable working independently in a remote setup

- Willingness to learn and improve

- Experience is a plus BUT NOT REQUIRED

- Personal pages, passion projects, or content you’ve made for fun all count as experience.



Why You’ll Like This Role:

- Fully remote work

- No micromanagement

- Paid training and regular feedback

- Opportunity to work on accounts with large audiences

- Clear growth path into strategist or leadership roles

- Supportive and healthy team culture



How to Apply (Please Read Carefully)

To be considered, your application must include:

1. A portfolio (this can be client work, personal Instagram pages, Reels, TikToks, or any creative projects.)

2. A short video introduction (1–2 minutes): Tell us why you’re a great fit. Be creative &  show your personality. We are not looking for a boring or scripted intro.

3. The number “100” in your application subject line (this helps us know you read the full post)



IMPORTANT!!!!!!!

*No video introduction = no review

*Boring or low-effort video = automatic pass



We’re looking for someone creative, detail-oriented, and passionate about social media not just someone who can follow instructions.



If this sounds like you, apply. We’re excited to see what you bring!

We're looking for a passionate, hard working performance video editor with proven DTC ecommerce experience to join our team long-term.

title: Meta Ads Creative Strategist
description:
WE NEED SOMEONE WITH EXPERIENCE IN HEALTH & WELLNESS AND/OR CONSUMABLE PRODUCTS (e.g. Supplements, powdered drinks, etc.)



Position Type: Full Time

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Schedule: Mon-Fri, 9:30am-6:30pm Singapore 

 

About the Company



Our client is a fast-growing Direct-to-Consumer health and wellness brand with sales in the USA and Singapore. Headquartered in Singapore, we operate as a remote-first team across four countries.



Over the last four years, we’ve grown to 7 figures in annual revenue with 60–80% year-on-year growth. As we scale toward 8 figures, we’re building a performance-led marketing engine driven by systems, data, and creative excellence.

 

About the Role



If you’ve only run ads for fashion brands, boosted posts, or content-first accounts, this role is not for you.

 

This role is for a data-driven Meta Ads Creative Strategist who can own the client’s entire Meta ads system, including scripting and media buying, to hit clear revenue, ROAS, CPA, and budget targets.

 

You won’t be guessing or “posting content.” You’ll be building a repeatable system that delivers consistent performance through structured creative testing and optimization.



As a creative strategist, you will fully own:



- Scripting

- Concept ideation

- Creative testing

- Production workflows

- Performance scaling

 

Responsibilities

 

- Strategic Ad Creative System: Build and operate a creative machine delivering 5–10 weekly video ads, tailored to different customer pain points and awareness levels.



- End-to-End Script Development: Write value-based, conversion-driven scripts using direct-response frameworks (AIDA, PAS) and create precise creative briefs for execution.



- Creative Testing Frameworks: Design and run systematic tests (e.g. 5 hooks × 3 angles × 2 lengths = 30 variations) to identify winning patterns.



- Performance Scaling: Launch structured tests with statistical significance, scale winners systematically, kill losers fast, and document learnings.



- Data Analysis & Optimisation: Monitor daily metrics (CTR, CPM, CPC, CVR, AOV), refresh creatives weekly to combat fatigue, and deliver monthly reports with actionable insights.



- Creator & Production Management: Coordinate creators in the US and Australia, manage production timelines, quality control output, and build repeatable templates for consistent delivery.



- Budget & ROAS Ownership: Take full ownership of scaling profitably while maintaining target ROAS and building predictable growth models.

 

Competencies and Qualifications



Must-Have



- 3+ years scaling Meta ads for DTC eCommerce brands

- Proven track record managing $5,000+ USD/month profitably

- Has scripted and/or created 30+ short-form video ads

- Strong direct-response copywriting skills (AIDA, PAS, etc.)

- Can clearly explain how CTR, CPM, CVR influence CAC

- Ability to break down funnels and diagnose bottlenecks (e.g. what to fix when CPC rises)

- Experience building systematic creative testing frameworks

- Expert-level proficiency in Meta Ads Manager

- Comfortable owning outcomes, not just execution

 

Nice-to-Have



- Experience managing remote creators and production workflows

- Experience scaling spend beyond $20k+ USD/month

- Strong documentation habits for systems and learnings

- Interest in mentoring or leading a team as the company scales

 

Key Attrributes



- Decisive: Able to make confident, data-backed decisions quickly; scales winners and cuts losers without hesitation

- Inquisitive: Naturally curious about why ads work or fail; constantly tests, questions assumptions, and seeks better angles

- Goal-Oriented: Driven by clear targets (ROAS, CPA, revenue) and focused on outcomes, not activity

- Analytical: Interprets performance metrics (CTR, CPM, CPC, CVR, AOV) to diagnose issues and guide creative and scaling decisions

- Detail-Oriented: Meticulous with scripts, test variables, data review, and execution; spots small issues before they become costly problems

title: Lead Generation & Apollo.io Expert
description:
We’re The Cultivator, an Australian-based agency scaling local and high-ticket service businesses across Australia, the US, and beyond. We’re currently looking for an Apollo Expert who can confidently handle full 
 setup and help us build a solid outbound system.



In this role, you’ll be responsible for setting up Apollo from scratch, including domain setup, inbox connections, lead sourcing, list building, sequences, and basic deliverability best practices. Your goal is to ensure our outbound campaigns are clean, organized, and ready to scale.



We’re looking for someone who knows Apollo inside and out, understands outbound workflows, and can work independently with minimal supervision. Experience with cold
 systems, CRM syncing, and lead generation is a big plus.



You don’t need to be a salesperson  but you do need to be detail-oriented, reliable, and confident in Apollo setup and execution. If you’ve done Apollo setups for agencies or service-based businesses before, we definitely want to hear from you.



We’re a remote-first team with strong support in the Philippines, so onboarding will be smooth. What matters most to us is that you’re proactive, eager to learn, and can deliver clean, working systems.



To apply, head over to thecultivator.co/applynow. Upload your CV and book an interview call with our team. Make sure to select ‘Apollo / Lead Generation’ as your preferred role.



We’re excited to work with you and get our outbound systems dialed in. Let’s grow together.

title: Merchandise Planner (AU Retail)
description:
WE NEED SOMEONE WITH STRONG DATA ANALYSIS IN INVENTORY CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT FOR RETAIL BUSINESSES (Managed inventory planning for multiple physical retail stores)



Position Type: Full Time

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 9AM to 6PM AEST (Fixed)

 

About the Company



Our client is a leading wholesaler that designs, sources, and imports products from around the world for major Australian retailers. Renowned for setting industry trends, they deliver innovative solutions across categories such as apparel, impulse, accessories, and travel luggage. As a market leader in VMI, brand management, licensing, and private label solutions, they design, manufacture, distribute, and manage a diverse portfolio of products and brands across department stores, discount department stores, supermarkets, independent retailers, and pharmacy channels.



About the Role



As a Merchandise Planner (Retail), you will be responsible for leading the Allocation and Store Analysts, ensuring the right product is in the right place at the right time. As planning is the cog that keeps the whole machine running, your role is critical in aligning inventory with demand—managing procurement from China, partnering with sales to forecast needs, and overseeing allocations across both wholesale and retail channels to drive sales performance.

 

Responsibilities



- Lead and support the Allocation & Store Analysts team.

- Ensure stock is allocated to the right stores at the right time, in line with agreed allocation methodologies.

- Analyze future sales forecasts by product and place stock orders to maintain appropriate warehouse inventory levels.

- Identify and action in-store sales opportunities in collaboration with Allocation & Store Analysts to maximize performance.

- Communicate with customers as needed regarding product availability, delivery, or planning updates.

- Coordinate with merchandising on upcoming in-store demand driven by seasonal events (e.g. School Holidays, Easter, Christmas).

- Complete monthly Open-to-Buy (OTB) reviews and reforecasting activities.

- Responsible for seasonal article creation and article master data maintenance.

- Manage monthly purchase order (PO) creation and ensure accuracy of procurement data.

 

Competencies and Qualifications



Must-Have



- Minimum 5 plus years of experience in retail allocations and merchandise planning

- Proven background in multi-store or multi-channel retail operations, with strong hands-on experience in stock allocations 

- Having at least 2 years of management experience with a minimum of 2 direct reports

- Excellent Retail math skills and understanding of excel based allocations

- Demonstrated ability to use data to drive allocation accuracy and improve sales outcomes.

- Proficient in Microsoft Excel, with solid knowledge of intermediate formulas such as XLOOKUP, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS, MROUND, CEILING, and CONCATENATE.

- Skilled in sales forecasting and inventory planning—able to interpret sales trends and plan stock orders to maintain optimal warehouse levels.

- Knowledge of stock allocation principles and methodologies, ensuring accurate and timely stock placement across stores.

- Strong analytical thinking and decision-making skills.

- High attention to detail, including proactive stock management based on external factors (e.g., weather, regional events).

- Accountability and ownership—able to manage key tasks independently without constant reminders.

- Resilience and adaptability in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.

- Excellent communication and cross-functional collaboration abilities—comfortable working across sales, merchandising, and customer teams.



Nice-to-Have



- System Proficiency (Planning Tools & ERP Systems): Proficient in using planning and ERP systems such as SAP, Oracle, or JDA, with the ability to efficiently input, manage, and update forecasts.

- Master Data & Purchase Order Management: Experienced in managing seasonal article creation, maintaining master data, and ensuring accurate and timely purchase order (PO) creation.

- Leadership Experience: Minimum of 1–2 years in a leadership or senior-level planning role, with demonstrated ability to guide and support tea
mbers.

 

Technical Requirements



- Computer with a minimum of 16GB RAM

- Intel Core i5 processor (or equivalent).

- Headset (preferable noise canceling microphone)

- Fast/Stable and Reliable Internet Connection (At least 30 Mbps)

- Having 2 external monitor is a plus

- Webcam

 

What We Offer



- 100% Remote Work

- 13th Month Pay

- Healthcare (HMO)

- Complete Benefits Package

- Paid Service Incentive Lead (SIL)

- Paid Philippines Holidays

- Free Learning and Development Programs

Our team manages the full content process, from planning and filming to editing and delivery. We focus on efficient studio sessions and content built for platforms like LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and websites.



We are a growing team that values clear communication, strong execution, and creative work that gets real results.



How to apply

Does this role sound like a good fit? Submit your application and fill out this form

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Growth-Minded Mid/Senior Python Developer
description:
Do you enjoy development and stimulating work that we approach like a game, with challenges and learning, all while doing great work with teammates who care? Let’s team up.



We believe in people. This is why we only work with clients who serve people. From firefighters, to law firms, to suppliers sending life-saving food to kids dying of malnutrition, the code you write will help make the world a better place.



Our team is made up of people who want to do the best work of their life. People who love to learn, challenge themselves, grow and have some fun along the journey. We also care about each other – we support each other in our own personal goals and vision. We are human beings before employees and we love to bring out the best in each other.



Now, ready to learn more about this opening? Buckle up.



If you work here, you’ll be:

- Challenged to do the best work of your life in a supportive environment.

- Become the best communicator you can become (this is the most important thing we do).

- Have the space to ask questions, voice your feedback and make a difference (and be yourself).

- Help expand our codebase and tools, participate in code reviews, and grow with your fellow developers.



You’ll do well in this job if you:

- Have a strong background in Python and understand HTML, CSS and Javascript enough to be dangerous.

- Enjoy working with people who actually care about what they do and will not let you be lazy or do sloppy work.

- Have an opinion and care about best practices and love learning and creating and building.

- Are familiar with common things we deal with as developers: Git, SQLAlchemy, building and engaging with APIs, linters, etc.

- Have grit and determination and are someone who will exceed no matter what gets in your way.

- Are attentive to details.

- Have 3+ years of Python development experience.



You probably shouldn’t apply if:

- You’re “just looking for extra money.”

- You like working 5 full-time jobs because all you care about is work.

- You get offended easily and take things personally.

- You are not someone with grit and determination who can persevere while being challenged to do great work.

- You get overwhelmed easily with new code, new habits, new learnings and chat messages.



The interview process:

- Since 99% of our work is done via Slack (we don’t do scheduled calls), the entire interview process will be via
. (With lots of questions, sprinkled with a few voice notes)

- You may be able to speak with a developer or two on our team to see how they like the role.



If you work here:

- You’ll get 13th month salary, Filipino holidays, unlimited time off (we don’t count sick days), a normal working day schedule (no night shifts, although an early start is preferred for time overlap) with some flexibility, a week off during the holidays in December, and the opportunity to grow and become your best self.



A little more about us:

- We’ve been in business for a decade+. Our teams are remote (mostly in the Philippines). Our longest standing tea
mber has been with us for over 13+ years. We've had people quit smoking on our teams with our help, lose weight, learn a new instrument, speak a new language, and more. We all love what we do.



How to begin

- Your mission, should you choose to accept, is to send us an
 with 3 questions you have about this role. If you’re currently in a full-time role and are looking for something new, we’re open to a transition window. We actually care about your happiness.



NOTE: While we like AI, and we use it in certain circumstances, we ask that no AI be used during communication. Communication is the most important thing we do. If I don't see your natural voice from our first interaction, then you're setting an inaccurate representation of who you are and how you communicate. And when I see that change, it's going to come across as a lack of harmony in how you communicate.

title: Project Manager
description:
About the Role

Woolbuddy is looking for a reliable, proactive, and organized Project Manager to keep our daily operations running smoothly. You’ll manage inventory, projects, and workflows, while supporting our remote team and helping the business grow.

We need someone who takes ownership, keeps things moving, and ensures nothing falls through the cracks.



Your Responsibilities

Track stock across all channels

Plan restocking and prevent stockouts or overstock

Track projects and deadlines

Who We’re Looking For

Ecommerce experience a plus

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Proactive and independent

Can manage multiple moving parts at once

Strong English communication



What You Get

Direct work with the business owner

Friendly remote team environment



How to Apply

Fill out the application form here:





Important: Only completed application forms will be reviewed.

title: Content & Digital Asset Development Specialist (Authority & Lead Generation Focus)
description:
**IMPORTANT – READ FIRST**

To apply, start your application with the phrase:

**“Content becomes leverage.”**

Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.



---



## About the Role



We are building multiple authority-driven brands in the financial services, insurance, entrepreneurship, and travel sectors. We have invested in a large licensed library of digital content, templates, research materials, and pre-built assets that need to be organized, refined, and strategically deployed.



We are hiring a **Content & Digital Asset Repurposing Specialist** to turn these raw materials into high-quality, structured assets that support:



* Lead generation

*
 list growth

* Website SEO

* Authority building (books, guides, resources)

* Social media content

* Training and educational materials



This role is focused on transforming existing licensed and internal content into strategic, revenue-supporting assets — not producing random content without direction.



---



## What You Will Own



### 1. Content Library Audit & Organization



* Review and categorize existing licensed content libraries

* Identify high-value, relevant content aligned with our target markets (homeowners, business owners, professionals, families)

* Eliminate low-quality or redundant material

* Build an organized digital content database



---



### 2. Content Repurposing & Asset Creation



* Combine and restructure multiple licensed sources into:



  * Lead magnets (checklists, guides, reports)

  * Blog posts optimized for SEO

  *
 sequences

  * Social media content batches

  * Website resource pages

* Rewrite, restructure, and refine content to ensure originality, authority tone, and brand alignment

* Format content for:



  * Website publishing

  * Amazon KDP (books and short guides)

  * PDF lead magnets



---



### 3. Authority & Book Development



* Develop short authority books or guides from curated licensed material

* Structure manuscripts for Amazon publishing

* Support long-form content creation aligned with brand positioning

* Ensure messaging is cohesive and professional



---



### 4. Lead Magnet & Funnel Support



* Work with Growth Strategist to create campaign-specific lead magnets

* Adapt licensed materials into downloadable resources

* Ensure assets align with target audience pain points

* Prepare materials for integration into CRM and
 systems



---



### 5. Ongoing Content Systems



* Build reusable content frameworks

* Maintain content calendar support

* Repurpose long-form content into multiple formats

* Assist in building training material and educational resources



---



## Required Experience & Skills



* Strong writing and rewriting ability (clear, professional English)

* Experience with content repurposing and restructuring

* Ability to combine multiple sources into cohesive material

* Understanding of SEO fundamentals

* Familiarity with formatting for Amazon KDP and digital downloads

* Organized and detail-oriented

* Comfortable working with structured guidance and campaign direction



---



## Work Details



* Full-time or high part-time (30–40 hours per week)

* Long-term role

* Must overlap with U.S. Eastern Time for at least 3–4 hours daily



---



## Compensation



* $400 – $800 USD per month (based on experience and scope)

* Performance-based increases tied to asset production and usability



---



## This Role Is Ideal For



* Content professionals who enjoy restructuring and improving existing material

* Detail-oriented operators who can work independently

* Individuals who understand that content must support revenue, not just output volume



---



## This Role Is Not For



* Writers who only want to create original opinion pieces

* Candidates uncomfortable with structured rewriting

* People looking for short-term freelance projects

* Anyone who avoids deadlines and production targets

title: CUSTOMER SUCCESS / GHL SPECIALIST - USA MARKET (PART-TIME, GROWING TO FULL-TIME)
description:
Company - Romea.AI

AI automation company for medical and aesthetic clinics. We implement GoHighLevel end-to-end: forms, funnels, advanced calendars, workflows, LLM automations, and full-funnel reporting. Small senior team, fast decisions, zero drama.

Hours and Schedule

Starting at 20 hours per week with clear path to grow. Must overlap with US business hours (Eastern/Central/Pacific depending on client load). Weekly client calls across US time zones.

The Role

You own the full client journey from discovery to go-live to ongoing success. You will set up GoHighLevel from scratch for each new client, run weekly client meetings, train clinic staff, and act as the bridge between our technical/dev team and the client. You are a problem owner - when something breaks or a client needs something, you figure it out and make it happen. This is a client-facing role so outstanding spoken English and communication skills are non-negotiable.

What You Will Do

Client Onboarding and Success

Scope projects, create project plans and acceptance criteria. Lead weekly status calls with clinic owners and managers. Keep action logs tight and follow through on every item. Run playbook checklists from forms to calendars to pipelines to automations to reporting. Be the single point of contact for the client and coordinate with our dev team to deliver.

GoHighLevel Build (From Scratch)

Forms and funnels with UTM/GCLID capture, hidden fields, spam controls. Advanced calendars including multi-rule, round-robin, buffers, provider rules, no-show logic, Zoom and Google Meet integration. Workflows including dynamic
s and SMS, conditional paths, merge fields, custom values, reactivation sequences. Pipelines, snapshots, and full account configuration.

Ads and Tracking Integration

Google Ads: GCLID/UTM capture into contact fields, offline conversion uploads with lead stage mapping, values, and de-duplication rules. TikTok Ads: Pixel plus Events API/CAPI mapping for key events such as form submit, schedule, and attended. GA4/GTM where needed. Verify events and fix data gaps.

Reporting

Build executive dashboards in GHL and/or Looker Studio showing leads to bookings to show rate to revenue, broken down by source, campaign, adset, provider, and location. Monthly and quarterly business reviews with clear recommendations.

Training (This Is a Big Part of the Role)

Create SOPs, checklists, and short Loom videos. Deliver live training sessions to clinic staff, partners, and internal team. You must be comfortable presenting, explaining, and teaching in a professional and engaging way. Experience running client-facing training sessions is required.

Commercial Awareness

Understand the business side. Identify upsell opportunities, flag churn risks early, and think like a business owner when advising clients. You are not just a technician - you represent Romea.AI to our clients.

Must-Haves (No Exceptions)

Extensive GoHighLevel experience - minimum 2 years or 15 plus implementations across funnels, forms, workflows, calendars, pipelines, and snapshots. You must be able to set up a full GHL account from zero.

GoHighLevel certification(s) required. Please include proof in your application.

Proven experience with client-facing training - live sessions, webinars, onboarding walkthroughs. Show us examples.

Google Ads plus TikTok Ads tracking into GHL: GCLID/UTM capture, offline conversions import, Pixel/CAPI setup.

Excellent spoken and written English. You will be on camera with US clinic owners weekly. Communication skills are critical.

Strong problem-solving mindset. You own problems until they are solved.

Solid project management habits using ClickUp, Asana, or similar. Change logs and rollback plans.

Nice to Have

Healthcare or clinic onboarding experience, especially multi-location setups. WhatsApp/Twilio, Messenger,
 warm-up basics. Light n8n or Zapier familiarity to coordinate with our automation team.

Success in the First 30 to 60 Days

3 to 5 new US accounts fully onboarded with forms, calendars, workflows, and reporting live with tracked conversions. One standard US snapshot refined including forms, calendars, baseline workflows, and reporting pack. Training pack with SOPs and Looms delivered. QBR deck template in use.

What to Include in Your Application (Show, Do Not Just Tell)

Portfolio: 1 to 2 GHL snapshots or screen recordings showing a multi-rule calendar, dynamic
 workflow, and your reporting view. Redact any sensitive information.

Tracking brief (one page max): your steps for GCLID/UTM capture to offline conversion upload to Google Ads from GHL, and TikTok Pixel plus Events API mapping for form submit and schedule events.

Proof of GHL certification(s).

Examples of client-facing training you have delivered (Loom links, session recordings, or descriptions).

Your hourly rate or retainer expectation, US hours you can cover, and earliest start date.

title: Frontend Developer (Electron.js) - WFH

Details

title: Senior Graphic Designer with Modern Skill with AI Prompting Master Skils and proven experience with Amazon
description:
ABOUT US



Since 2013, Prodigy Media has built more than brands — we've created an Amazon-native empire. With 12 years of proven success and 28+ product lines under our belt, we don't play small. Our mission? Launch culturally resonant, design-led, emotionally sticky products that dominate Amazon and beyond.



Now, we're leveling up — and we want a design assassin who’s mastered AI workflows, commands Midjourney like a wizard, and turns prompts into visual gold.



WHO WE WANT



This is not your average graphic design role. We're looking for a hybrid Creative Director / Prompt Engineer / Graphic Design savant who can:



Think like a marketer. Design like an artist. Prompt like an AI god.



You’ll own the visual storytelling for our brands, using both traditional tools and bleeding-edge AI systems to pump out Amazon-optimized assets that convert.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Craft Ultra-High-Converting Amazon Ads – static, lifestyle, 
-tier, and scroll-stopping. Own A+ Content Design – full module execution with story arcs that build obsession. Design Labels & Packaging – pixel-perfect, regulatory-ready, and unforgettable on the shelf. Prompt, Edit & Produce AI-Generated Visuals – using tools like Midjourney, DALL•E, Runway, Spline, Veo3, Sora, and others. Run 3D Product Renders – via Blender, KeyShot, or AI-powered 3D tools. Develop Scroll-Hook Videos – using After Effects, Premiere, Runway AI, etc.



Systematize Brand Visuals Across 30+ Products – while keeping it all aligned, emotional, and conversion-focused.



WHO YOU ARE



5+ years in design, at least 2+ years in Amazon/e-commerce brand creative

Fluent in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Blender, After Effects

Pro-level Midjourney / AI prompt engineer – this is non-negotiable

Obsessed with Amazon visual psychology, packaging psychology, and design that sells

Able to juggle 10 brands and still hit deadlines

Operate with a Creative Director mindset — not just execution, but strategy

Bonus: Experience creating creative systems, art direction templates, or leading a team



MUST-HAVES

Portfolio with Amazon ads, A+ pages, labels, 3D renders, videos, and AI-gen examples

Real-world use of AI tools integrated into your workflow

Available Mon-Fri 5:00am–2:00pm PST

title: Appointment Setter Needed ASAP – Immediate Start
description:
CLIENT SALES REP - FULL-TIME POSITION FOR HIGH PERFORMERS ONLY



WARNING: This isn't your typical "dial and smile" appointment setting role. We're building the #1 renovation growth agency in Australia, and we need absolute killers who thrive under pressure and deliver results. If you're looking for an easy paycheck, keep scrolling.



About ReynMedia



We're a renovator-specific growth agency helping high-ticket renovators ($20K-$100K+ AUD projects) generate consistent revenue. Our clients close $100K+ monthly because we don't mess around with cheap leads or empty promises.



We're scaling FAST: 10 clients now, 50 ASAP, 100 by end of 2026.



Your Mission As Client Sales Rep:



You're the bridge between high-value homeowners and life-changing renovation projects. Every call you make impacts thousands of families getting their dream homes.



Core responsibility: Call and qualify 100% of inbound leads to achieve 30-40% qualification rate.



What You'll Do Daily:



- Call new leads immediately when they come in (speed matters)

- Follow up with existing pipeline prospects

- Qualify homeowners for $20K+ renovation projects

- Track Leads Via GoHighLevel CRM

- Send Leads To Our Clients Directly Via Slack

- Communicate With Our Clients On Lead Specific Information

- Deliver an exceptional customer experience on every call

- Track performance and submit daily reports





Schedule & Compensation:



Hours: 9am-5pm Australian Eastern Daylight Time (full-time)

Base + Commission: $5/AUD + $6 commission for every lead you qualify

Uncapped earning potential - our killers make serious money ($600+ AUD per week)



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

- 1+ years phone-based B2C sales/appointment setting experience

- Proven ability to build rapport and trust quickly

- Experience with CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred, training provided)

- Elite level organisation and consistency

- Sales-driven mindset with positive attitude

- Available during mandatory hours



BONUS: Prior experience with renovators/home services



Our Culture (Can You Handle It?):

- Pure devotion to delivering best-in-class service

- Extreme accountability - we call each other out

- Elite standards - we don't settle for second place

- Growth focused - personal and professional development

- Fun - a work environment our team loves working in every day



This role is an entry point to higher positions. We promote from within based on performance, commitment, and competency.



Don't Apply If...

- You can't handle direct feedback

- You're just looking for any paycheck

- You don't thrive in high-performance environments

- You can't commit to consistent daily activity



How To Apply:



1. Fill out application form: 
/
. MANDATORY: Record 60-second Vocaroo audio explaining why you'll crush this role

3. We respond within 24-48 hours if you advance to group interview



Applications without Vocaroo submissions videos are automatically rejected.



Spots fill fast when we post these positions. Apply immediately if you're serious about joining the ReynMedia team and helping renovators and homeowners achieve their dreams.

title: Operations & Client Support Assistant
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a boutique interior design studio seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented Operations & Administrative Assistant to support daily business needs. This role focuses on
 management, administrative tasks, and backend organization allowing the founder to concentrate on creative work and client relationships.



This position does not involve sales or direct client interaction, but it does require professional communication with vendors, trade partners, and brands regarding pricing, samples, orders, and shipping. The role is hands-on and execution-driven, with a strong emphasis on organization and follow-through.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



 & Administrative Operations

* Monitor, organize, and maintain structured inbox systems

* Draft, send, and respond to professional
s using provided templates and brand guidelines

* Proactively follow up on outstanding
s, requests, and action items

* Flag priority items, identify next steps, and ensure timely resolution

* Maintain clear documentation and organization of
 threads when needed



Calendar & Scheduling Support

* Manage and maintain the business calendar, including scheduling calls, vendor meetings, site visits, and deadlines

* Coordinate scheduling with internal tea
mbers as needed

* Follow established calendar guidelines and respect scheduling boundaries



Vendor & Trade Accounts

* Apply to new trade and vendor accounts

* Track approvals, account credentials, and relevant details

* Request samples, pricing, and written confirmations

, spreadsheets, and online systems

mbers to keep files moving

title: Bookkeeper & Financial Operations Analyst
description:
Enlightened Stock Trading is an online education business that helps traders transition from emotional, inconsistent trading to confident, systemised success using proven, backtested trading systems.



*Please read this entire job description before applying*



We are seeking a detail-oriented and commercially minded Bookkeeper & Financial Operations Analyst to manage bookkeeping, reporting, and actively monitor customer payments and renewals to maximise recurring revenue.



This is a long-term, remote role working closely with the founder and team.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- Maintain accurate financial records in Xero

- Perform bank and payment gateway reconciliations (e.g. Stripe, PayPal)

- Monitor customer payments, subscriptions, renewals, and failed payments

- Follow up on overdue invoices and payment issues

- Track Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) and identify revenue leakage

- Prepare monthly management reports (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)

- Assist with cash flow tracking and forecasting

- Maintain Excel-based financial reports

- Attend daily team huddles on Zoom



REQUIREMENTS:

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

- Proven bookkeeping or financial operations experience

- Strong working knowledge of Xero

- High proficiency in Excel

- Experience with online or subscription-based businesses preferred

- Fluent written and spoken English

- High attention to detail and strong follow-up skills



REMOTE WORK REQUIREMENTS

- Based in the Philippines

- Reliable high-speed internet (with backup preferred)

- Windows-based computer (Mac not supported)

- Webcam, headset, and quiet private workspace

- Willingness to sign confidentiality and NDA agreements



WORKING HOURS

- Part-time

- Must be willing to work Australian business hours

- Availability for daily Zoom huddles



WHY JOIN US

- Long-term remote role

- Structured business with clear systems and expectations

- Opportunity to grow responsibility as the business grows



NEXT STEPS TO APPLY (Please do ALL of the following)

1. Do not submit a generic AI generated application

2. At the top of your application please say "I have read the entire job description"

3. Please include a copy of your formal accounting or finance qualification including grades

4. Go to speedtest.net and run a speedtest of your normal computer setup and include a screenshot of the result

5. On your computer go to to "About my pc" and include a screenshot of your computer processor and ram so we can see you have sufficient hardware to run the computer

6. Explain in your cover letter what experience you have had with accounting / bookkeeping / payroll in Xero. If you do not have Xero experience please do not apply as you will not be considered.

7. Please provide 2 references for your relevant work including
s or phone numbers for us to contact should we requirte.

title: Customer Support Specialist (Must have High EQ & Attention to Detail)
description:
We are a premium wellness brand looking for a long-term tea
mber. We don't just want someone to "answer
s", we need a problem solver.



You will report to our Operations Lead. 



Responsibilities:



Read Between the Lines: You don't just read the text; you understand the context. Is the customer actually angry, or just confused? Is this a VIP wholesale opportunity, or a scammer?



Inbox Management: Handling daily inquiries about shipping, tracking, and product usage with warmth and speed.



Commercial Logic: You treat the company's money like it is your own. You know when to offer a refund to save a relationship, and when to offer a solution to save the sale.





Requirements:



Hyper-Attention to Detail: If you skim
s, this job is not for you.



High Emotional Intelligence (EQ): You know how to de-escalate an angry customer without using a robotic template.



Perfect Written English: Native-level reading comprehension is mandatory.



Tech Savvy: Familiarity with Shopify and helpdesks is a big plus.

title: Amazon Order and Catalog Management
description:
Beyond the Listing: Build a High-Performance Career in E-Commerce 

The Engine of Our Success

-$50M+ Amazon Global Revenue

-Proprietary Growth Framework

-Collaborative Execution



Why You’ll Thrive With Us

-Total Freedom

-Life-First Scheduling

-Accelerated Growth

-Industry-Leading Rewards



Learn More: 



Salary Ranges from $500 to $1500/month

Candidates shall be competent in the following:

Data-Driven SEO & Funnel Architecture: Master search volume dynamics and competitor positioning via Helium 10 and Amazon Search Query Performance reports to identify high-opportunity keywords, diagnose funnel drop-offs, and filter irrelevant traffic to protect conversion rates.

Conversion Content & Product Authority: Develop a "molecular-level" understanding of product science to transform Amazon Customer Review sentiment and competitor pain points into high-converting Product Titles, Bullet Points, and A+ Content (EBC) that proactively addresses buyer objections.

Technical Proficiency & Prompting: Leverage modern AI tools (Gemini, Claude) through advanced prompt engineering to synthesize review data, generate creative copy variations, and automate complex SEO tasks using Slack and Drive to meet tight deadlines.



Apply using the form below:



Not for you? Please view all of our available jobs: 



Disclaimer: This is a general job description for the position stated above. The actual job description will be finalized during interview and onboarding.

Disclaimer 2: Newcomers shall value a long-lasting, committed career here; and cherish collaboration and achieving hyper-growth milestones while sustaining fundamentals.

title: SEO Writer
description:
Posting for my client! 



A growing digital marketing agency is looking for an SEO writer to handle all content-related tasks for their roster of clients. I currently do this and have set up some good automation, but I am moving on to focus more on SEO strategy, so we need someone to come in and do this.



We do use AI and automation (and it's even encouraged!), but we're also looking for someone who knows how to create/what it takes to create great content, and not just completely rely on ChatGPT.



ABOUT THE ROLE:

- You'll be working with the CEO (the owner), SEO Specialist (me), and sometimes the project manager to handle content requirements. 

- You'll be following established SOPs for content creation.



REQUIREMENTS:

- Great English writing skills

- On-page optimization and how keywords and entities work.

- Google Sheets proficiency (a big plus if you know how to keep Google Sheets organized and hygienic) 



NICE TO HAVE:

- Knows how to use NeuronWriter



HOW TO APPLY:

- Send over your resume, previous work, or portfolio. 

- We might also give you a paid writing test.

- Write a catchy subject line. The catchier the better.





I will shortlist the candidates. Shortlisted candidates will move on to an interview with the CEO. I'm setting the salary as TBD for now since that discussion will be between you and the CEO.



Good luck!

title: YouTube Shorts VA (ANDROID NEEDED)
description:
Pay: $150 USD per month + $20 each account that gets monitized



Accounts: Manage 8 YouTube shorts accounts



Role Overview



I’m hiring a YouTube Shorts VA to manage 8 YouTube accounts and post 3–4 Shorts per day per account.

Videos are short (~10 seconds) and already created, but you must source them from TikTok and add a caption. 



This is a repetitive, execution-based role. If you follow instructions and show up daily, this is straightforward. If you need creativity, hand-holding, or flexibility, don’t apply.



Responsibilities

 • Source pre-made short videos from TikTok

 • Quick CapCut caption

 • Post 3–4 Shorts per day per account

 • Follow exact posting instructions 

 • Manage 8 accounts accurately and consistently





Requirements

 • Experience with YouTube (Shorts)

 • Experience with CapCut

 • Android / Samsung phone required (must be able to use a cloning app)

 • Laptop or desktop access

 • Strong attention to detail

 • Available every day

 • Able to follow instructions exactly

 • Reliable internet connection



Payment

 • $150 USD per month + $20 per monitized account 

 • Long-term work for consistent performance

 • Bonuses possible for strong results

title: Short Form Video Editor
description: This position is for a short form video editor who can look at raw footage and come up with creative effects and turn everyday videos into something that captures a person's attention. Daily check-in's required. Good communication skills needed including good spoken English. Needs to be open to feedback from clients and have a can-do personality! Please submit examples and when you can start working. Looking to make a quick hire!

title: Inbound Sales Lead Qualifier & Appointment Setter (Fluent English Required)
description:
We are a fast-growing U.S.-based company generating 30–50 inbound leads daily from Instagram,
, and TikTok ads.

We are hiring a confident Inbound Sales Lead Qualifier to call warm leads, prequalify them, and book appointments for our closing team.

This is NOT cold calling. All leads have already shown interest.

Your Responsibilities:

• Call new leads within 5–10 minutes of submission

• Prequalify based on budget, timeline, and readiness

• Handle objections professionally

• Book qualified appointments

• Follow up via phone and SMS

• Update CRM notes clearly

• Respond to assigned direct messages

Requirements:

• Fluent, neutral English speaking voice

• Prior sales or appointment setting experience

• Comfortable calling U.S. customers

• Strong objection handling skills

• Reliable internet & quiet workspace

• Available during U.S. business hours

Compensation:

$6–$10 per hour depending on experience + performance bonuses for qualified appointments.

To apply:

Send a 1-minute voice introduction

Record yourself responding to: “I’m interested but just looking right now.”

Share your availability in U.S. time zones

We are looking for long-term tea
mbers who want to grow with us.

title: Expert Cold Email + Lead Gen VA (Apollo / Clay / Smartlead)
description:
We operate a white-label personal & business funding company. Your role is to execute expert-level outbound

campaigns targeting solo CPAs in Florida (1–5 staff). CPAs do zero fulfillment , they only make introductions. This role

is for a proven outbound operator, not a beginner.

• Build targeted lists of Florida solo CPA firms (1–5 staff only).

• Enrich leads using Clay with high-quality personalization.

• Operate cold
 campaigns in Smartlead or Instantly with inbox rotation.

• Manage replies, qualify interest, and book Zoom calls via Calendly.

• Update CRM pipelines and report daily performance metrics in GoHighLevel.

• Apollo (lead sourcing)

• Clay (enrichment + personalization)

• Smartlead or Instantly (sending + inbox management)

• GoHighLevel (CRM + pipeline tracking)

• Google Sheets



Expert-Level Performance Standards (Required)

• Bounce rate ? 2%

• Spam complaint rate ? 0

• Open rates consistently 55%–75%

• Reply rates 8%–15%

• Positive reply rates 2%–6%

• Booked call rate 0.5%–1.5% from delivered
s



For any shortlisted candidates, Paid Trial Task will be required for this role

description:

This role supports a custom woodworking and cabinetry shop and focuses on translating architectural or AutoCAD drawings into clean, shop-ready CNC files that can be sent directly to the CNC machine with minimal revisions.



The ideal candidate has hands-on experience in a millwork or cabinet manufacturing environment, a strong understanding of CNC manufacturing requirements, and the ability to clearly interpret drawings and communicate with the team to clarify specifications as needed.



Must apply using this link,

title: Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist – ABA
description:
We are seeking a highly detail-oriented and organized professional to support an ABA clinical documentation process. This role is responsible for carefully reviewing session notes written by providers, identifying errors, inconsistencies, or missing information, and compiling clear, concise summaries to support actionable feedback and corrections.



The ideal candidate demonstrates strong focus, excellent reading comprehension, and the ability to interpret clinical documentation accurately. In addition, this position will assist with drafting amendment notes and related documentation in accordance with internal standards and compliance requirements, helping ensure all records are accurate, complete, and audit-ready.



Must apply using this link,

title: Canva Presentation Editor (Project-Based | 2 Months | 80 Presentations)
description:
Project Overview



We’re looking for a skilled Canva Presentation Editor to help us upgrade our existing presentation materials into high-quality, clean, and engaging slide decks.



You will be working from existing sample presentations that already define:



? Transition styles

? Font styles and hierarchy

? Asset and element choices

? Overall visual direction



Your role is to replicate and maintain consistency while executing clean, professional layouts across multiple decks.



This is a 2-month project covering approximately:



? 80 total presentations

? Around 2 presentations per day



Responsibilities



? Format and design presentations in Canva

? Follow existing brand/style guides strictly

? Maintain consistent typography, spacing, and visual hierarchy

? Apply clean transitions and animations

? Use appropriate Canva elements and assets aligned with samples

? Ensure slides are visually balanced and easy to read

? Deliver presentations on time (daily output expected)



Required Skills



? Strong Canva design experience (please send portfolio)

? Good eye for layout, spacing, and typography

? Understanding of visual hierarchy

? Experience with corporate/business presentations

? Ability to follow templates and brand guidelines precisely

? Fast turnaround without sacrificing quality



Project Details



? Duration: 2 months

? Output: ~80 presentations total

? Workload: Approx. 2 presentations per day, no time tracking required

? Fully remote

? Please indicate your rate



Ideal Candidate



? Detail-oriented and consistent

? Efficient but not sloppy

? Can follow directions well

? Communicates clearly and meets deadlines

? Has reliable internet and availability during PH business hours



How to Apply

 

Please include:

? Subject line: “Canva Pro – [SAY SOMETHING CATCHY]”

? Portfolio link (Canva presentations preferred)

? Your rate



Applications without samples will not be reviewed.



If you're someone who loves clean, structured design and can execute consistently at scale, we’d love to work with you.

title: CS agent
description:
Dear applicant,



We run a dropshipping business with multiple stores in different countries.



We are looking for long-term employees to join our team. There is a great deal of growth opportunity for those that consistently make a positive contribution to our company. We are seeking great candidates that will represent the company with great customer service and dedication.



Therefore, please apply the word strawberry before you introduce yourself. Read on to find out what tasks we expect you to perform, as well as the experience we feel is necessary for this job.



This is a Customer Support job where you would have to follow a very clear process to keep our customers happy, but which will become very simple when you understand every step.



MUST HAVE KNOWLEDGE OF THESE PLATFORMS:



Shopify (eCommerce platform)



Slack (communication channel)



ChatGPT (for prompts + translations)



DeepL (for translation)



PayPal (for managing disputes)



Responsibilities:



Handling customer complaints



Reporting on refunds and complaints



Responding to customer
s regarding refunds, tracking numbers, and FAQs



Contributing to our documentation and improving our support processes



Responding to all customer inquiries in a timely, polite, and accurate manner



Skilled in reporting in Google Sheets



Skilled in generating weekly reports per store



Demonstrating a high level of professionalism at all times



We maintain an ETA of 24 hours, therefore all customer
s must be replied to within this timeframe.



We will provide you with:



Video training



SOPs to follow



 templates



Worksheets



Access to the team lead to answer all your questions



Applicant needs to:



Speak fluent English, both written and verbal



Have a minimum of 2 years of experience in eCommerce Customer Support



Be available for and open to team calls



Be organized, motivated, and willing to learn and grow



Be available to join immediately



Be available during night shifts between 7:00 PM and 7:00 AM (Philippine Time)



This is a 12-hour availability window; the actual working shift is not 12 hours. Working hours (8 hours per shift) will be scheduled within this time frame



Be available 7 days per week (rotating schedule may apply) — this availability is mandatory



Be available for a minimum of 40 hours per week once starting full-time



We will start with a two-week trial period, after which the position will transition from part-time to full-time.

This means that ideally, you are not currently working another full-time job.



Ideally, you'll have some experience with customer support, but ultimately we want to work with someone who loves helping people and is interested in handling customer support issues. We do not want any inconsistency in the
s exchanged with customers.



Examples of inconsistency include:



Sending the same
 twice



Imprecise answers



Off-topic replies

title: YouTube Thumbnail Designer (Viral Style)
description:
A Note Before You Apply:



This is your first test. We do not consider generic, copy-and-pasted applications. If you don’t follow the instructions below precisely, your application will be archived. We’re looking for tea
mbers who are detail-oriented and committed, and that starts here.



You can find our founder on Instagram 
 to learn more about who you’d be working with.





TYPE OF WORK: Project-Based



WAGE / SALARY: Highly Competitive



VOLUME: 12+ Thumbnails Per Month



JOB OVERVIEW



We are looking for a creative and skilled YouTube Thumbnail Designer who specializes in creating high-energy, "viral style" thumbnails. The ideal candidate has a strong portfolio of eye-catching designs that drive clicks and a deep understanding of what makes a thumbnail successful on YouTube.



You will be responsible for designing thumbnails that are not only visually appealing but also strategically crafted to capture attention and communicate the video's value. We need a designer who can work quickly, meet a 48-hour turnaround time, and consistently produce high-quality work for a minimum of 12 videos per month.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



•

Design high-impact, "viral style" YouTube thumbnails that increase click-through rates.



•

Develop creative concepts and compelling text for thumbnails, sometimes using only an audio file for context.



•

Ensure all thumbnails align with our brand's visual identity and high standards.



•

Meet a 48-hour turnaround time for each thumbnail design.



•

Collaborate with our content team to ensure thumbnails accurately represent the video content.



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS



To apply, you must follow the instructions below precisely. Failure to follow these instructions will result in immediate disqualification.



1.

Send an
 to 

Use the subject line: Viral Thumbnail Editor



3.

Inside the
, copy and paste the questions below, providing your answer after each one:



A. Please provide a link to your portfolio, specifically showcasing your best YouTube thumbnail designs.



B. What is your price per thumbnail?



C. What is your desired hourly rate?



D. Are you able to listen to an audio file of a YouTube video and come up with the thumbnail text and concept yourself? Please describe your process for this.



E. What is your typical turnaround time for a single thumbnail design?



F. Are you comfortable working in a Christian-based environment?

title: Operations Coordinator (Remote Dispatch)
description:
Key Responsibilities

1. Fleet & Retail Ops Coordination

*Take retail calls

*Own the estimate-to-approval-to-route workflow:

**Create and submit estimates

**Follow up for approval

**Ensure parts are sourced

**Finalize tech routes for the following day

*Track all jobs in progress and flag issues proactively

*Ensure routes are realistic and efficient; confirm techs are prepped and ready

*Communicate clearly with customers and fleet managers about job timing, status, and follow-ups

*Submit and close out fleet approvals in Element, LeasePlan, and AutoIntegrate

*Ensure invoices match approvals; follow up on outstanding invoices and missing payments



2. Scheduling & Productivity Tracking

*Maintain the daily technician schedule, making updates as needed

*Monitor tech productivity; flag idle time, reschedules, or delays

*Track time logs and coordinate with bookkeeper for payroll



3. Customer Communication

*Respond to incoming calls, texts, WhatsApp messages, and system inquiries in a timely, professional manner

*Follow up with clients as needed to resolve open issues or gather job-related info

*Escalate concerns appropriately and promptly



4. Admin & Reporting

*Submit a detailed Daily Recap covering completed work, pending tasks, blockers, and KPIs

*Keep Trello and other tools up-to-date with accurate job and task statuses

*Track inventory needs and coordinate ordering of parts, oil, and supplies

*Monitor A/R and follow up on past-due fleet invoices



5. Marketing & Content Support

*Publish our monthly newsletter in MailChimp with content from marketing team

*Coordinate publishing of content to Instagram /
 / Google My Business

*Other light admin support as needed for the marketing team



What Success Looks Like

*All work orders, estimates, approvals, and tech routes are handled with zero dropped balls

*You identify blockers or problems before they become fires

*Communication is clear, timely, and professional — with both customers and internal team

*The business runs like a machine — nothing gets missed or delayed

*You take full ownership of your responsibilities and require very little follow-up



Who You Are

*A natural systems thinker who thrives on clarity, organization, and ownership

*Extremely proactive — you don’t wait to be told what to do

*Excellent at written and verbal English communication

*Comfortable in the automotive world and eager to learn the details

*Sharp and reliable — you retain info, spot gaps, and follow through



Experience & Skills Required

*3+ years of experience in a remote automotive: coordinator, dispatcher, operations role

*Demonstrated responsibility for keeping things moving without handholding

*Excellent written and spoken English

*Experience with dispatch, route planning, or technician scheduling

*Familiar with tools like Slack, Google Docs, Trello (or similar), CRM/invoicing platforms

*Experience working with U.S.-based field service, auto, or fleet companies

*Bonus: Familiarity with AutoIntegrate, Housecall Pro, Element, or LeasePlan platforms



Required Software Experience

*Slack

*WhatsApp

*Trello (or similar)

*Google Workspace

*CRM / invoicing tools (Housecall Pro, AutoIntegrate)

*
 (plus)



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

*Dual monitor setup is required to ensure efficiency in managing multiple applications simultaneously.



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Schedule: Full-time, US hours Monday to Friday (9:30 AM – 6:30 PM EST) / Tuesday to Saturday 10:30PM to 7:30 AM PHT

Pay: Php50K-75K monthly; we pay 13th month



We are offering bonuses for full-time members:

*Internet

*Generator

*Paid time off

*13th month pay

*HMO



Application Instructions:

Fill out this form: 
/appqNAvkEQ10YFlc3/pagrX4PvZe0xsKHWT/form

After submitting the form, click the apply button and send us a short message on why you would be a good fit for the role.

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency
