title: Online English/World History Teachers (Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Google PPC Ads Guru
description:
We are a translation company looking for a highly experienced candidate with deep and vast experience planning, setting up, running, optimizing, and scaling Google PPC ad campaigns across the USA to help advertise our translation and interpretation services online.

We care about lead quality and intent (not just clicks or impressions), and thoughtful budget allocation that prioritizes commercially meaningful searches.

The ideal candidate should have many years of experience working on all aspects of Google PPC ads, strong analytical skills and understands search intent, buyer readiness, and lead quality.

Responsibilities:

- Plan, build, and manage Google Ads campaigns across different stages of demand (BOFU, MOFU, and TOF)

- Monitor, track and analyze performance and continuously optimize bids, budget, keywords, ads, and landing page alignment

Requirements:

- Several years of hands-on experience managing high-conversion ads campaigns

- Super responsive and available to help fix urgent issues, including if occasionally needed on evenings and weekends

- Ability to explain strategy, performance, and ads recommendations

- Strong written and spoken English skills

- Previous experience doing PPC ads for translation companies would be great

Please be prepared to showcase work history and references during the application process. This can be a full-time, part-time, or freelance role.

title: Shopify Web Developer - Remote, Part Time
description:
We are seeking a skilled and analytical Shopify Developer to manage, enhance, and optimize our Shopify eCommerce store. This role will be pivotal in ensuring the technical health of our Shopify storefront while also assuring the tracking analytics between platforms is properly maintained and enhanced.



Ideal candidates are both technically savvy and data-driven, with experience in eCommerce, Shopify development, and performance analytics.



Requirements:

-Design, develop, and maintain the company’s Shopify website using Liquid, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

-Set up and manage analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, GA4, Meta Pixel, TikTok Pixel, etc.).

-Knowledge of Google Tag Manager and connection between tracking tools is an essential.

-Build, customize, and optimize Shopify themes and third-party app integrations.

-Maintain and troubleshoot the Shopify store to ensure site stability and performance.

-Improve and optimize page speed, checkout flows, mobile responsiveness, and user experience (UI/UX).

-Monitor, analyze, and report on key performance metrics (conversion rate, bounce rate, AOV, customer journey, etc.).

-Collaborate with marketing teams on A/B testing for product pages, landing pages, and campaigns.

-Assist in setting up tracking for affiliate and influencer marketing efforts.

-Implement CRO (conversion rate optimization) best practices based on real-time data and testing.



Qualifications:

-3+ years of experience in Shopify development, theme customization, and app integrations.

-Proven track record of optimizing eCommerce websites for conversion and performance.

-Proven track record of optimizing analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, GA4, Meta Pixel, TikTok Pixel, etc.).

-Proficient in Shopify Liquid.

-Strong knowledge of analytics platforms (GA4, Google Tag Manager, Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads Manager).

-Experience with A/B testing and CRO strategies.

-Strong attention to detail, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

-Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced eCommerce environment.

-Excellent communication and teamwork skills.



Know more about us!

Ennovation Brands is dedicated to creating innovative, high-quality beauty and wellness products. We are passionate about connecting with our audience and delivering exceptional value through our content, products, and services.



Visit our websites:

title: [POOLING] Head of Ecommerce (Conversion Rate Optimization focused) – Full-Time, Remote
description:
[We are currently pooling applicants to fill several upcoming job orders]

Location: Remote (Philippines candidates only)



Type: Full-time







About Cyber Tools



Cyber Tools is on a mission to revolutionize the world of tools — blending innovation, performance, and storytelling to build one of the biggest power tool brands in the world.



We’re not just selling products — we’re building a movement. We're looking for a Head of CRO who can turn traffic into conversions and browsers into believers.



Our mission? To create the Biggest Tools Company, Biggest Tv Show and the Biggest Castle in the world by blending great products, storytelling, and direct-response marketing.







What You’ll Do



As the Head of CRO, you’ll lead strategy and execution for optimizing conversion across all of our customer touchpoints — landing pages, advertorials, checkout flows, and
 funnels.



You’ll combine creative copywriting with analytical experimentation to identify what truly drives results.



You will:



Own the end-to-end CRO roadmap for Cyber Tools’ DTC funnels and eCommerce sites.

Create, test, and iterate on landing page copy, layouts, and hooks that increase CVR and AOV.

Design and run A/B and multivariate tests using tools like Convert.

Analyze funnel performance and user behavior to find conversion leaks and opportunities.

Collaborate closely with designers, media buyers, and content teams to bring high-impact experiments to life.

Develop hypotheses based on consumer psychology and direct-response marketing principles.

Optimize messaging hierarchy, product storytelling, and visual elements to maximize clarity and desire.

Build dashboards and reporting for continuous learning and scaling what works.





What You Bring



3+ years experience in CRO or eCommerce growth, ideally for DTC or Amazon brands.

Proven success running data-driven A/B tests that moved key metrics.

Strong copywriting chops — you know how to sell with words, not just test buttons.

Deep understanding of consumer psychology and direct-response marketing.

Proficiency with analytics and testing tools (GA4, Mircosoft Clarity or Hotjar, etc.).

Comfort working in a fast-paced, experimental environment.

A growth mindset — analytical, creative, and relentless about results.





Why Join Cyber Tools?



Be part of a brand with a bold creative vision and global reach.

Work remotely with a world-class team driven by innovation and performance.

Have direct impact — your insights shape product launches, ads, and customer experience.

Competitive compensation + growth opportunities.

title: Amazon Dispatcher
description:
Key Responsibilities



Live Dispatch (On-Road Support)

*Monitor active Cycle 1 routes in real time starting at 11:00 AM

*Support drivers with access issues, delivery problems, and route questions

*Coordinate rescues, sweeps, and route adjustments (in the coordination room with other dispatch)

*Track late routes and proactively mitigate delays



Driver Communication

*Communicate clearly and professionally with drivers via calls, texts, and chat

*Reinforce Amazon safety policies and DSP SOPs

*De-escalate issues and maintain calm, solutions-focused communication



Metrics & Performance

*Monitor and protect key Amazon DSP metrics, including:

*On-Time Delivery (OTD)

*Returns

*DCR / DNR

*Safety and compliance flags

*Identify trends that may impact performance and alert leadership

*Monitor how drivers are marking packages ( reach out to the drivers that are marking incorrectly such as household member , out of drive time )



Documentation & Reporting

*Document driver issues, i
, and returns accurately

*Provide end-of-shift dispatch summaries to management



Required Qualifications:

*Prior Amazon DSP/FEDEX/UPS or similar dispatch experience preferred

*Comfortable working midday to evening hours

*Strong multitasking and decision-making skills

*Excellent written and verbal communication

*Reliable internet and dedicated workspace



Preferred Experience:

*Amazon Flex

*Chime

*Support Central

*Rescue and sweep coordination

*Familiarity with Cycle 1 delivery flow



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

*Dual monitor setup is required to ensure efficiency in managing multiple applications simultaneously.

*Location: Remote (Philippines)

*Schedule: Tuesday - Saturday 12PM - 8PM EST // Wednesday - Saturday 1AM - 9AM PHT



Pay: Php 50K-65K monthly; we pay 13th month



We are offering bonuses for full-time members:

*Internet

*Generator

*Paid time off

*13th month pay

*HMO



Application Instructions:

Fill out this form: 
/appqNAvkEQ10YFlc3/pagHcLQwTxwDq1yRh/form

After submitting the form, click the apply button and send us a short message on why you would be a good fit for the role.

title: Notion Solutions Architect & Project Manager
description:
Pivyt is a U.S. marketing agency managing high-volume client workflows. As we scale, our internal systems need to be flawless. We are looking for a Notion Expert who lives and breathes databases, relations, and formulas to build and maintain the "brain" of our agency.



The Role



This isn't just about data entry; it’s about systems engineering. You will be responsible for building, optimizing, and managing our Notion workspace to ensure our team stays organized and our clients stay happy. You should be able to build a complex, interconnected agency ecosystem "with your eyes closed."



Key Responsibilities



Workspace Architecture: Build and optimize Notion databases with complex relations, rollups, and advanced formulas (Notion 2.0/3.0).



Project Management: Oversee agency projects, ensuring tasks are assigned, deadlines are tracked, and nothing falls through the cracks.



Workflow Automation: Integrate Notion with other tools (Slack, Gmail, Typeform) using Zapier or Make to streamline operations.



Template Creation: Build "client-ready" portals and internal dashboards that are both functional and aesthetically clean.



Process Documentation: Create "SOPs for our SOPs." Ensure the team knows exactly how to use the systems you build.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Advanced Notion Mastery: You must be an expert in database architecture. If you don't know the difference between a "Relation" and a "Rollup," or how to write a complex Formula, please do not apply.



Project Management Logic: You understand P
thodologies (Agile, Kanban, etc.) and how to translate them into a digital workspace.



On-Point English: You will be documenting processes and communicating with the U.S. team daily. Your English must be clear, concise, and professional.



Strategic Thinking: You don't just take orders; you look at a problem and propose a better, more efficient way to build the solution.



Technical Must-Haves



Mastery of Notion (Filters, Linked Views, Grouping, Sub-tasks).



Experience with Automation Tools (Zapier, Make/Integromat).



Ability to build clean, intuitive UI/UX within Notion.



What We Offer



Salary: $800 – $1,000 USD per month.



Ownership: You will have significant influence over how our agency operates internally.



Stability: Full-time, long-term remote work with a growing U.S. firm.

title: Financial Controller- NIGHT SHIFT
description:
About the Company:

Our client is a fast-growing, U.S.-based manufacturing company operating in a complex, high-volume production environment. They manage multi-location operations with a strong focus on financial accuracy, operational efficiency, and data-driven decision-making. As they continue to scale, they are strengthening their finance leadership to support operational growth, system optimization, and financial governance.

About the Role:

Our client is seeking a highly experienced Controller to lead their accounting and financial operations. This role owns the full accounting lifecycle, including manufacturing cost accounting, inventory management, ERP integrity, financial reporting, compliance, and team leadership.



The ideal candidate combines deep technical accounting expertise, manufacturing finance experience, ERP mastery, and leadership capability, while remaining highly hands-on. This role is critical in maintaining financial accuracy, driving operational insight, strengthening controls, and supporting strategic business decisions.



Responsibilities:

Own end-to-end accounting operations including GL, AP, AR, payroll oversight, inventory accounting, and month-end close

Lead manufacturing cost accounting, including BOMs, standard vs actual costing, COGS, and margin analysis

Manage inventory valuation, reconciliation, cycle counts, and cost accuracy across SKUs

Oversee ERP accuracy, data integrity, and financial system optimization

Prepare timely and accurate financial statements in compliance with US GAAP

Manage multi-state sales tax compliance, filings, and audit readiness

Lead budgeting, forecasting, cash flow planning, and financial analysis

Strengthen internal controls, documentation, and audit preparedness

Partner with leadership on financial strategy, operational improvements, and automation initiatives

Build, lead, and mentor the accounting team



Competencies and Qualifications

Must-Have:

Advanced manufacturing accounting and cost accounting expertise

Strong ERP system experience in a manufacturing environment

US GAAP financial reporting and compliance

Multi-state sales tax and regulatory compliance

End-to-end accounting operations leadership

Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills

Proven experience leading and developing accounting teams



Nice-to-Have:

CPA or equivalent professional certification

Experience implementing ERP systems or process automation

Exposure to AI-driven finance tools and automation

Experience supporting high-growth or scaling organizations



Key Qualities:

Highly analytical with strong attention to detail

Strategic thinker with hands-on execution ability

Strong leadership presence with a coaching mindset

Organized, disciplined, and process-driven

Comfortable operating in fast-paced, high-accountability environments

Proactive problem-solver with strong ownership mentality



What We Offer:

100% Remote Work – Work from anywhere in the Philippines.

Career Growth Opportunities – Gain hands-on experience, and continuous learning.

Collaborative & Innovative Team – Work alongside skilled professionals who value excellence.



Application Process:

We understand that searching for a new job can be challenging, and we’re here to support you every step of the way. Our goal is to make the process as transparent and respectful as possible.

The interview process includes a Recruiter Interview, Client Interview, and Assessment. As part of the process, candidates complete a hands-on task during the technical interview. Throughout each stage, we keep you informed and provide feedback as quickly as possible, ensuring you feel valued and supported throughout your journey with us.

title: Senior React Native Mobile Engineer (15+ Years Experience Required)
description:
???? TL;DR:



If you have only React experience and think React Native is "close enough," it’s not. Don’t apply.

If you don’t own a MacBook Pro with Xcode installed, don’t apply.

If you’ve never submitted a build to App Store Connect or Google Play Console yourself, don’t apply.



We’re only looking for true senior mobile engineers who’ve been through the entire mobile deployment lifecycle more times than they can count.



? What You MUST Bring to the Table:



7+ years building production React Native apps (not React, not hybrid, not Cordova)



Deep familiarity with Expo (managed + bare workflow), and Expo EAS build/deploy pipelines



Expert with both Xcode and Android Studio



Proficient writing native modules (Swift/Obj-C, Kotlin/Java) when React Native hits a wall



Fully understand the iOS mobile ecosystem:



Apple Developer Account setup



Certificates, provisioning profiles, entitlements



Uploading and managing builds in App Store Connect



Internal and external beta testing via TestFlight



App Store metadata and review process troubleshooting



Fully understand the Android ecosystem:



Google Play Console account setup



Creating signing keys and managing build variants



Managing tracks (internal, closed, open, production)



Uploading AABs, rollout strategies, Play Store policies



Strong JavaScript and TypeScript fundamentals (async flow, memory management, perf optimization)



Experience solving hard mobile problems like:



Background tasks



Push notifications (device-specific bugs? Welcome to hell)



Offline caching and syncing



Native SDK integration



UI jank / frame drops



Comfortable managing OTA updates, crash reports, CI/CD workflows, and OTA rollback strategies



???? Bonus Points For:



Having war stories about apps failing App Store review because of a missing privacy string



Working around Expo limitations with custom native code



Knowing what the React Native bridge is and how it becomes a bottleneck



Handling push notification weirdness across Samsung and Huawei devices



Building your own UI library instead of relying on bloated third-party components



Deploying production apps to millions of users across both platforms



???? Minimum Equipment Requirement:



You must own a MacBook Pro with Xcode installed and working



You should be able to build and archive an iOS app locally without Googling “how to do it”



???? How to Apply:



Reply with the following, or you won’t be considered:



How many years of React Native experience you have



Confirm that you are a Senior React Native engineer



Include a portfolio or GitHub link if available

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
About the Company



Autopilot is a fast-growing B2B SaaS platform built for home service businesses (junk removal, cleaning, landscaping, etc.). We replace expensive, complicated software with a simple all-in-one system for scheduling, invoicing, calls, texts, and marketing.



Our customers are real business owners, not tech people — which means great support and follow-up matters a LOT.



Schedule (Important – Please Read Carefully)

This role starts part-time and covers off-hours support for our U.S. customers.

Saturdays & Sundays (required, even if promoted to full-time)

Some weekday night shifts in U.S. Pacific Time (PST)



Schedule will be set in advance and remain consistent

These shifts take place overnight in Manila time



If things go well after the first month, this role can be expanded into a full-time position.



*** What You’ll Be Doing ***

Customer Support (Intercom)

Respond to customer messages using Intercom



Help customers with:

App setup & onboarding

Scheduling jobs, invoices, estimates

Built-in phone system (calls, texts, voi
)

Marketing tools (follow-ups, text blasts)

Troubleshoot issues and escalate only when necessary

Customer Follow-Ups (Very Important)



Proactively follow up with:

Trial users

New customers in their first 30 days

Customers who seem stuck or inactive



Make sure customers actually use the features that make them money



Customer Calls



Call customers when needed to:



Walk them through setup



Solve problems faster than chat



Prevent cancellations



Clear, neutral English accent required



Onboarding & Success



Help customers get their first win inside the app



Reduce confusion and overwhelm



Make customers feel supported, not rushed



Retention & Feedback



Help prevent churn by solving problems early



Clearly document cancellation reasons when customers leave



Share feedback and common issues with the team



? Requirements



Strong spoken and written English



Neutral accent (you will be calling U.S. customers)



Experience with:



SaaS support OR CRM tools



Intercom, Zendesk, or similar chat tools



Confident talking to non-technical customers



Reliable internet, headset, and quiet workspace



Comfortable working weekends & night shifts



? Bonus Points (Not Required)



Experience supporting:



CRM, FSM, or business software



U.S.-based customers



Sales or retention experience



Ability to spot problems and suggest improvements



???? Growth Opportunity



This role starts part-time, but if you’re good:



You can move into a full-time Customer Success role



Take on more responsibility



Grow with a fast-moving startup



We care more about competence and attitude than fancy resumes.



???? How to Apply



Please include:



A short intro about your SaaS support experience



Your availability (nights + weekends)



A short voice recording (1–2 minutes) introducing yourself



Any experience with Intercom or customer calls



Applications without a voice recording will not be considered.

title: Real Estate Listing Manager
description:
We are seeking a Full Time Virtual Assistant to support our real estate operations, specifically in managing listings and related platforms such as MLS, Zillow, SISU, Follow Up Boss (FUB), Dotloop, and similar tools. This role is ideal for someone with a strong real estate background who is looking for a long-term professional commitment.



Why Join Us?



- Competitive perks including 13th month pay.

- Paid leaves for work-life balance.

- Career growth with the opportunity to step into a leadership role.

- Opportunity to work with a growing real estate business.

- Long-term stability for the right candidate.

- Collaborative and supportive team environment.



What We’re Looking For



- Real Estate Background: Prior experience in real estate operations, ideally with a long-term commitment to one employer.

- Communication Skills: Strong written English skills for
 and backend support. 

- Organization & Detail Orientation: Highly organized, detail-focused, and tech-savvy.

- Proactivity & Focus: Able to multitask while staying dedicated to this role only.

- Reliability: Punctual and dependable, with availability to work Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours.

- Flexibility: Open to working on weekends when needed.



Responsibilities

- Property Input & Updates: Enter and maintain property details in MLS, Zillow, and other listing platforms.

- Pre-Listing Prep: Gather property information, photos, documents, and disclosures before a listing goes live.

- Comparables (CMA): Research market data to help agents set competitive pricing.

- Marketing Coordination: Ensure listings are syndicated across platforms; assist with flyers or online ads when needed.

- Compliance & Accuracy: Double-check that all listing information meets MLS rules and brokerage standards.

- Agent Support: Handle backend tasks so agents can focus on client-facing work.

- Track and report performance metrics using SISU.

- Coordinate client communications via Follow Up Boss (FUB) and similar CRM tools.

- Manage transaction documentation and compliance through Dotloop.

- Ensure all listing details are accurate, complete, and up to date.



How to apply



 
 and 
 with:

title: Online Business Operations Virtual Assistant – Administration Assistant
description:
Please read this whole Description - Important Instructions for your application are included



The Virtual Administrative Assistant plays a pivotal role in supporting the operational flow and online presence of Enlightened Stock Trading and Igniting Your Spark. This position exists to ensure smooth communication, protect brand integrity across digital platforms, and foster positive member and customer experiences through attentive administration and responsive support. This role enables our educational and coaching teams to focus on delivering exceptional value by ensuring the day-to-day administrative and community functions run efficiently.



Working closely with the founder and other key tea
mbers, the assistant will coordinate team schedules, manage digital content updates, oversee social and community engagement, and safeguard our intellectual property online. From monitoring
s and managing files to engaging with members across platforms, this role is essential to maintaining our professional image, enhancing customer satisfaction, and enabling operational excellence across both brands.



The ideal candidate has 5+ years of relevant experience and is looking for a stable, long term role in an engaged and collaborative team.



1. Communication & Inbox Management

• Managing and triaging
s across multiple business accounts

 group

etings and training sessions as required

title: Video Content & Social Media Assistant
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION



Title: Video Content & Social Media Assistant

Division / Business Unit: Marketing / Content Production

Reports to: CEO (Adrian Reid), Enlightened Stock Trading

Location: Remote (Virtual Assistant)



Purpose:

As the Video Content & Social Media Assistant, your primary responsibility is to produce, repurpose, and publish high-quality video content that aligns with the Enlightened Stock Trading brand and mission. You will edit both long-form and short-form video assets for educational use, social media, YouTube, and our members' area. You will also help manage our YouTube channel and ensure consistent, optimized publishing to drive engagement and brand awareness. Your work helps our content reach and impact more traders globally.



Key Responsibilities:

- Video Editing & Production

- Edit raw video footage into long-form educational content and short-form marketing clips.

- Ensure logical sequencing, smooth transitions, and high visual/audio quality.

- Add subtitles, captions, graphics, overlays, and branding elements.

- Produce and package videos for multiple platforms (YouTube,
, Instagram, LinkedIn, Kajabi).

- Create video snippets from training sessions, webinars, and coaching calls.

- Content Repurposing & Social Media Snippets

- Extract and edit engaging highlights from longer videos to repurpose into social media-ready content.

- Prepare optimized versions for YouTube Shorts, Reels, Stories, and square feed posts.

- Follow established naming conventions, file structures, and publishing SOPs.

- YouTube Channel Management

- Upload and schedule videos to the EST YouTube channel.

- Optimize video titles, descriptions, tags, chapters, and thumbnails for maximum reach.

- Maintain playlists and channel layout to improve content discoverability.

- Monitor video performance metrics and suggest improvements.

- Content Library Maintenance

- Maintain a clean, well-organized shared folder system for all video assets.

- Archive and label footage according to campaign, format, and usage.

- Ensure all published content meets brand guidelines and quality standards.

- Manage social media content calendar, plan calendar 30 days in advance and work with graphic designer to produce graphics to support social media posts



Tools You Will Use:

- Descript (primary editing tool)

- Final Cut Pro or similar for more advanced cuts (optional)

- YouTube Studio

- ChatGPT for Descriptions / Titles 

- Google Drive / Shared Drive (file management)

- Canva or similar (thumbnail creation – optional)

- Scheduling tools like Hootsuite / Content Studio and native platforms (for social media publishing)



Success Metrics:

- Increase in clicks to website from social media (especially YouTube)

- Number of videos produced and published per week/month

- Reduction in required re-edits or revisions

- Growth in YouTube metrics (subscribers, click rate, views, likes, retention rate)

- Timeliness of publishing to content calendar

- Increased engagement on short-form content (reels, snippets)



Skills & Qualifications:

- 2+ years experience in video editing and content repurposing for social media/YouTube

- Strong knowledge of Descript (Essential - all our video editing is done in Descript)

- Understanding of social media video formats and platform requirements

- Strong eye for detail, timing, and storytelling

- Excellent time management and ability to meet publishing deadlines

- FLUENT English essential and strong communication skills (written & verbal)

- Reliable internet and computer setup for editing and uploading



Bonus Skill #1: Understanding of stock trading/finance or interest in the niche

Bonus Skill #2: Wordpress management / post creation



About Enlightened Stock Trading:



We help traders around the world escape inconsistent, emotional trading by building confidence through robust trading systems. Our mission is to guide thousands of traders to achieve long-term financial success using a systematic, scientific, and personalized approach.



Slogan: "Remember – You are only one trading system away!"



To Apply, Please closely follow the following steps. Please note if you do not complete these steps your application will be ignored:

1. Attach cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for this specific role

2. List your relevant experience with 1-3 references 

3. Provide a direct link to 5 of the best, recent videos you have edited at the bottom of your cover letter 

4. Provide a link to your portfolio

5. Provide a link to your portfolio for me to review

6. Please confirm you are willing and able to work full time on Australian Dayshift (40 hours per week)

title: Automation Architect (n8n, AI Voice & CRM Integration)
description:
**IMPORTANT – READ FIRST**

To apply, start your application with the phrase:

**“Automation creates leverage.”**

Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.



---



## About the Role



We are hiring an **Automation Architect** to build and connect the core systems of a growing financial services business.



We have already invested in the following tools:



* **Dialora (AI voice / outbound automation)**

* **Bika.ai (AI workflow & knowledge automation platform)**

* **WordPress (Elementor)**

* CRM platform (in active use)

* Automation platforms such as **n8n / Make / Zapier**



Your job is to connect these systems into one seamless, scalable operational engine.



This is a technical architecture role focused on integrations, workflows, and automation logic.



---



## What You Will Own



### 1. Automation Architecture (Primary)



* Design and build workflows using **n8n (preferred)**, Make, or Zapier

* Integrate **Bika.ai** into automation flows for AI-assisted data handling and knowledge workflows

* Connect Dialora AI voice workflows to CRM updates and follow-up sequences

* Ensure web leads, calls, bookings, and outreach flow correctly into pipelines

* Handle API connections, webhooks, JSON parsing, and data mapping between systems



---



### 2. AI Voice, AI Workflow & Communication Integration



* Integrate Dialora with CRM and automation tools

* Configure **Bika.ai** workflows to support internal automation, documentation, or AI-assisted processes

* Ensure AI call data triggers SMS/email follow-ups

* Optimize logic for inbound and outbound communication flows

* Monitor and improve automation reliability across platforms



---



### 3. CRM & Sales Pipeline Engineering



* Design scalable lead ? appointment ? sale pipelines

* Build automated follow-up logic

* Create fail-safes for missed calls, no-shows, and stalled leads

* Maintain clean data structure and stage clarity



---



### 4. Website & Lead Capture Infrastructure



* Optimize WordPress (Elementor) lead capture flows

* Ensure forms connect properly to automation systems

* Support performance when integrating video, plugins, or AI tools



---



### 5. Business Intelligence & Dashboards



* Build a leadership dashboard (CRM-based, Airtable, or Looker Studio)

* Track:



  * Leads generated

  * Calls triggered

  * Appointments booked

  * Conversion rates

  * Revenue metrics

* Provide clear visibility into operational performance



---



## Required Experience & Skills



* Strong experience with **n8n, Make, or Zapier**

* Experience working with AI workflow platforms (Bika.ai or similar tools)

* Comfortable working with APIs, webhooks, JSON, and automation logic

* Experience integrating AI tools or communication platforms

* CRM pipeline design and automation experience

* WordPress/Elementor familiarity

* Systems thinking and architectural mindset

* Clear documentation skills



---



## Work Details



* Full-time (40 hours per week)

* Long-term role

* Must overlap with U.S. Eastern Time for at least 4 hours daily



---



## Compensation



* $1,000 – $1,600 USD per month (based on experience)

* Performance-based increases tied to efficiency improvements and system reliability



---



## This Role Is Ideal For



* Technical builders who enjoy connecting complex tools

* Automation specialists who think in workflows and dependencies

* Operators who want ownership over a company’s technical infrastructure



---



## This Role Is Not For



* Entry-level VAs

* Designers without automation experience

* Candidates uncomfortable with APIs and integration logic

* Short-term freelancers

title: WordPress Developer
description:
About Pesty Marketing

Pesty Marketing is a fast-growing U.S.-based digital marketing agency that builds and maintains high-performing websites for small businesses ($1M–$20M revenue). We currently manage 30+ active WordPress websites (and growing), primarily built with Elementor and Advanced Custom Fields (ACF).



As we continue scaling, we need a reliable, technically strong WordPress Developer who can maintain stability, troubleshoot confidently, and improve sites without breaking what’s already working.

This is a long-term, stable, full-time position — not a short-term freelance gig.



Compensation

- $20,000 USD per year

- Paid bi-monthly (1st and 15th)

- Stable, long-term role

- Performance-based increases over time

- Full-time position (not project-based)



Work Schedule

- Full-time (40 hours per week)

- Must be available during U.S. CST business hours

- Async-friendly team, but you must be responsive during working hours

- Clear tickets and priorities — no chaos or guesswork



What You’ll Be Doing

You will be responsible for maintaining and improving existing WordPress sites.

Most sites use:

- Elementor

- Advanced Custom Fields (ACF)

- Custom themes



Your work will include:

- Maintaining and improving WordPress sites

Building and modifying:

- Custom theme functionality

- ACF-powered templates

- Elementor templates with dynamic content

Debugging and resolving:

- Plugin conflicts

- PHP errors

- Layout or rendering issues

- Implementing marketing updates safely without breaking functionality

- Performing WordPress, theme, and plugin updates

- Troubleshooting issues independently before escalating

- Communicating clearly with a marketing-focused team



Required Skills (Non-Negotiable)

You must be confident in:

- WordPress Core

- Actions & filters (hooks)

- Template hierarchy

- Custom post types & taxonomies



PHP

- Writing and modifying theme-level PHP

- Debugging confidently

- Reading and understanding existing code



Elementor

- Theme Builder

- Dynamic content

- Maintaining complex builds (not just basic pages)



Advanced Custom Fields (ACF)

- Repeaters and flexible content

- Rendering ACF data inside templates

- Connecting ACF with custom post types



Front-End Basics

- HTML

- CSS

- Responsive layouts



What We Are NOT Looking For

This role is not focused on:

- WooCommerce customization

- Headless WordPress

- REST API development

- Multisite networks

- Accessibility compliance leadership



If your experience is mainly installing plugins and using page builders without touching PHP — this role is not a fit.



This Role Is a Good Fit If You:

- Have worked on multiple client WordPress websites

- Are comfortable fixing problems in existing codebases

- Prefer long-term stability over freelance project hopping

- Can take a vague request and translate it into a clean technical solution

- Care about reliability and preventing issues before they happen

- Test your work carefully before marking it complete



This Role Is NOT a Good Fit If You:

- Avoid debugging

- Only use WordPress through plugins

- Need step-by-step instructions for everything

- Prefer short-term freelance gigs

- Expect to only build brand-new sites from scratch



Important: How to Apply

To filter serious applicants, please include the following in your application:

- A short Loom video (2–5 minutes) introducing yourself

- 2–3 WordPress Elementor sites you’ve worked on and are most proud of

- A brief explanation of a difficult WordPress bug you fixed and how you diagnosed it

- Your internet speed (upload/download)

- Your available work hours (confirm PST availability)



Applications without these will not be reviewed.



What to Expect After Applying

If your application meets our requirements, we will send you a short technical review task as the next step.

You will receive a WordPress template file with intentional issues. Your job is to:

- Review the file and identify as many problems, risks, and improvements as you can

- Explain what each issue is and why it matters

- Record a Loom video (5–10 minutes) walking through your findings



This is not a trick or a timed coding test. It's designed to show us how you think, how you read existing code, and how clearly you communicate.



Final Note

We are intentionally hiring for reliability, real WordPress skill, and long-term partnership — not the cheapest option.

If you are looking for stability, consistent pay, and the opportunity to take ownership of real production websites, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Test Engineer
description:
We're seeking a mid-level test engineer to join the Dusk Labs engineering team, focusing on building robust automated testing infrastructure across our portfolio of fintech and cryptography projects. This role is primarily hands-on systems engineering - designing, building, and maintaining the test frameworks and CI/CD integrations that keep our codebases reliable as they grow.



You'll be on a high-performing team with other expert-level developers who are passionate about learning and working on interesting problems.



Responsibilities



- Design and build automated testing infrastructure, including unit, integration, and end-to-end test suites.

- Develop and maintain comprehensive test frameworks across multiple projects spanning fintech and cryptography domains.

- Build monitoring and alerting systems to surface regressions and reliability issues early.

- Create tools and frameworks for continuous validation in CI/CD pipelines.

- Perform test planning and coverage analysis to identify gaps in existing test suites.

- Write and maintain fuzzing harnesses and property-based tests for critical system components.

- Document testing strategies and translate findings into actionable recommendations for the development team.

- Maintain and enhance existing testing tools and infrastructure.



Required Qualifications



- Strong software development fundamentals with 2–4 years of experience.

- Proficiency in Python or Rust

- Comfortable with TypeScript and modern web technologies.

- Strong experience with Linux systems and shell scripting.

- Experience building automated testing infrastructure or CI/CD systems.

- Familiarity with testing methodologies including static analysis, dynamic analysis, fuzzing, and property-based testing.

- Knowledge of network protocol analysis and traffic inspection tools.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.



Preferred Qualifications



- Experience with Rust.

- Background in fintech, payments, or financial systems testing.

- Familiarity with cryptographic concepts and protocol testing.

- Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).

- Experience with cloud infrastructure and infrastructure-as-code.

- Experience with performance testing and benchmarking.

- Open source contributions.



Compensation



- Salary: $3,000 - $4,000 USD per month, including 13th month bonus

- $5,000 discretionary education budget to attend conferences, trainings, and workshops of your choosing. Covers your flight, hotel, per diem, and tickets.

 you'd send 7 days after someone buys our 3-pack cleaning cloth. This tells me more about your skill than any resume.

5. Other information about you that may be relevant.

title: Security Engineer — Research & Test
description:
We're seeking a mid-level security engineer to join the Dusk Labs engineering team, focusing on security research and building robust automated security testing infrastructure across our portfolio of fintech and cryptography projects. This role combines hands-on security analysis with systems engineering, requiring someone who can both identify vulnerabilities and build the tools to continuously validate security posture.



You'll work across a range of systems - from transport layer protocols implementing novel post-quantum cryptography to financial infrastructure handling sensitive transactions - conducting in-depth security research and developing comprehensive automated testing frameworks to support our security-first development process.



You'll be on a high-performing team with other expert-level developers who are passionate about learning and working on interesting problems.



Responsibilities



- Conduct security research and vulnerability analysis across fintech and cryptographic systems.

- Design and build automated security testing infrastructure using Rust and shell scripts.

- Develop and maintain comprehensive security test suites, including fuzzing, penetration testing automation, and cryptographic protocol testing.

- Build monitoring and alerting systems to detect security anomalies and potential attack vectors.

- Perform threat modeling and security assessments of system architecture and code implementations across multiple projects.

- Research and analyze emerging attack techniques, vulnerabilities, and defensive technologies relevant to financial systems and cryptographic protocols.

- Create tools and frameworks for continuous security validation in CI/CD pipelines.

- Document security findings and translate research into actionable recommendations for the development team.

- Maintain and enhance existing security testing tools and infrastructure.



Required Qualifications



- Strong software development fundamentals with 2–4 years of experience.

- Solid experience with Rust or willingness to learn quickly.

- Comfortable with TypeScript and modern web technologies.

- Strong experience with Linux systems and shell scripting.

- Background in security testing methodologies, including static analysis, dynamic analysis, and penetration testing.

- Knowledge of cryptographic concepts and secure coding practices.

- Experience building automated testing infrastructure or CI/CD systems.

- Familiarity with security tools and frameworks (SAST, DAST, fuzzing tools, etc.).

- Knowledge of network protocol analysis and traffic inspection tools.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.



Preferred Qualifications



- Experience with security research or vulnerability discovery.

- Background in cryptographic protocol analysis or implementation.

- Experience auditing DeFi protocols.

- Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).

- Familiarity with reverse engineering tools and binary analysis.

- Experience with compliance frameworks and security standards.

- Background in malware analysis or i
 response.

- Experience with cloud security and infrastructure-as-code.

- Open source contributions to security tools or research projects.



Compensation



- Salary: $4,000 - $5,000 USD per month, including 13th month bonus

- Education Budget: $5,000 discretionary education budget to attend conferences, trainings, and workshops of your choosing. Covers your flight, hotel, per diem, and tickets.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Position Overview



We are seeking a highly detail-oriented Accountant to play a key role in overseeing accounting and financial reporting for our real estate operating entities and investment funds. This role is focused on review, analysis, and financial control—not data entry. You will serve as a critical checkpoint between our external CPA firm and internal stakeholders, ensuring financials are accurate, GAAP-compliant, and aligned with partnership agreements, lender requirements, and investor expectations.



This position is designed as a Controller-track opportunity, offering increasing responsibility, visibility, and ownership over time. While prior real estate accounting experience is helpful, it is not required. Candidates with strong accounting fundamentals will receive in-depth, hands-on training across real estate, partnership, and fund accounting.



Key Responsibilities

Financial Review & CPA Oversight



Review monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements prepared by the external CPA firm for accuracy, consistency, and GAAP compliance



Analyze general ledger activity, reconciliations, and supporting schedules to ensure completeness and appropriate accounting treatment



Validate accounting for development costs, operating expenses, debt structures, and equity transactions



Partner with the CPA firm and internal management to resolve questions, identify issues, and implement corrections



Requisitions & Construction Draws



Review requisition packages and construction draw requests for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with lender and investor requirements



Confirm costs align with approved budgets, contracts, and loan agreements prior to approval



Fund & Partnership Accounting Oversight



Review and confirm accuracy of:



Intercompany transactions and eliminations



Capital calls and distribution calculations



Investor capital account activity



Waterfall models and preferred return calculations



Ensure all transactions are recorded in accordance with governing partnership and joint venture agreements



Tax & Audit Support



Prepare annual tax packages for joint venture entities, including trial balances, equity rollforwards, and supporting workpapers



Coordinate closely with external CPAs to support partnership tax returns and K-1 preparation



Maintain audit-ready documentation and assist with auditor, tax preparer, and investor inquiries



Investor & Lender Reporting



Review investor reporting packages and lender compliance deliverables



Support internal controls, documentation standards, and ongoing compliance efforts



Training & Development



Comprehensive, in-depth training provided for candidates without prior real estate accounting experience



Hands-on mentorship covering real estate and fund accounting concepts, including:



Capital structures and equity mechanics



Intercompany transactions



Investor allocations and reporting



Waterfall and preferred return calculations



Lender compliance and draw processes



Ongoing exposure to increasingly complex transactions as responsibility grows



Preferred Qualifications



Strong accounting fundamentals and experience with financial statement review and analysis



Experience working with or reviewing work prepared by external accountants or fund administrators



Interest in real estate, private equity, or investment fund structures



Advanced Excel skills and strong attention to detail



Growth Opportunity



This is a Controller-track role focused on oversight rather than transactional processing. The candidate will gain deep exposure to real estate fund structures, investor economics, and partnership accounting while progressively taking ownership of the accounting review, control, and governance function.



If you’re looking for a role where judgment matters, learning is accelerated, and responsibility grows with performance, this position offers a clear and compelling path forward.

title: E-commerce Marketing Coordinator (Full-time)
description:
Location: Remote

Department: Marketing / E-commerce

Reports to: Marketing Manager

Schedule: Full CST hours 



Why This Role Exists

This role exists to own day-to-day e-commerce execution so launches, promotions, and PDP updates don’t bottleneck at the Marketing Manager level.

The E-commerce Marketing Associate consolidates Shopify execution, launch coordination, and marketing operations into a single accountable role. As launch volume increases (3–4/month), this role improves speed, accuracy, and execution quality across PDPs, promotions, and site updates.

You’ll act as the execution right-hand to the Marketing Manager — owning backend setup, QA, CRO execution, and cross-functional coordination, while surfacing risks early and keeping work moving forward.



Role Scorecard & Outcomes

E-commerce Execution & Site Ownership

Shopify backend is clean, accurate, and fully maintained. PDPs, collections, promotions, and homepage updates are executed correctly and on time with minimal supervision.

Launch Readiness & QA

All launches are fully set up, QA’d, and executed without last-minute issues or escalations.

Conversion & CRO Support

PDP and site improvements are consistently implemented, contributing to improved CVR, engagement, or UX clarity over baseline.

Inventory Awareness & Readiness

Inventory status is clearly understood from a marketing perspective. OOS risks, restocks, and back-in-stock opportunities are proactively flagged and supported through site updates and campaign readiness.

Operational Reliability

Reporting, inventory visibility, and promo-related site updates are accurate, timely, and dependable.

Cross-Functional Coordination

Designers, copywriters, inventory, and agencies receive clear briefs, timelines, and follow-ups. Work progresses without repeated intervention from the Marketing Manager.



Key Responsibilities

E-commerce & Website Execution

Build and manage PDPs in the Shopify backend (SKUs, variants, pricing, bundles, collections).

Implement PDP copy (from Copywriter) and visual assets (from Designer).

Execute homepage, collection, and promotional site updates.

Maintain site hygiene: broken links, formatting issues, outdated content, and UX friction.

QA the site prior to launches to ensure accuracy, functionality, and readiness.

Integrate SEO content into the website.

Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)

Support CRO initiatives including layout adjustments, upsells, trust elements, and merchandising improvements.

Execute approved A/B tests and experiments; document changes and results.

Product Launch Execution

Coordinate product launches and promotions based on the marketing calendar.

Own backend launch setup end-to-end (products, pricing, promos, collections, inventory sync).

Conduct basic competitor pricing analysis and margin checks when required.

Support post-launch performance summaries and insights.

Marketing Operations

Maintain daily, weekly, and monthly scorecards.

Monitor inventory levels relevant to marketing execution (OOS, low stock, restocks, incoming inventory).

Partner with Inventory and Operations teams to stay aligned on availability, timing, and constraints.

Support back-in-stock, relaunch, and inventory-driven campaigns through site and launch readiness.

Coordinate with internal teams and external agencies to keep timelines on track.

Flag execution risks, blockers, or dependencies early — with proposed solutions.



Ways of Working & Mindset

Ownership mindset: Takes responsibility for outcomes, not just tasks.

Bias toward action: Moves work forward with imperfect information.

Commercially aware: Understands how inventory, timing, and execution impact revenue.

Detail-obsessed but pragmatic: High accuracy without paralysis.

Solution-oriented: Comes with options, not just problems.

Calm under pressure: Handles launch changes without noise.

Right-hand mentality: Thinks one step ahead to reduce load on the Marketing Manager.





Core Competencies

Strong Shopify and e-commerce backend fluency.

High attention to detail and execution accuracy.

CRO and merchandising fundamentals.

Inventory awareness for e-commerce and lifecycle marketing.

Clear written communication and coordination skills.

Comfort working with performance data and reporting.



Candidate Must-Haves

Proven experience executing e-commerce updates in Shopify or similar platforms.

Strong analytical literacy using GA4, Shopify Analytics, and/or heat map tools (Hotjar, Clarity).

Ability to manage multiple execution tasks with speed and accuracy.

Strong problem-solving instincts and independent judgment.

Excellent QA discipline, especially around launches, pricing, promos, and inventory-driven updates.



Nice-to-Haves

Experience in DTC or high-SKU e-commerce environments with frequent launches.

Exposure to CRO frameworks beyond basic A/B testing.

Experience coordinating with paid media, lifecycle, or
 teams.

Familiarity with strength training, home gym equipment, or enthusiast-driven brands.



PLEASE READ CAREFULLY: To apply send your CV/resume with answers to the screening questions below: 

You'll own Shopify execution so launches, promos, and site updates happen fast and correctly — without the Marketing Manager babysitting every detail. That means you'll work with teams here to ensure everything is accurate.



1) Tell me about a Shopify/E-commerce launch (ex. major site update, product launch, promo launch etc.).What was your day-by-day execution plan, who are the teams involved, how do you ensure all teams are on top of things? Please break them down and share situations where you had to step in. 



2) Before launching something high-impact, what is your personal QA checklist? What are 5 things that commonly break that others forget to check?



3) Tell me about a time you had to set something up in a system where accuracy was critical before it went live (e.g., product setup, pricing update, bulk edits, system configuration).

title: Product Buyer – Luxury Resale & Global Auctions
description:
Foreign Objects is the #1 pre-owned luxury seller on TikTok Shop and one of the fastest-growing live shopping brands in the U.S. We sell authenticated designer handbags and accessories from brands like Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Gucci, Prada, Dior, and more.



We source globally from auction houses and wholesale marketplaces throughout Asia, and the U.S. Our sourcing is the foundation of our entire business. 



As a Product Buyer you will be essential in scaling Foreign Objects.



This is not a basic purchasing role. We are looking for product buyers who will scale sales and profit margin. Experienced buyers will receive bonuses and commissions for successful inventory purchases. 



If you are not hard working or willing to put in the extra effort 



You’ll act as:



a deal hunter

a numbers-driven decision maker

a fashion tastemaker

and an operator who treats inventory like capital



If you love spreadsheets as much as style… and negotiating as much as discovering great product… this role is for you. If you think you would be a good fit. Read the job details below and send in a cover letter. 



What You’ll Own



???? Sourcing & Buying



Bid daily on pre-owned luxury auctions (Japan, Asia, U.S., online marketplaces)

Evaluate 100s–1000s of SKUs per week

Identify undervalued inventory and high-velocity products

Build relationships with suppliers and auction partners

Negotiate bulk deals and private buys



???? Analytics & Decision Making



Analyze sell-through rates, margins, and velocity

Forecast pricing + resale value

Track ROI on every buy

Build and maintain buying models in Sheets

Make data-backed purchasing decisions (not “gut feel” alone)



???? Product Judgment



Spot trends before they hit

Understand what sells on live shopping vs traditional resale

Choose the right mix of:

wallets/accessories (high velocity)

mid-tier bags

premium pieces

Maintain brand + style standards



? Operations



Manage purchase orders and shipment tracking

Maintain inventory accuracy

Collaborate with operations + content teams on product drops

Please fill out the form to apply:

title: Patent Legal Assistant
description:
A Legal Assistant (Patent) plays a crucial role in supporting the legal team, particularly in intellectual property (IP) matters, with a focus on patents and occasional involvement in trademark cases. This role involves assisting attorneys and patent agents in various aspects of patent and IP law, including research, documentation, and administrative tasks. The primary responsibilities of a Patent Paralegal include:



Key Responsibilities:

1. Patent Filings: Provide support to external legal counsel in the submission of patent applications in jurisdictions that mandate filings exclusively by attorneys. Prepare, review, and file patent applications with the appropriate patent or intellectual property offices whenever possible. Ensure compliance with filing requirements and deadlines.



2. Patent Prosecution Support: Assist in managing patent prosecution activities, such as tracking deadlines, preparing responses to office actions, and communicating with patent examiners and/or external counsel.



3. Patent Search and Analysis: Conduct patent searches to assist in the evaluation of patentability and patent infringement issues. Summarize and present findings to legal professionals and/or external counsel.



4. Document Management: Organize and maintain intellectual property related documents, including but not related to patent portfolios, external counsel correspondence, and related paperwork. Manage electronic and physical files efficiently.



5. Deadline Compliance: Maintain and update patent docketing systems to ensure accurate tracking of patent deadlines, including maintenance fees and annuities.

6. Communication: Prepare correspondence for external counsel and internal tea
mbers to provide updates, gather information, communicate instructions, and facilitate collaboration on patent and IP matters.



7. Trademark and Copyright Assistance: Provide support in various trademark-related tasks, including conducting trademark searches, preparing trademark applications, and managing trademark maintenance. Additionally, assist with copyright tasks, such as advising on copyright registration, submission of documents and requirements under copyright laws, and aiding in the enforcement of copyright protections.



8. Legal Research: Conduct legal research into matters pertaining to patent and intellectual property law, ensuring continual awareness and understanding of evolving regulatory frameworks, case law, and best practices.



9. Administrative Support: Handle administrative tasks, such as billing, scheduling, and preparing reports and other duties as required by the legal team.



Qualifications:

* A bachelor's degree in a related field is often preferred.

* Paralegal certification that allows them to prepare and/or prosecute patent applications.

* Experience in Patent and IP law.

* Proficiency in legal research, patent databases, and document management software.

* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with legal professionals and clients.

* Knowledge of patent prosecution procedures and USPTO rules and regulations.

* Familiarity with intellectual property law in multiple jurisdictions (a plus, but not always required).

title: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
description:
As the DPO, you will be responsible for ensuring our company’s compliance with data protection regulations, implementing robust data protection policies and procedures, and safeguarding the privacy and protection of the data of our employees, customers, and stakeholders.

This is a critical role that requires a deep understanding of data privacy laws, excellent communication skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively across various departments.



 Responsibilities:



1. Data Protection and Privacy Policies:



• Develop, implement, and maintain data protection policies and controls to ensure regulatory compliance.

• Conduct audits to monitor compliance and collaborate with legal teams to address data protection issues.

• Ensure compliance for third-party vendors and update policies as necessary.



2. Privacy Impact Assessments and Data Mapping:



• Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for new projects and perform data mapping to identify privacy risks.

• Develop and implement mitigation strategies and regularly update DPIAs and data mapping exercises.

• Monitor emerging technologies for privacy impacts.



3. Data Subject Rights and Consent Management:



• Manage processes for data subject requests (e.g., access, erasure) and obtain and manage consent for data processing.

• Ensure compliance with consent requirements and periodically review processes.



4. Training and Awareness:



• Provide regular training on data protection and regulatory requirements.

• Develop specialized training for high-risk data processing and integrate data protection into onboarding.



5. Security I
 Management and Breach Response:



• Develop and maintain an i
 response plan and coordinate with teams to manage breaches.

• Conduct post-i
 reviews and implement prevention measures.



6. Vendor Management:



• Implement a vendor management program to assess and monitor data protection practices.

• Review and negotiate data processing agreements and conduct regular compliance audits.



7. Regulatory Compliance and Reporting:



• Maintain an inventory of data protection laws and serve as the contact for regulatory authorities.

• Prepare reports on data protection activities and i
.



8. Privacy by Design and Data Governance:



• Integrate privacy by design principles into product development and implement data governance frameworks.

• Monitor and recommend improvements for data governance compliance.



9. General Recommendation:



• Recommend strategies to management for enhancing overall data protection practices, addressing compliance gaps, and improving privacy and security measures across the organization.



Qualifications and Skills:



• Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in computer science or related field such as information security, data protection, law, or a related discipline.

• Proficiency with software for preparing reports and presentations

• Proven experience as a Data Protection Officer or in a similar role, preferably in a technology or data-driven organization.

• In-depth knowledge of global data protection laws and regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other regional frameworks.

• Familiarity with privacy-by-design principles and practical implementation strategies.

• Strong understanding of data security, encryption, anonymization techniques, and data lifecycle management.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess and manage privacy risks effectively.

• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.

• Professional certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) or Certified Data Protection Officer (CDPO) are highly desirable.

• Knowledge of emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cloud computing, and their implications for data protection is a plus.



Data Protection Officer and play a vital role in ensuring the privacy and security of sensitive data while driving compliance with global data protection regulations.

Apply your expertise in data privacy and make a meaningful impact on our company’s commitment to protecting data and maintaining the trust of our employees, customers and partners.

title: Community & Lead Generation Manager (Organic Growth – Finance & Insurance Focus)
description:
IMPORTANT – READ FIRST

To apply, start your application with the phrase:

“Conversations create revenue.”

Applications without this phrase will not be reviewed.



About the Role



We are building a demand-generation engine within the financial services and insurance space and are looking for a Community & Lead Generation Manager to own organic audience growth and direct prospect engagement.



Our target audiences include:



Homeowners



Families seeking financial protection



Small business owners



Entrepreneurs and executives



This role is focused on one thing:



Starting conversations that turn into qualified leads.



You will research our market, participate in online communities, build relationships, and convert engagement into real opportunities related to life insurance, financial protection, and business continuity solutions.



This is not a passive social media role.

This is a proactive relationship-building position.



What You Will Own

1. Organic Prospecting & Relationship Building



Engage daily in relevant
 groups, LinkedIn, and niche communities



Identify and connect with homeowners, business owners, and professionals



Start direct conversations with aligned prospects



Maintain prospect tracking and follow-up systems



Nurture warm leads into the sales pipeline



2. Market Research & Insight Gathering



Identify common financial concerns, objections, and questions



Report recurring themes from conversations



Suggest messaging and offer improvements



Identify untapped audience segments or partnership opportunities



3. Content That Supports Conversations



Create short-form posts that spark engagement and discussion



Repurpose insights from real conversations into content



Ensure all content drives toward interaction and relationship-building



Align messaging with financial protection, insurance, and long-term planning themes



4. Weekly Performance Metrics



You will maintain a simple scorecard tracking:



Conversations started



Meaningful interactions



Qualified leads generated



Follow-up activity



Target: 10–15 qualified leads per month after ramp-up period.



Required Experience



Experience with organic lead generation or outbound prospecting



Comfortable initiating conversations with strangers online



Strong written English and conversational tone



Ability to think independently and prioritize high-impact work



Experience using Google Sheets or CRM tools for tracking



Understanding of professional communication (finance/business audiences preferred)



Work Details



Full-time (40 hours per week)



Long-term position



Must overlap with U.S. Eastern Time for at least 4 hours daily



Compensation



$800 – $1,200 USD per month



Performance-based bonuses tied to lead generation milestones



Long-term growth opportunity



This Role Is Ideal For



Someone who enjoys real conversations



A marketer who understands human psychology



An operator who prefers ownership over micromanagement



A professional comfortable engaging business owners and decision-makers



This Role Is Not For



Passive social media schedulers



People uncomfortable with outreach



Anyone who avoids direct interaction



Candidates looking for short-term freelance work

title: Lead Generation Specialist
description:
We’re Hiring at BOUNDLESS COLLECTIVE!



Who We Are

Boundless Collective is a dynamic, experienced outsourcing powerhouse specializing in delivering creative, admin-backed solutions across industries. We’re not just assistants, we’re innovators, growth enablers, and trusted partners in our clients’ success.



Why You’ll Love It Here

- A high-energy team culture that blends professionalism with camaraderie, where collaboration and creativity are daily drivers.

- Fun-focused atmosphere: from team outings and social events to celebrating milestones big and small, work here feels like more than just work.

- Meaningful recognition: enjoy structured bonuses and reward programs that celebrate your contributions and let you know they’re appreciated.

- Growth-first mindset: as part of our team, you’ll innovate, share ideas, and help shape the future of client solutions every single day.



We’re expanding, and we’re looking for talented individuals to be part of our dynamic team! If you're looking for a fulfilling, impactful role, read on to see how you can contribute and grow with us!



We are hiring for the following positions:



Lead Generation Specialist



What We Offer:

Position: Full-time

Work Setup: Permanent remote – work from anywhere in the world!

Shift: 6 AM - 3 PM (MNL time) – Start your day with energy!

Equipment: Self-provided – Bring your tech, and we’ll bring the opportunity!

Salary:  PHP 30,000 - PHP 35,000 depending on experience. + bonuses



Apply via this link: 
/
RESPONSIBILITIES:



1. Lead Generation, Sales Support & Outreach

- Identify and research potential leads (businesses, decision-makers, partners) aligned with target industries and service offerings.

- Build, segment, and maintain lead lists with accurate details (name, role, company,
/LinkedIn, notes).

- Support outbound outreach via LinkedIn and
 (draft messages, follow-ups, and sequences for Director review/approval).

- Monitor inbound enquiries (DMs,
, website/contact forms), respond where appropriate, and triage to the Director/COO/CRO.

- Track lead status, next steps, and follow-up schedules in CRM and internal trackers to maintain pipeline 
ntum.

- Support event-based lead generation, including attendee lists, outreach before/after events, and structured follow-up coordination.

- Collect and summarise outreach insights (response rates, objections, FAQs) to improve messaging and targeting.

- Proactively engage online with the target market (following/liking/commenting strategically) to increase page visits and lead flow.



2. Marketing, Content & Online Presence

- Upload content and ensure formatting, links, and assets are correct across channels.

- Create and adapt marketing assets using Canva and AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT) as needed.

- Create graphics and complete light video editing for social media and marketing campaigns.

- Create worksheets and branded documents as required (lead magnets, client resources, event handouts).

- Manage social media comments/messages and engage with prospective clients to encourage event attendance and lead magnet downloads.

- Support
 newsletter/campaign coordination and formatting/uploading content (e.g., Gamma).

- Manage paid ads administration and provide strategic feedback on ad performance and spend.

- Complete basic website updates and improvements (e.g., Showit) to enhance layout, aesthetic, and user experience (no coding required). 



3. Online Events, Logistics & Follow-Up

- Coordinate and manage online event logistics end-to-end (set-up, registrations, reminders, attendee comms, links, materials).

- Handle lead and attendee follow-ups before and after events to drive conversions and nurture relationships.

- Ensure all links, registrations, and lead magnets are tested and functioning correctly prior to launch and event delivery.



4. Executive, COO & CRO Administrative Support

- Provide administrative support to the COO and CRO, and executive support to the Director as required.

- Manage and organise inboxes (including multiple inboxes if needed), ensuring timely replies, follow-ups, and priority flagging.

- Draft
s and communications for review prior to sending.

- Prepare correspondence, meeting notes, summaries, and supporting documents.

- Assist with data entry, document preparation, file organisation, and maintaining clear systems and workflows.

- Maintain internal trackers (handover/task master sheets) to monitor tasks, contacts, and delivery progress.



5. Scheduling & Calendar Management

- Book and manage meetings, calls, reminders, and reschedules.

- Coordinate across time zones and multiple stakeholders as needed.



6. CRM, Client Onboarding & Systems

- Keep CRM records and files updated and accurate, maintaining strong pipeline hygiene.

- Manage client onboarding and workflow updates in SuiteDash, ensuring all documents, tasks, and records are correctly set up.

- Produce basic CRM reports when required.

- Build and maintain a bank of SOPs (standard operating procedures), ensuring documentation is current and easy to follow.



QUALIFICATIONS:

- 2–3 years of experience supporting marketing and operations through lead generation activities.

- Proven track record in lead generation and pipeline support, with strong capability in maintaining clean, accurate, and current lead data in a CRM.

- Experience using SuiteDash or equivalent tools to support client onboarding, documentation, and ongoing workflow coordination.

- Strong written and verbal communication; professional, friendly, and trustworthy.

- Highly organised, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities independently.

- Proficiency with Canva/AI tools and Google/Microsoft suites; comfortable learning new systems quickly.

- Experience with event coordination and CRM tools is highly regarded.



At Boundless Collective, we take pride in fostering a culture of confidence, reliability, and a relentless commitment to excellence. If you are ready to support a dynamic executive team and grow in a supportive environment, we’d love to hear from you.



Ready to make an impact and elevate your career? Apply via link below and let's create something extraordinary together!



APPLY HERE:

Manage communication

Support clients
