title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer (Node.js / Automation)
description:
Senior Full-Stack Engineer (Node.js / Automation)



The Role:

We are a VC-funded AI sales platform working with pilot clients to validate and scale our product. We are hiring 3 Senior Engineers for a 3-month contract with the opportunity to convert to a full-time salaried role. During this period, we offer flexible work commitment options to ensure the right fit.



You will own the core product infrastructure. You will architect and build the engines that drive our main products: a LinkedIn automation bot and a real-time AI voice calling system (Linked).



This is a comprehensive ownership role. You will not just be writing backend workers; you will be building the full feature set—from the React UI where users configure campaigns, to the backend engines that execute them. You will be the technical owner of our automation logic, security posture, and infrastructure.



The Engineering Challenge

Our platform is currently a large Node.js application. Your mission is to evolve this into a scalable system while shipping critical features. You will need to decouple heavy background workers (browser automation, audio processing) from the main API server without breaking the user experience.



Key Responsibilities

LinkedIn Automation Engine: We have the scheduling logic, but we need the execution layer. You will architect a robust worker system using Puppeteer/Playwright that manages headless browsers, handles session persistence, rotates proxies, and mimics human behavior to prevent account bans.



Voice AI Infrastructure: Maintain and optimize our WebSocket bridge between Twilio and ElevenLabs. You will debug race conditions, improve call outcome detection (distinguishing voi
s from gatekeepers), and ensure real-time latency remains low.



Campaign Orchestration &
: Maintain the complex logic that weaves calls,
s, and LinkedIn actions into sequences. This includes managing
 OAuth integrations (Gmail/Outlook), token refreshing, and deliverability logic.



Security & Compliance: Own the application security posture. Implement CSRF protection, secure webhook handling, and lead the technical side of security audits (specifically Google CASA verification).



Full-Stack Implementation: You are not just a backend dev. When you build a new automation feature, you will also build the React components and settings pages that allow customers to use it.



The Stack

Backend: Node.js (TypeScript), Express

Frontend: React, Tailwind

Data: PostgreSQL (Supabase), Redis

Automation: Puppeteer / Playwright, BullMQ

Voice: Twilio Media Streams, ElevenLabs WebSocket API



Who We Are Looking For

Systems-Focused: You understand the difference between writing an endpoint and building a distributed system. You know how to manage memory leaks in long-running processes.



Automation Experience: You have built scrapers, bots, or testing frameworks in production. You understand rate limiting, fingerprinting, and anti-detection strategies.



Security Mindset: You write secure code by default. You are comfortable handling OAuth 2.0 flows, session management, and sensitive customer data.



Product-Capable: You can touch the frontend. You don't need to be a designer, but you must be able to wire up the UI for the complex backend features you build.



AI Native Tooling: You are proficient and efficient using AI coding tools like Cursor, Claude Code, or GitHub Copilot to accelerate development. You view these as essential tools for velocity, not shortcuts for understanding.



LLM Interest: While we currently use APIs, we have a roadmap to experiment with self-hosted 7B+ parameter models. You are interested in eventually moving down the stack to optimize inference and deploy open-source models for real-time voice.



How to Apply

Please share your CV and a portfolio of relevant work (GitHub links, technical write-ups, or case studies). Please specifically mention your experience with browser automation and background queues.

description:
The Cold Calling & Outreach Specialist is responsible for making outbound calls, following up with leads, confirming interviews, and maintaining warm communication with candidates and potential clients. This role requires strong, confident spoken English and ideally bilingual fluency in both Spanish and English to support diverse client communication.



The ideal candidate for this role is energetic, articulate, reliable, and capable of making a great first impression in every call or message.

Key Responsibilities

• • Make 50–100 outbound calls per day to candidates or client leads using the company’s CRM and call platforms.

• • Confirm interviews, send reminders, and reloop no-shows using scripts provided.

• • Manage and update call logs, lead trackers, and CRM records in real time.

• • Collaborate with the recruitment and operations team to ensure seamless handoffs.

Ideal Candidate

• • Goal-oriented and motivated by performance metrics

• • Adaptable and clear in communication

• • Has prior experience in bilingual call center or recruitment support roles.

• • Understands U.S. business etiquette and communication tone.

• • Thrives in structured systems but works well independently.

• • Brings energy, initiative, and a “no excuses, just solutions” attitude.



Requirements

• • Strong, confident verbal English skills — clear pronunciation and natural conversational flow.

• • Bilingual proficiency (Spanish + English) preferred.

• • Prior experience in cold calling, customer service, or telemarketing (U.S. clients preferred).

• • Comfortable using RingCentral, Zoom, Google Workspace, and basic CRM tools.

• •Excellent listening and note-taking skills.

• •Ability to stay calm under pressure and think quickly during calls.

• •Professional, positive attitude with strong emotional intelligence.

• •Excellent listening and note-taking skills.

• •Ability to stay calm under pressure and think quickly during calls.

• •Professional, positive attitude with strong emotional intelligence.



Performance Expectations

• • Demonstrate consistent communication and proactive follow-ups.

• •Submit daily call reports and weekly outreach summaries.

• • Maintain a friendly yet persuasive tone that reflects the brand’s professionalism.

title: Senior Local SEO Specialist
description:
Senior SEO Specialist – Full-Time + Remote



$1,300-1,800/month base + $100-$500/month performance bonus



About Us



We're a fast-growing SEO agency helping local service businesses dominate search results. Our team is small, sharp, and results-driven. We value clear communication and extreme ownership. We stay ahead of our industry with heavy investment in AI systems. We're US-based, serving US clients exclusively.



About the Role



We're hiring a full-time contract SEO specialist (4–5+ years of experience) to own 6-12 local SEO client campaigns end to end. You'll manage strategy (alongside the team lead), execution, reporting, and client deliverables - with autonomy over how you manage your time and make decisions.



This isn't just a task-completion role. Our clients are real business owners whose livelihoods depend on results. We need someone who feels the weight of that and operates accordingly: flagging issues early, bringing solutions, and keeping campaigns moving forward without being asked. You'll earn performance bonuses tied directly to problem solving and client retention.



What You'll Do



- Manage the full SEO lifecycle for 6–12 clients

- Run comprehensive audits: technical, local, content, backlink, etc

- Conduct keyword research and execute on-page, technical, local, and content SEO strategies

- Optimize Google Business Profiles

- Configure and manage GA4, GSC, and GTM

- Track performance, send weekly internal updates, and build monthly client reports

- Use AI tools to streamline workflows, solve problems independently, and contribute to internal automation projects



Required Qualifications



- 4-5+ years managing local SEO campaigns with proven results

- Experience managing multiple client accounts simultaneously

- Strong knowledge of local SEO (Map Pack, GBP optimization) and organic SEO

- Comfortable with basic HTML/CSS and writing technical SEO guidelines

- Hands-on experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) for research, content, troubleshooting, and/or automation

- Familiarity with core SEO tools: GA4, GSC, GTM, Ahrefs or SEMrush, Screaming Frog, and local SEO tools (Local Dominator, Local Falcon, or similar)

- Native English proficiency

- Reliable high-speed internet



Who You Are



- Accountable - You see tasks through and own the outcome, good or bad

- Self-managed - You deliver quality work consistently without needing oversight

- Proactive - You surface updates, flag risks, and solve problems before they escalate

- Results-focused - You care about what the work produces, not just checking boxes

- AI-forward - You already use AI in your daily work and are excited to push further

- Collaborative - You share knowledge openly, take feedback well, and leave ego at the door



What We Offer



- Compensation: $1,300–$1,800/month USD base (based on experience) + $100-$500/month performance bonuses tied to campaign health and client retention

- Employment type: Full-time independent contractor

- Schedule: CST business hours

- Location: 100% remote

- Growth: Clear path to Senior Lead or Team Manager as we scale

- Learning: Paid access to training resources and industry consultants



How to Apply



Submit the following to 



- Resume

- 2-3 case studies with specific metrics (map rankings, organic traffic, leads generated, etc.)

- A 2 minute video (YouTube, Loom, or similar) answering:

---> What's your name?

---> What motivates you in your life? (Be honest)

---> What's the coolest result you've driven with SEO?

---> Why are you a good fit for this role?



Do NOT just read off of AI please.



No video = automatic pass. We use this to assess communication skills and personality fit — keep it casual.

description:
We’re looking for a Social Media Editor who gets the internet. You’ll be creating and editing short-form videos and visuals designed to go viral — not just exist. If you’re chronically online, obsessed with trends, and know why content blows up, this role was made for you.

What You’ll Be Doing:

You’ll be editing and creating content that’s meant to perform, not just look pretty.



*Editing viral-style short-form videos (Reels, TikToks, Shorts)

*Creating eye-catching visual content and photos for social media

*Turning ideas, trends, and raw footage into scroll-stopping posts

*Keeping up with trending audios, formats, 
s, and Gen Z humor

*Writing captions that sound real, not robotic

*Collaborating with a creative team that actually listens to your ideas

*Helping social media pages grow through smart, trend-driven content

*You’ll get training, clear direction, and the freedom to bring your own creative flavor.



What We’re Looking For:

We’re not hunting for “years of experience.” We’re looking for taste, instinct, and passion. That looks like:



*A genuine love for social media and content creation

*Strong understanding of trends, viral formats, and internet culture

*High-level English communication skills

*A good eye for visuals, pacing, and aesthetics

*Confidence, curiosity, and positive energy

*Willingness to learn, test ideas, and improve fast

* Having a personal brand or active social media account is a plus, not a requirement.



How to Apply?



Send us:

*A short video introduction (1–2 minutes) showing your personality, creativity, and why you’re a great fit. NO INTRO VIDEO AUTO FAIL

*Link to your creative portfolio

* Add the word 'Awesome' to your application so we know you've read everything

title: Social Media Content Creator
description:
This Role Is For You If You’re:



- Chronically online (and proud of it)

- Always scrolling, saving, reposting, analyzing

- The friend who just knows why a post went viral

- Fluent in English and confident expressing ideas

- Creative, enthusiastic, and full of good energy

- Lowkey building (or dreaming of building) your own online brand



If social media feels less like “work” and more like second nature, then this is for you! 



What You’ll Be Doing:



You’ll help create, shape, and manage content that’s meant to perform, not just exist.



Your day-to-day includes:

- Creating short-form videos and trendy visual content

- Brainstorming ideas based on what’s viral, aesthetic, and engaging

- Writing captions that sound human (not corporate)

- Staying on top of trends, audios, formats, and Gen Z humor

- Helping grow social media pages through smart, creative content

- Collaborating with a creative team that actually values your ideas



You’ll be trained, supported, and encouraged to bring your own creative voice.





What We’re Looking For:



We’re not obsessed with years of experience. We care more about:



- Genuine love for social media + content creation

- Strong understanding of Gen Z trends and internet culture

- High-level English communication skills

- A good eye for aesthetics and visuals

- Confidence, enthusiasm, and positive energy

- Willingness to learn, experiment, and grow

- Having a personal brand or active social media presence is a bonus, not a requirement.





Why You’ll Love This Role:



- 100% remote (work from anywhere)

- No micromanaging

- Paid training + continuous feedback

- A creative, supportive, non-toxic team

- Opportunities to grow into higher-level creative or strategy roles

- You get paid to do what you already love





How to Apply:



- Send us a short video introduction (1–2 minutes) showing your personality, creativity, and why you’d be a great fit

- Links to your creative portfolio ot any content you’ve created (personal or professional)

- Link to your resume/CV

This role is for someone who shows up with personality, creativity, and confidence.

We can’t wait to see what you bring!

title: E-commerce Digital Marketing Specialist (Shopify, Klaviyo, SEO, CRO)
description:
# E-commerce Marketing Specialist

## Joycoast | Full-Time | $900/month



---



## ???? About Joycoast



Joycoast is a Chicago-based sustainable lifestyle brand creating premium wooden watches, sunglasses, and accessories. **Every product plants 10 trees.** We've been growing consistently for 8 years, recently opened our first retail store in Lincoln Park, and sell direct-to-consumer through Shopify plus corporate gifting for companies.



We're looking for a skilled e-commerce marketer to own our digital presence and drive revenue growth.



---



## ???? What You'll Do



**?? Important:** This is NOT a task-based role. We need a strategic thinker who can identify opportunities, develop marketing strategies, and execute them independently. You'll own the entire e-commerce marketing function and drive growth initiatives.



###
 & SMS Marketing (35%)

- Build, design, and optimize **Klaviyo
 campaigns and automated flows**

- Manage **SMS marketing strategy** (segmentation, campaigns, performance)

- A/B test subject lines, content, send times, and audience segments

- Report on
/SMS revenue and continuously optimize performance



### Shopify & Website Optimization (30%)

- **Create and edit high-converting landing pages** using Shopify theme blocks/sections

- **Optimize product pages** for conversion, SEO, and brand consistency

- **On-page SEO optimization** (meta titles, descriptions, alt tags, URL structure, internal linking)

- Improve site UX, navigation, and overall conversion rate

- Update collections, banners, and promotional content



### Content & Copywriting (20%)

- Write compelling copy for
s, landing pages, product listings, and ads

- **Publish blog articles** (1-2 per month) about sustainability, gifting, and product stories

- Optimize all website copy for SEO and conversions

- Maintain consistent brand voice across all channels



### Analytics & Paid Ads (15%)

- Track performance metrics 
 revenue, conversion rates, traffic, AOV)

- Run A/B tests and make data-driven recommendations

- **Manage Meta and Google Ads** (if experienced - bonus but not required)

- Coordinate with creative team for assets when needed



---



## ? Requirements



**Must-Haves:**

- **3+ years e-commerce marketing experience** (Shopify stores)

- **Strategic marketing mindset** - ability to develop and execute growth strategies, not just complete tasks

- **Expert Klaviyo knowledge** (flows, segments, campaigns, deliverability)

- **SMS marketing experience** (Postscript, Attentive, or similar)

- **Proven Shopify experience** (landing pages, product pages, theme customization)

- **Strong SEO knowledge** (on-page optimization, keyword research, meta data)

- **Excellent English copywriting** 
s, blogs, product descriptions, ads)

- **Data-driven mindset** (Google Analytics, Shopify reports, conversion tracking)

- **Portfolio with real results** (metrics, screenshots, case studies required)



**Nice-to-Haves:**

- Google Ads and Meta Ads experience

- Graphic design skills (Canva, basic photo editing)

- Experience with sustainable/DTC brands

- Familiarity with B2B or corporate gifting marketing



---



## ????? Tools You'll Use



- **Klaviyo** 
/SMS)

- **Shopify** (website/landing pages)

- **Google Analytics** (traffic/conversion tracking)

- **Canva** (design)

- Google Ads & Meta Ads (if experienced)



---



## ???? Who You Are



- **Strategic thinker AND executor** - You don't just follow tasks; you develop strategies and execute them

- **Action-oriented and organized** - You own projects end-to-end

- **Strategic but execution-focused** - You think big but move fast

- **Performance obsessed** - You live in the data and constantly optimize

- **Self-starter** - You don't need hand-holding; you identify problems and fix them

- **Proactive problem-solver** - You see opportunities before they're pointed out

- **Excellent communicator** - You can write copy that converts and collaborate effectively

- **Mission-aligned** - You care about sustainability and want to make an impact



---



## ???? Compensation & Benefits



**Salary:** $850 USD/month  

**Hours:** Full-time (40 hours/week)



**Why Join:**

- Work with a mission-driven brand (10 trees planted per product)

- Direct access to founder (fast decisions, no bureaucracy)

- Significant autonomy and creative freedom

- Fully remote with flexible schedule

- Opportunity to grow as the company scales



---



## ???? How to Apply



Include:

1. **Your resume/CV**

2. **Portfolio showing any of the following:

   -
 campaigns you've created (screenshots + metrics)

   - Klaviyo flows you've built (screenshots with results)

   - Shopify stores/pages you've worked on (before/after)

   -
/SMS revenue impact (open rates, click rates, attribution)

   - SEO improvements you've made (traffic/ranking increases)

   - Any paid ads results (if applicable)



--



## ?? Only Apply If:



? You have proven e-commerce marketing experience with real results  

? You're expert-level with Klaviyo and Shopify  

? You have a portfolio that shows conversion-focused work  

? You can work independently and own the entire marketing function  

? **You're a strategic thinker, not just a task executor** - you develop strategies and identify growth opportunities  

? You're passionate about sustainability and mission-driven brands  



? Don't apply if you're a generalist VA looking to "learn" e-commerce  

? Don't apply if you can't provide examples of previous work with metrics  

? Don't apply if you need to be told what to do every day - this requires strategic thinking and initiative  



---

**Type:** Full-Time Contract  

**Industry:** E-commerce | Sustainable Products | Corporate Gifting



---



*We are an equal opportunity employer. We've planted over 165,000 trees and are on a mission to plant 1 million in the next two years. Join us in growing something beautiful.* ????

title: Compliance and Documentation Coordinator
description:
Overview

The Compliance and Documentation Coordinator is responsible for organizing, maintaining, and standardizing the company’s digital documentation across all departments. This role ensures that files, records, and reference materials are properly structured, easily accessible, and consistently updated — supporting smooth collaboration and operational efficiency across the organization.



Key Responsibilities

 Develop and maintain a centralized digital filing system for all departments (e.g., HR, Finance, Operations, Marketing).

 Ensure consistency in file naming, structure, and version control across shared drives and platforms.

 Regularly audit folders and files to remove duplicates, outdated content, and ensure accuracy.

 Coordinate with department heads to collect, organize, and update key documents, SOPs, and reports.

 Support documentation of workflows, processes, and company templates for operational use.

 Manage access permissions and data organization within platforms such as Google Drive, Notion, or SharePoint.

 Maintain logs and summaries of documentation updates and communicate changes to relevant teams.

 Provide guidance to tea
mbers on proper file management practices and document handling.



Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or related field (preferred but not required).

 Proven experience in digital file management, documentation, or operations coordination.

 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

 Familiarity with cloud storage platforms (e.g., Google Workspace, SharePoint, Dropbox).

 Excellent communication and coordination skills.

 Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a digital, fast-paced environment.



Preferred Skills

 Experience creating or maintaining SOPs and documentation templates. 

 Knowledge of data privacy and file access protocols.

 Basic understanding of project management or workflow tools



Success Indicators

 Company files are well-organized, easily searchable, and consistently formatted.

 Documentation updates are completed on time and communicated clearly.

 Teams can locate and use resources efficiently with minimal duplication or confusion.

Guest communication (pre-arrival through post-checkout)



Vendor coordination (cleaners, maintenance, supplies)

Bookkeeping (QuickBooks or similar)



Expense tracking



Reconciliations



Monthly financial reporting



Digital file management

Organize invoices, receipts, contracts, property documents, and SOPs



Create and enforce clear naming conventions and folder structures



Administrative systems



Build and follow checklists



Document workflows and SOPs



Keep records current, accurate, and audit-ready

Light social media support (posting pre-approved content)



Assist with basic property or brand updates as needed



No content creation required unless already skilled



Who We’re Looking For



Proven short-term rental experience (Airbnb/VRBO required)



Strong bookkeeping skills with high attention to detail



Exceptionally organized and systems-driven



Able to work independently with minimal oversight



Proactive problem-solver — you see issues and resolve them



Excellent written English



Comfortable with US Eastern Time overlap



Seeking a long-term, stable role



What We Offer



$7–$10/hour depending on experience



Long-term position with growth opportunities



Clear expectations and systems



Trust and autonomy — no micromanagement



Competitive pay for a high-caliber professional



Screening Question (Required)



You are given a Google Drive with 500+ unorganized files (invoices, receipts, contracts, and STR documents) and no existing structure.

Please include:



Folder structure



Naming conventions



How you would prevent it from becoming disorganized again



Applications that do not answer this question in detail will not be considered.



Reply to this job post state Eastern hours 11-5 to verify you can work

title: Senior Cloud Accountant (Direct Hire / Work from Home)
description:
Join the Team as a Cloud Accountant at Bean Ninjas USA!

Philippine CPA license highly preferred.



Bean Ninjas USA is on the lookout for enthusiastic and skilled professionals to become part of our expanding team. If you're passionate about cloud accounting and meet the qualifications listed below, we’d love to connect with you!



Position: PH Cloud Accountant

Company: Bean Ninjas USA



Filipino candidate must possess the following (Please do not apply if you do not have the following):



~ 3+ years of full-time accounting experience within a BPO or similar environment.

- end-to-end bookkeeping experience including preparation of Balance Sheet and Income Statement

~ Proficient in cloud accounting software and platforms.

~ Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.

~ Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

~ Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field (preferred)

- Has Xero and/or QuickBooks Online experience



Qualifications for the role:



- Full-time work (Mon-Fri) for our US clients within the Philippines working hours of 8 am to 5 pm.

- We also offer flexibility on the schedule at work once you are familiar with the processes and client work.

- Excellent attention to detail and time management skills.

- Team player who would get along well with the rest of the Bean Ninjas team



Specific Responsibilities



In this role, you will look after management reporting and weekly/monthly transaction processing for a portfolio of Bean Ninjas bookkeeping clients.



Bookkeeping Service Delivery



-Uses Xero and QuickBooks Online

-Uses Xero and QBO add-ons and integrations like Hubdoc, A2X, Receipt Bank, Stripe, and Paypal.

-Responds to client queries via our online
 helpdesk software Helpscout.

-Communicates with other staff via Slack.

-You write well: concise, understandable, helpful, professional, and fast. You can build rapport with others solely through your writing.



Remote work

-You’re self-motivated and ideally, have previous experience working remotely and with little direct supervision.

-You must have an excellent internet connection.

-You know how to keep your computer and work secure and private.

-You know the joys of using two monitors (or splitting a big monitor) to do bookkeeping work.



Who are we?

Bean Ninjas is a bookkeeping and financial reporting business founded on Australia’s Gold Coast in 2015.



We specialize in eCommerce businesses and our mission is to create financial freedom through stress-free business finances for our clients.



We have over 16 Philippine tea
mbers here and we are growing!



What’s it like being part of the Bean Ninjas team?



Career development

We believe in developing our team and promoting internally. You will go through an initial 6-month training program and will then receive ongoing training and mentoring. We prepare individual staff development plans for each tea
mber.



Flexible and remote role

This is a remote role and you will have some level of flexibility in choosing your regular work hours, but must generally be online during Philippine working hours.



Benefits

We offer a variety of benefits from 13th-month pay, birthday vouchers, birthday time off, accrued leaves, and Christmas shutdown leave (where everyone does not need to log in to work for a couple of days during the Christmas shutdown which is usually 5 to 7 working days, yet these days are still paid for by the company!), 6-week maternity leave, remote social activities, and pieces of training and up to date certifications for our accountants on various accounting platforms or integrations.



Bean Ninjas is recognized as an industry leader. You will be working alongside Chartered Accountants and CPAs who have come from firms such as Ernst and Young, BDO, and Grant Thornton.



We won the Xero Australia Bookkeeping Partner of the Year Award in 2019 and the equivalent state award for Queensland in both 2017 and 2019.



Applications can be sent to 
 and include a copy of your resume. Please do not apply if you have no relevant experience or are only looking for a project-based role. Thank you!

title: call alberta dayhomes
description:
You MUST provide voice message if you submit resume...no voice message no consideration.

You start 1 month probation of 20 hrs/wk then after hired it is full time 30 hr/wk

You will not have to perform overtime..unecessary.

You must call during Alberta hours.

You earn $3usd for probation one month, then $5usd when hired plus bonuses when houses register with the Agency

You receive per house or new dayhome registered of $40-50usd.

You must call dayhomes to inform them of JDM Dayhome Agency.

You must find anyone who wants to open new dayhome.

You must have great speaking voice. Calm, happy, Never rude,

You cannot say these: ummm, ahhh,, you know,,,but ya...and ahh 

You can never use americanisms...speak words not sounds.

You must use laptop or home computer.

You must use Voip for all calls withCanadian number based in Alberta.

You must create excel records for all interactions and dayhome contact details or forward Agency
 if they resist.

You will receive compensation for Voip creation.

title: Sales Executive (Closer)
description:
Overview



We are looking for a highly fluent English speaker based in the Philippines to work remotely with clients and prospects in the United States. This role involves daily conversations with native English speakers, so strong spoken English and real conversational ability are essential.



This is not a scripted role. You must be able to listen carefully, understand context, respond naturally, and hold a smooth back-and-forth conversation with US-based prospects.



If you are confident speaking English, enjoy conversations, and can communicate clearly and professionally, this role may be a strong fit.



Responsibilities



Speak directly with clients and prospects in the United States



Hold natural, unscripted conversations



Listen actively and respond clearly and confidently



Represent the company in a professional and friendly manner



Requirements



Fluent, natural spoken English (near-native or native-level)



Strong conversational and listening skills



Comfortable speaking with people in the USA



Ability to think on your feet and communicate clearly



Reliable internet connection



Quiet, professional work-from-home environment



Professional, friendly, and confident communication style



Schedule & Pay



Remote / work from home



4–5 hours per day



Hourly pay plus commissions



Part-time role with consistent daily work



How to Apply (Important)



To apply, you must submit a short voice recording:



Go to 



Speak naturally and conversationally in English



Share the Vocaroo link with your application



Applications without a Vocaroo recording will not be considered.



Record this script:



"Hello, my name is ___, and I’m applying for this role because I enjoy speaking with people and building clear, professional conversations.



I have experience communicating in English and feel comfortable speaking with clients in the United States. In conversations, I focus on listening carefully, understanding what the other person needs, and responding in a natural and confident way.



I’m reliable, detail-oriented, and able to work independently from home while maintaining a high level of communication."





This role is best suited for candidates who are truly fluent in spoken English and comfortable communicating with US-based clients. Please apply only if you meet this requirement.

title: Social Media Manager for Australian Hair Salon
description:
Part-Time (10-20 hrs/week) | AUD $3–$7/hour | Remote | Sydney Australia Hours | Long-Term Opportunity



We’re hiring a strategic, organised and brand-aware Social Media Manager to lead the content and online presence of Carte Blanche Hair; a luxury, education-led hair salon delivering elevated experiences through precision, intention, and design.



This role is the starting point of what may grow into full marketing ownership for the salon. You will be responsible for planning, directing, creating, and scheduling content, not reactively, but with clarity and structure.



You are not just posting content.

You are shaping perception.



There are 3 key components to this role:



1. Content Strategy & Planning



You will:

Review and plan content weeks in advance

Develop a clear, structured content calendar aligned with the brand

Identify gaps and opportunities in our current social presence

Ensure consistency in tone, aesthetic, and messaging



2. Content Direction & Creation



You will:

Clearly direct the salon team on exactly what content is required

Specify video types, angles, timing, and context

Manage and utilise Shared Albums to access and organise content

Edit and prepare content for posting



3. Scheduling, Performance & Growth



You will:



Schedule content across relevant platforms

Apply marketing fundamentals (not trend-chasing)

Monitor performance and refine content strategy

Support future campaigns, launches, and brand growth

Potentially evolve into full marketing role for Carte Blanche Hair



Hours & Availability

Approx. 10–20 hours (starting with 10) 



Flexible scheduling, aligned with Sydney (AEST) time



Long-term role with the opportunity to expand into a broader marketing position



We’re Looking For Someone Who Is…



- Strategically minded, not reactive

- Confident in giving clear direction to a creative team

- Experienced in managing social media for similar brands

- Knowledgeable in marketing fundamentals

- Highly organised, proactive, and detail-oriented

- Comfortable managing workflows and digital systems

- Aligned with high standards and premium branding

- Bonus if you have experience in luxury, beauty, fashion, or service-based brands.



Contract & Compensation



- Hourly rate: AUD $3-7 AUD/hour 

- Initial trial period with clear review points

- Long-term role with defined growth opportunities

- Potential to evolve into Marketing Manager / Brand Lead



How to Apply



Please submit your application via
 to 
 with the following:

- Industry (Hair & Beauty or Fashion)

- Level of professionalism

Submission of materials listed above

title: Virtual Assistant – Project Manager / Estimator (Construction)
description:
We’re a growing Australian residential building company specialising in complex renovations and custom builds. We’re looking for a reliable, detail-driven Virtual Assistant to support our team as a Project Manager / Estimator.

This role is ideal for someone with construction admin experience who enjoys keeping projects organised, schedules on track, and numbers accurate.

You’ll work closely with the Director to support live projects and assist with estimating and quote preparation.



Key Responsibilities



Project Management Support:

Daily use of Buildertrend for:

- Project scheduling

- Creating and managing purchase orders

- Tracking tasks, timelines, and approvals

- Assisting with coordination between suppliers, subcontractors, and internal staff

- Keeping project information accurate, current, and well organised

- Identifying scheduling gaps, missing information, or potential issues early



Estimating & Quoting Support:

- Assisting with estimating for residential building projects

- Reviewing plans and double-checking quantities

Contacting subcontractors and suppliers to:

- Request quotes

- Follow up pricing and scope details

- Comparing subcontractor pricing and scopes

- Assisting in compiling estimates into clear, professional quote presentations

- Ensuring accuracy and completeness before quotes are issued



Additional Responsibilities:

(Training can be provided where needed)

- Organising project documentation and plans

- Preparing variation summaries

- Basic cost tracking and budget comparisons

- Updating internal checklists and systems

- General construction administration support as required



About You:



- Experience in construction, estimating, or project coordination (essential)

- Comfortable reading plans, working with quantities, and trade pricing

- Strong attention to detail and accuracy

- Clear written and spoken English

- Highly organised and proactive

- Able to work independently and meet deadlines

- Experience with Buildertrend or similar project management software ideal



Working Hours:

- Part-time or full-time opportunity available.

- Australian business hours preferred, or at least partial overlap



Why Work With Us:

- Long-term role with a stable, growing company

- Clear systems, expectations, and support

- Direct communication with decision-makers

- Opportunity to grow into a senior support role over time



To Apply:

Please include all of the following in your application:

- Start your written application with the words “Buildertrend Ready”

- A brief summary of your experience in construction, estimating, or project coordination

- A list of any relevant software you’ve used (e.g. Buildertrend, Procore, Excel, PlanSwift, etc.)

- An example of a similar role you’ve held



Submit a short video (1–3 minutes) explaining:

- Why you are well suited to this role

- Your experience with construction projects and/or estimating

- Why you would like to work with A-Team Builders

- Are you looking for part-time or full-time



Applications that do not include the requested video or do not follow the application instructions will not be considered.

title: Client Nurturing Specialist
description:
About Proactive Marketing



The Proactive Marketing mission: “To help Chiropractors build their dream practice while having a positive impact on the health of their patients.”



We not only guarantee the best results for our clients, but we also prioritize building a one-of-a-kind working experience for our team. We are 100% remote, and we encourage our employees to work from anywhere in the world.



We have a strong company culture that focuses on innovation, personal development, leadership, and cultivating a winning environment. We believe that our company is most productive when our employees are fulfilled, challenged, and working to achieve both their personal and professional goals, while constantly striving for their own personal next level.



Our #1 Core Value: Better Than Yesterday



In today’s world taking initiative is a critical component of success. Therefore, we encourage tea
mbers to take initiative in the direction that they see fit so that they can learn valuable lessons along the way and contribute to relevant team goals. We don’t micromanage and we encourage an environment of responsibility and leadership.



About the Role



We are looking for a Client Nurturing Specialist to help manage and protect our client experience behind the scenes.



This role is not sales and not account management — your primary mission is to ensure clients feel supported, tracked, and never forgotten, while reducing administrative workload for our Account Managers so they can focus on high-value conversations and faster response times.



If you are highly organized, process-driven, and naturally attentive to client satisfaction, this role is for you.



Primary Objective



To reduce administrative workload for Account Managers by owning client tracking, follow-ups, and quality control — ultimately improving retention, continuity, and overall client experience.



Key Responsibilities



  -Client Onboarding & Launch Oversight

  -Ensure all clients are fully onboarded within the ideal timeline

  -Confirm that every onboarding and launch call strictly follows SOP

  -Flag missing steps, delays, or process gaps immediately

  -Call Quality Control & Client Sentiment Monitoring

  -Quality check every onboarding and launch call

  -Identify signs of frustration, dissatisfaction, or confusion

  -Proactively alert Account Managers if a client appears unhappy or disengaged

  -Client Retention & Lifecycle Tracking

  -Maintain a clear, up-to-date spreadsheet of:

        -Clients nearing the end of their service term (for retention follow-up)

        -Clients who stopped service (for re-engagement after 1–2 months)

        -Ensure no client reaches an end date without a retention action planned

        -Re-Engagement & Responsiveness Tracking

        -Track clients who become unresponsive

        -Coordinate outreach through different channels 
, Slack, CRM, etc.)

        -Help bring conversations back in sync before issues escalate

        -Internal Coordination

        -Keep Account Managers informed with clear notes, flags, and updates

        -Maintain clean, accurate documentation at all times



What We’re Looking For



 -Extremely detail-oriented and organized

 -Strong follow-up and tracking skills

 -Comfortable reviewing call recordings and SOPs

 -Able to spot emotional cues and early client dissatisfaction

 -Process-driven with a strong sense of ownership

 -Clear written communication skills

 -Experience in client success, operations, VA support, or account coordination is a plus



Why This Role Matters:



 -Your work directly impacts

 -Client satisfaction

 -Client retention

 -Faster response times

 -Better focus for Account Managers

 -A smoother, more professional client experience

 -You are the system behind the relationship.



Role Details



Remote



Full-time / Part-time (adjust as needed)



Long-term opportunity for the right candidate

title: Automotive Operations & Dispatch Coordinator
description:
Key Responsibilities

1. Fleet & Retail Ops Coordination

*Take retail calls

*Own the estimate-to-approval-to-route workflow:

**Create and submit estimates

**Follow up for approval

**Ensure parts are sourced

**Finalize tech routes for the following day

*Track all jobs in progress and flag issues proactively

*Ensure routes are realistic and efficient; confirm techs are prepped and ready

*Communicate clearly with customers and fleet managers about job timing, status, and follow-ups

*Submit and close out fleet approvals in Element, LeasePlan, and AutoIntegrate

*Ensure invoices match approvals; follow up on outstanding invoices and missing payments



2. Scheduling & Productivity Tracking

*Maintain the daily technician schedule, making updates as needed

*Monitor tech productivity; flag idle time, reschedules, or delays

*Track time logs and coordinate with bookkeeper for payroll



3. Customer Communication

*Respond to incoming calls,  texts, WhatsApp messages, and system inquiries in a timely, professional manner

*Follow up with clients as needed to resolve open issues or gather job-related info

*Escalate concerns appropriately and promptly



4. Admin & Reporting

*Submit a detailed Daily Recap covering completed work, pending tasks, blockers, and KPIs

*Keep Trello and other tools up-to-date with accurate job and task statuses

*Track inventory needs and coordinate ordering of parts, oil, and supplies

*Monitor A/R and follow up on past-due fleet invoices



5. Marketing & Content Support 

*Publish our monthly newsletter in MailChimp with content from marketing team

*Coordinate publishing of content to Instagram /
 / Google My Business

*Other light admin support as needed for the marketing team



What Success Looks Like

*All work orders, estimates, approvals, and tech routes are handled with zero dropped balls

*You identify blockers or problems before they become fires

*Communication is clear, timely, and professional — with both customers and internal team

*The business runs like a machine — nothing gets missed or delayed

*You take full ownership of your responsibilities and require very little follow-up



Who You Are

*A natural systems thinker who thrives on clarity, organization, and ownership

*Extremely proactive — you don’t wait to be told what to do

*Excellent at written and verbal English communication

*Comfortable in the automotive world and eager to learn the details

*Sharp and reliable — you retain info, spot gaps, and follow through



Experience & Skills Required

*3+ years of experience in a remote automotive: coordinator, dispatcher, operations role

*Demonstrated responsibility for keeping things moving without handholding

*Excellent written and spoken English

*Experience with dispatch, route planning, or technician scheduling

*Familiar with tools like Slack, Google Docs, Trello (or similar), CRM/invoicing platforms

*Experience working with U.S.-based field service, auto, or fleet companies

*Bonus: Familiarity with AutoIntegrate, Housecall Pro, Element, or LeasePlan platforms



Required Software Experience

*Slack

*WhatsApp

*Trello (or similar)

*Google Workspace

*CRM / invoicing tools (Housecall Pro, AutoIntegrate)

*
 (plus)



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

*Dual monitor setup is required to ensure efficiency in managing multiple applications simultaneously.

title: Appointment Setter (DM-Based) – Graveyard Shift
description:
We are looking for a reliable and experienced Appointment Setter to join our growing team.



This role is ideal for someone confident with DM-based appointment setting, comfortable working night shifts, and committed to consistent performance.



Kingdom Rose Realty helps part-time and full-time professionals, business owners, and university students build additional income through property, particularly deal sourcing. We value integrity, quality conversations, and long-term relationships, not pressure or spammy sales tactics.



Role Responsibilities



Respond to inbound leads via Instagram, TikTok, and other platforms

Start genuine conversations and qualify prospects

Identify pain points, goals, and motivation

Handle basic objections (time, money, commitment)

Book qualified calls into the calendar for the closer

Follow up consistently and manage conversations properly



Work Schedule (IMPORTANT)



???? Primary Shift: 2:00 AM – 8:00 AM Philippine Time



Applicants must be comfortable and consistent with night shifts on weekdays.



? Weekend Availability (Highly Preferred):



Priority will be given to applicants who are also willing to be available anytime between 7:00 PM – 8:00 AM PH time on Saturdays and Sundays.



This does not require working straight hours, breaks are absolutely fine. The main goal is availability to respond as lead volume is typically higher on weekends.



Requirements:



Proven experience as an appointment setter (DM-based preferred)

Strong written English and conversational skills

Comfortable with KPIs, daily targets, and performance tracking

Reliable internet connection and backup setup

Coachable, honest, and proactive communicator



What We’re Looking For:



Someone dependable and consistent

Comfortable working independently and within a team

Open to feedback and continuous improvement

Focused on quality bookings, not just volume



How to Apply



Please include:



Link to your portfolio that has your active
 and mobile number

A brief summary of your appointment-setting experience

The platforms you’ve worked on (Instagram, TikTok, etc.)

Your availability confirmation for 2:00 AM – 8:00 AM PH time

If you're also willing to work anytime between 7:00 PM  - 8:00 AM PH time on weekends



Also include an example of how you would respond to a lead who says:

“I’m interested but I can't afford the course at the 
nt.”



Applications without the availability confirmation may not be considered.

title: CPA/Bookkeeper
description:
Job Type: Contract

Location: Remote



We are seeking an experienced CPA/Bookkeeper with a strong background in government contracting and/or staffing firms to manage accounting operations, ensure compliance with federal and state regulations, and support accurate financial reporting. This role requires hands-on experience with contract billing, payroll accounting, and regulatory compliance in a government contracting or staffing environment.



Key Responsibilities

• Maintain and reconcile general ledger accounts in accordance with GAAP

• Manage full-cycle accounting for government contracts and staffing engagements

• Prepare and submit client invoices, including cost-plus, time-and-materials (T&M), and fixed-price contracts

• Track labor costs, indirect rates, and overhead allocations

• Ensure compliance with FAR, DCAA, and applicable state and federal regulations

• Manage accounts payable, accounts receivable, and cash flow

• Process and reconcile payroll, including W2 and 1099 classifications, overtime, and fringe benefits

• Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

• Prepare and file federal, state, and local tax returns

• Support audits, including DCAA or other government audits

• Monitor contract funding, ceilings, and burn rates

• Maintain organized financial and contract documentation

• Collaborate with operations and HR teams to ensure accurate billing and payroll data

• Provide financial reporting and analysis to support management decision-making



Qualifications

• Active CPA license preferred (or in progress)

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

• Minimum of 3–5 years of accounting/bookkeeping experience in government contracting and/or staffing companies

• Strong knowledge of FAR, DCAA compliance, and government contract accounting

• Experience with labor-based billing and timekeeping systems

• Proficiency with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Deltek, NetSuite, or similar)

• Strong understanding of payroll compliance and worker classification (W2 vs. 1099)

• Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

• Ability to manage multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment

• Strong communication and analytical skills



Preferred Qualifications

• Experience with staffing firm accounting, including temp, temp-to-hire, and direct-hire models

• Familiarity with indirect rate structures and cost pools

• Experience working with DCAA auditors or government agencies

• Advanced Excel skills



Compensation 

• Competitive compensation based on experience

title: Local SEO & Google Ads Specialist (Booking-Focused Lead Generation)
description:
We are a growing residential cleaning company looking for a results-driven Local SEO & Google Ads Specialist to help us generate high-quality, low-cost leads that convert into booked cleaning jobs.



This is not a traffic-only role. Your success will be measured by qualified leads and booked jobs, not impressions or clicks.



You will own the full funnel: Local visibility ? website ? booking ? optimization.



Primary Responsibilities

-Local SEO (Primary Focus)

-Optimize and manage our Google Business Profile

-Improve local rankings for cleaning-related searches

-Optimize service pages for local intent and conversions

-Manage citations, NAP consistency, and local relevance

-Implement review-generation strategies (ethical, compliant)

-Track and report local SEO performance

-Google Ads (Secondary Focus)

-Set up and manage Google Search Ads end-to-end

-Focus on high-intent, booking-ready keywords only

-Optimize ads for cost per lead and cost per booking

-Write compelling ad copy and extensions

-Set up conversion tracking (calls, forms, bookings)

-Continuously optimize to reduce wasted spend

-Conversion & Funnel Optimization

-Review website booking flow and identify drop-offs

-Suggest improvements to increase booking conversion rate

-Ensure leads are highly qualified (location, service, intent)

-Focus on quality over volume



Success Metrics (Very Important)

You will be evaluated on:

-Cost per qualified lead

-Cost per booked job

-Lead quality (not junk traffic)

-Consistent improvement over time

If you can prove ROI, budget and scope will increase.



Required Skills & Experience

-Proven experience with Local SEO

-Proven experience running Google Search Ads

-Experience generating leads for local service businesses

-Strong analytical mindset (you track what matters)

-Clear written English communication

-Ability to work independently and proactively



Strongly Preferred:

-Experience with residential cleaning, home services, or trades

-Experience optimizing booking or form-based websites

-Understanding of customer intent and buyer psychology

-Experience working with limited budgets efficiently



Compensation & Structure

-Please submit hourly or monthly retainer proposals

-This role will begin as a trial engagement (30–60 days) to evaluate fit and results



Compensation and scope may increase based on:

-Quality of leads generated

-Cost efficiency over time

-Communication and execution reliability



Optional Performance Upside (After Trial):

Opportunity for performance-based bonuses tied to:

-Consistent qualified leads

-Improvement in cost per booking

-Bonuses are reviewed and adjusted collaboratively based on results



This structure is designed to reward strong performance without requiring commission-only work, and to support a long-term working relationship.



Tools & Access Provided

-Website access (WordPress)

-Booking system access

-Google Business Profile access

-Google Ads account (new)

-Clear tracking and reporting expectations



To Apply (Read Carefully) Please include:

-Your experience with Local SEO (what you’ve ranked before)

-Your experience with Google Ads for local services

-Examples or case studies showing leads or booked jobs

-If you had a $500/month budget to generate booked cleaning jobs locally, how would you allocate it and why?

-How you would approach generating cleaning leads on a limited budget

-Your proposed base rate and bonus expectations

-Applications that focus only on traffic, impressions, or followers will not be considered.

title: FUNNEL BUILDER (Part-time)
description:
We’re hiring a Funnel Builder who knows how to architect, build, and optimize conversion-focused funnels using GoHighLevel and automation tools like 
 and Zapier.



This role is for someone who thinks in systems, understands how cold traffic behaves, and builds funnels cleanly and correctly. You are here to design, deploy, and improve funnels.  Your priorities are CRO, reliable automation, and creating a magical client experience from the first time someone interacts with our brand.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Team Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important, and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just managing marketing campaigns for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you think like a funnel and conversion architect? Do you enjoy structuring systems, workflows, and sales psychology that drives measurable results? Are you obsessed with improving KPIs by designing experiments and running tests? Do you take pride in building things properly the first time while still iterating and optimizing?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Funnel Architecture, Buildout & Optimization

- Build complete funnels inside GoHighLevel focused on lead generation

- Structure landing pages with conversion principles in mind

- Create and customize pages, forms, and
s

- Embed forms, manage page layouts, and ensure clean user flow across multiple devices

- Maintain proper tagging architecture and funnel logic



Automations, Workflows & Integrations

- Build and maintain workflows, automations, and multi-step sequences

- Implement conditional logic and clean tag-based systems

- Create 
 automations as needed

- Integrate APIs and third-party tools where required (OPTIONAL, but preferred)

- Set up UTM parameters, tracking codes, and verify traffic source links are set up correctly



Tracking, Optimization & Testing

- Implement Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager (bonus)

- Ensure accurate tracking and data flow across funnels

- Apply an A/B testing mindset to improve conversion rates

- Optimize funnels over time based on performance data and KPIs



Campaign Systems & Deployment

- Maintain clean, scalable campaign structures

- Collaborate with leadership on funnel improvements and testing plans

- Continuously learn and stay up to date on best practices to help brainstorm and make recommendations for improvements to our funnel ecosystem



Requirements:

- STRONG hands-on experience with GoHighLevel, required

- Recent experience with workflows, automations, tags, and sequences, required

- Experience building lead generation funnels (not ecom or dropshipping focused), required

- Experience with 
 and/or Zapier automations, required

- Understanding of conversion rate optimization and buyer behavior, required

- Ability to think in systems and campaign logic, required

- Clean build habits, required

- Moderate familiarity with cold traffic funnels, required

- Strong English communication skills; near-native preferred if involved in testing copy

- Interest in copy, funnel strategy, and optimization (execution-focused)

- A stable, high-speed internet connection, required (at least 150mbps)

- Growth mindset, required



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

- Meta Ads, Google Ads, or media buying familiarity

- Meta Pixel, GA4, GTM setup experience

- Basic SEO understanding

- API integrations beyond native tools



NOTE: This is a part-time role (5–15 hrs/week) with the opportunity to grow into a full-time position for the right person.



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.



As part of your application, include a Loom or YouTube video (2 minutes or less) explaining why you believe you’re a strong fit for this specific Funnel Builder role.







STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to an interview.



STEP 3:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 4:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Funnel Builder with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Technical SEO Specialist (Hands-On)
description:
We are seeking a Technical SEO Specialist to lead the execution of technical search engine optimization initiatives across our digital platforms. This role requires strong hands-on experience, attention to detail, and the ability to translate SEO best practices into practical implementation.



Key Responsibilities

- Conduct technical SEO audits and implement fixes related to crawlability, indexing, site architecture, canonicalization, and internal linking.

- Improve website performance including page speed, mobile optimization, and Core Web Vitals.

- Work directly within WordPress, Shopify, and PHP-based platforms to implement SEO enhancements at the theme, plugin, and template level.

- Address JavaScript rendering and technical issues affecting search visibility.

- Implement structured data and ensure SEO best practices are followed across all pages.

- Monitor keyword rankings, organic traffic, and technical health using SEO tools.

- Collaborate with content, development, and marketing teams to support overall SEO strategy.



Required Skills & Experience

- 3+ years of hands-on Technical SEO experience with proven results.

- Strong understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and working knowledge of PHP.

- Experience working directly with WordPress and Shopify; experience with PHP-based eCommerce platforms is a plus.

- Proficiency with SEO tools such as Google Search Console, Ahrefs/Semrush, Screaming Frog, Lighthouse, and GTmetrix.

- Strong analytical skills with a data-driven approach to problem solving.



Preferred Qualifications

- Experience with structured data and schema implementation

- Familiarity with AI-driven or generative search concepts

- Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities effectively

title: Technical SEO Developer (Hands-On, Performance-Driven)
description:
We are looking for a hands-on Technical SEO Developer who can implement SEO changes directly, not just recommend them.



This role is for someone comfortable working inside CMS files, templates, and codebases to improve crawlability, performance, and keyword rankings. If your experience is mainly content SEO, reporting, or tool-based optimization, this role will not be a good fit.



What You Will Do

 • Audit and implement technical SEO fixes related to:

 • Crawlability and indexation

 • Site architecture and internal linking

 • Canonicalization and rendering issues

 • Core Web Vitals, page speed, and mobile performance

 • Work directly within:

 • WordPress (themes, plugins, core files)

 • Shopify (Liquid templates, SEO constraints, performance)

 • PHP-based platforms (e.g. OpenCart or similar)

 • Implement structured data and technical enhancements at code level

 • Optimize websites for traditional search and AI-driven search experiences (GEO / GSEO)

 • Take ownership of ranking performance and SEO KPIs

 • Use SEO tools to diagnose issues, but rely on implementation, not automation alone



Required Skills & Experience

 • 3+ years of hands-on technical SEO implementation

 • Comfortable editing live websites and templates

 • Working knowledge of:

 • HTML, CSS, JavaScript (rendering understanding required)

 • PHP and Shopify Liquid

 • Experience working directly inside:

 • WordPress, Shopify, and PHP-based e-commerce platforms

 • Strong understanding of:

 • Google Search Console

 • Ahrefs / Semrush

 • Screaming Frog, Lighthouse, GTmetrix

 • Able to clearly explain why SEO actions are taken and how they affect rankings

 • Good command of spoken and written English



Nice to Have

 • Experience with SQL or Python / Node.js for SEO automation

 • Practical exposure to Generative Engine Optimization (GEO / AI search)

 • Proven examples of technical changes leading to ranking improvements



Important Notes

 • This is not a strategy-only or reporting-only role

 • Candidates who rely mainly on plugins, widgets, or third-party apps without understanding the underlying technical mechanics will not be suitable

 • You must be comfortable implementing changes yourself

title: Inside Sales Executive (Telemarketing)
description:
Job Description



Job Title: Telemarketing Specialist

Salary Range: $
Remuneration Scheme: Basic + Incentive





Overview



We are looking for a Telemarketing Specialist to play a key role in Lead Generation and Client acquisition. You will be the first point of contact for Prospective SME clients - Introducing our Services, qualifying leads and arranging appointments for the Business Development Team. 

.

Key Responsibilities



- Prospecting & Outreach: Conduct outbound calls to identify Client needs and present outlet's solutions.

- Lead Qualification: Identify and assess prospects for suitability and potential for further engagement.

- Appointment Setting: Schedule meetings with qualified leads and ensure smooth handover to the Business Development team. 

- CRM Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of interactions, follow ups and lead progress.

- Relationship nurturing: Maintain engagement with prospects through timely follow ups and meaningful communication.

- Marketing insights: Provide feedback from prospective clients’ interaction to refine and improve outreach strategies.  



Requirements



- Experience: minimum 1 year in Telemarketing, inside sales or outbound client engagement

- Communication skills: Clear, confident and persuasive with the ability to engage prospects and handle objections professionally.

- Results-oriented: Self-motivated, energetic and target driven (Call volumes and appointment targets)

- Business curiosity: Interested in Digital & AI solutions and their role in supporting business growth

- Team Player: Works collaboratively and contributes positively to team culture. 



Why Join us 



- Compensation structure: Base salary plus uncapped incentives

- Continuous learning: Training in Digital & AI technologies & consultative sales techniques.

- Career Progression: Clear pathways to advance into business development or other Client-facing roles

- Collaborative culture: Work with a supportive team that values initiative, creativity and learning



If you are a confident communicator who enjoys engaging with people and driving business growth, we want to hear from you!

title: Tech-Savvy VA for Project Management Career Launch (Irvine/OC Focus)
description:
Project Goal: I am an aspiring Project Manager aiming to secure an entry-level role (Project Coordinator, Associate PM, or Junior PM) in Irvine or Orange County, CA by March 1st. I need a high-level assistant to manage my application engine.



Key Responsibilities:



1.Daily Lead Sourcing: Find 5–10 new roles daily. Focus on titles like "Project Coordinator," "Associate Project Manager," and "Junior PM".

2.Location Filter: Prioritize Irvine, Orange County, and Newport Beach. I am open to Remote, Hybrid, or On-site roles.

3. Application Submission: Use my "Project Management" (Resume, Google Project Management Certificate details, and Cover Letter templates) to apply.

4. Keyword Matching: Ensure applications highlight skills like Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Gantt charts, and Stakeholder Communication.



Requirements: 



1. Strong understanding of Project Management tools (Jira, Asana, or Trello).

2. Ability to work 4 hours/day during US Pacific Standard Time (PST)

3. CRITICAL: To prove you read this, your application subject line must be: "I am your Philippines PROJECT Assistant" and mention one Project Management methodology (e.g., Waterfall or Agile).

title: Bookkeeper
Virtual Admin & Front Desk (Payments & Scheduling)
description:
We are looking for a Virtual Full-time studio Admin & Front Desk (Payments & Scheduling). You are highly organised and calm-under-pressure individual to join our team at Getlaashed The Studio. This role is critical to the smooth daily functioning of both our Singapore and Kuala Lumpur outlet, with a strong focus on customer appointment management and payment coordination.



You will be the heart of the studio, managing payments, handling client bookings/scheduling and ensuring a seamless payment experience for our customers.





GetLaashed The Studio is a Lash-Lift-only beauty studio that specialises in natural-looking, long-lasting lash lifts, no extensions, no fuss!





Start Date: Immediate



Salary: $450 USD/mth





Key Responsibilities

* Confirming appointments and schedules using Setmore & WhatsApp for both SG & KL outlet

* Handle payment collection, verification, and follow-ups (SGD & MYR) using Setmore & WhatsApp

* Ensure booking accuracy, correct tagging, and clean system records  

* Monitor and follow-up pending, rescheduled, and incomplete bookings

* Ensure no overlaps, missed payments, or errors

* Create and update customer time table for lash beauticians daily

* Handle client check-ins and check-outs virtually

* Respond to all customer enquiries professionally, calmly, and clearly

* Handle some customer complaints with critical thinking

* Escalate high-risk cases to management appropriately







3 Softwares you will only be using

* Setmore (appointment scheduling)

* WhatsApp (client communication & follow-ups & payment collection)

* Google Docs (create customer timetable)







Requirements

* Minimum 1-2 years of experience in client coordination, scheduling, and payment roles

* Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving ability

* Extremely detail-oriented and meticulous

* Able to multitask efficiently without losing accuracy

* Calm, collected, and professional under pressure

* Comfortable handling payments and sensitive client information

* Tech-comfortable (booking systems, WhatsApp, basic reporting)

* Able to manage both Singapore and KL operations daily — this is mandatory







What We Expect

* You take ownership, not instructions-only

* You double-check instead of assuming

* You prioritise accuracy & efficiency

* You understand that payments + scheduling = zero room for error





Working Hours

* 5.5-day work week

* 8hrs work per day 

* 1hr Break

* Weekends work is required

* 1 and half Days Off





Why Join Us

* Work in a fast-growing regional brand

* (Training will be provided)

* Clear systems, SOPs, and structured workflows

*Work from Home





To Apply:



Please answer two questions:



1. Date of Birth:



2. Why are you a strong fit for the role?





Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Guest Experience & Short-Term Rental Coordinator With an Experienced of Over Hundreds of Properties
description:
Requirements



1. Must have experience managing at least 100 short-term rental properties. Applicants with experience managing fewer than 100 properties will be auto decline.



2. Full-time availability with no other commitments.



3. Comfortable with timestamping, screen recording, and monitoring tasks.



4. Updated Resume/CV attached or linked with complete details including employment date, company name and website you handled.



PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE ALL THESE REQUIREMENTS



Role Overview

We are looking for an Experienced Guest Communications Specialist who excels in high-level guest relations while upholding host performance standards. This role goes beyond managing messages — you’ll be a key part of a collaborative team, working closely with operations, maintenance, and other departments to create seamless guest experiences. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy solving problems, and can balance guest satisfaction with company interests, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities



Professionally and empathetically manage guest communications across multiple platforms (Airbnb, 
, VRBO, direct bookings, etc.).



Handle sensitive or escalated issues, ensuring guest satisfaction while protecting company standards.



File, manage, and follow up on damage claims and compensation requests with booking platforms.



Identify, appeal, and remove unfair or policy-violating guest reviews.



Maintain accurate records of disputes, claims, and communications.



Collaborate closely with internal teams to resolve issues efficiently and ensure smooth operations.



Accept and apply constructive feedback to continuously improve both individual performance and team processes.



Who We’re Looking For



Someone proactive, solution-oriented, and able to thrive in a team environment.



Calm under pressure while managing multiple priorities.



A communicator who values empathy, understanding, and teamwork as much as problem-solving.



How to Apply

Please only apply if you meet all requirements above. In your application, make sure to:



Confirm full-time availability with no other commitments.



Outline your STR experience, including tools used.



Confirm comfort with timestamping, screen recording, and monitoring tasks.



Attach or link your resume/CV.
