title: Senior Property Accountant (Yardi/Appfolio experience)
description:
Senior Property Accountant

Job Type: Full-Time, WFH(Remote)

Work Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM Pacific Time

Salary: $1,600





Work Experience:

Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, including both senior-level responsibilities and hands-on bookkeeping.





Job Overview:

We are seeking a seasoned and detail-oriented Senior Property Accountant to join our team. This role requires advanced expertise in financial reporting, analysis, and compliance, combined with a willingness to handle day-to-day accounting tasks such as bookkeeping, transaction recording, and reconciliations. The ideal candidate is highly organized, proactive, and capable of managing both strategic accounting functions and operational responsibilities.







Key Responsibilities:



•Financial Reporting and Analysis:

Prepare and analyze financial statements, ensuring accuracy and adherence to accounting standards.

Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports to support decision-making.

Develop budgets and forecasts, providing financial insights to stakeholders.

Monitor and analyze financial performance, identifying opportunities for improvement.



•Audit and Compliance:

Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal accounting regulations.

Prepare for and assist with internal and external audits, maintaining comprehensive records.

Implement and maintain internal controls to safeguard financial data.



•Collaboration and Communication:

Work closely with management and stakeholders to provide financial updates and insights.

Support the team with ad hoc accounting tasks and special projects as needed.





Qualifications:

•Minimum 5 years of experience in accounting, including advanced financial reporting and hands-on bookkeeping.

•Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero) and advanced Excel skills.

•Strong understanding of GAAP and other relevant accounting standards.

•Exceptional attention to detail, organizational skills, and problem-solving abilities.

•Willingness to perform both senior-level accounting functions and routine bookkeeping tasks.

•Professional, proactive, and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment.

•Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams and external stakeholders.

•Ability to work independently in a remote environment and meet tight deadlines.

•CPA qualification or equivalent is preferred but not required.

•Corporate accounting experience in real estate and property management is a must.

Yardi/AppFolio experience is preferred but not required.

Comfortable with screen sharing and being on a video call for the entire shift.

title: Inside Sales Representative - B2B Performance Engineering (US Market)
description:
Hi, my name is Yuri. I'm the founder of PFLB, a performance testing and engineering company headquartered in Delaware, USA. We've been in business since 2008 and work with companies like Tinder, College Board, Illumina, and NOV. We have 500+ engineers and serve clients across banking, healthcare, e-commerce, education, energy, and technology.

We're growing our US market presence and need a sharp, hungry inside sales rep to help us build pipeline and book qualified meetings with enterprise decision-makers.



This is NOT a virtual assistant role. This is NOT a call center job. This is a real B2B sales position where you'll be prospecting into US enterprises, having real business conversations, and directly contributing to company revenue. If you've sold B2B tech services or SaaS to US companies before, keep reading.



What You'll Be Doing:



1. Outbound Prospecting (60% of your time)



- Research and identify target accounts: VP/Director-level decision-makers in Engineering, QA, DevOps, SRE, and IT Operations at US mid-market and enterprise companies

- Build prospect lists using LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Apollo, ZoomInfo, or similar tools

- Write personalized cold
s and LinkedIn messages (not spray-and-pray templates)

- Make cold calls and follow-up calls to prospects

- Execute multi-touch outbound sequences 
 + LinkedIn + phone)



2. Pipeline Management (20%)



- Qualify inbound leads from our website (
)

- Manage your pipeline in HubSpot CRM - keep it clean and updated daily

- Book discovery calls and demos for our account executives and technical team

- Track all activities, conversations, and outcomes



3. Research and Strategy (20%)



- Research target industries to understand their performance testing pain points

- Monitor trigger events: new product launches, site outages, migration announcements, funding rounds

- Contribute ideas to improve our outreach messaging and targeting

- Provide market feedback on what prospects are saying





What We're Selling

PFLB helps companies make sure their software doesn't crash, slow down, or fail when lots of people use it at the same time. We offer:



- Performance testing services - our team of engineers runs load and stress tests on websites, apps, APIs, and enterprise systems

- PFLB Platform - our AI-powered load testing platform that companies can use themselves

- Managed performance engineering - ongoing performance monitoring, optimization, and SRE support



Our typical clients are companies that can't afford downtime: banks processing transactions, e-commerce sites during Black Friday, healthcare platforms during open enrollment, energy utilities during storm events, EdTech platforms during exam periods.

Deal sizes range from $5,000 for a single project to $200,000+ for annual managed services contracts. Your job is to open doors and book meetings - our technical team handles the demos and closing.



Who You Are

Must-have:



- 2+ years of B2B outbound sales experience (SDR, BDR, or inside sales role)

- Experience selling to US-based companies (you understand US business culture)

- Excellent spoken and written English - you can hold a natural conversation with a US executive without them noticing you're reading from a script

- Experience with CRM tools (HubSpot preferred, Salesforce also fine)

- Experience with LinkedIn for prospecting

- Comfortable making cold calls (not just
s)

- Reliable high-speed internet + backup connection

- Willing to work US time zone hours (EST or CST overlap, typically 9pm-6am PH time)

- Own laptop/computer with webcam and headset



Nice-to-have (not required, but will make you stand out):



- Experience selling IT services, SaaS, DevOps tools, or technical consulting

- Familiarity with sales tools: ZoomInfo, Apollo, Outreach, Salesloft, Lemlist, or similar

- Understanding of software development concepts (you don't need to be technical, but knowing what QA, load testing, DevOps, or cloud infrastructure means is a big plus)

- Experience with LinkedIn Sales Navigator

- Track record of meeting or exceeding quota





Compensation and Benefits



- Base salary: PHP 70,000 - 90,000/month depending on experience

- Performance bonuses: Additional PHP 5,000 - 10,000 per qualified meeting booked that converts to opportunity (uncapped)

- Paid time off: 14 days per year

- Growth: This is a ground-floor opportunity. As we grow the US sales team, high performers will move into senior sales or account executive roles with higher comp





How to Apply

IMPORTANT: Do NOT just click "Apply" and send a generic message. Applications that don't follow these instructions will be ignored.

To apply, please send me a message with the following:



Subject line: "PFLB Sales - [Your First Name]"

In your message, answer these three questions:



1. What is the most complex B2B product or service you've sold, and who were you selling to? (2-3 sentences)

2. Describe your best month in sales - what did you do differently that month? (2-3 sentences)

3. Why does this role interest you specifically? (1-2 sentences)





Attach your resume (PDF preferred)

Record a 2-minute Loom video (free at 
) where you pitch PFLB's services to me as if I'm a VP of Engineering at an e-commerce company worried about Black Friday traffic. Don't worry about getting every detail right - I want to hear how you communicate, think on your feet, and handle a sales conversation. Paste the Loom link in your message.



If you cannot follow these four steps, this role is probably not a good fit.



Our Hiring Process



- Application review (1-2 days)

- Async screening (the Loom video above)

- Live video interview with me - includes a mock cold call exercise (30 minutes)

- Paid trial task: I'll give you 10 real target companies and ask you to build outreach sequences for 3 of them. This is paid work ($50 USD) regardless of whether we hire you.

- Offer and 90-day trial period



We move fast. If you're a fit, you could be starting within 2 weeks.



I'm looking for someone who's genuinely excited about sales, not just looking for any remote job. If you love the hunt, enjoy talking to people, and want to be part of building something, I'd love to hear from you.

ABOUT US

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



Client Support (maintaining 40-50 total clients):



- Run kickoff calls with new clients using our proven script

- Review client content and give actionable feedback

- Answer client messages within 24 hours

- Host weekly group calls and 1-on-1 coaching sessions

- Help clients overcome content blocks and limiting beliefs



Progress Tracking:



- Update daily/weekly reports

- Track client progress and next steps

- Join daily team check-ins

- Ensure clients follow strategies consistently



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)



- C1+ English (written and spoken) with no accent

- Strong communication skills

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment



IMPORTANT



When recording a Loom video as part of your application:



- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Content creation and social media experience

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

- Regular usage of AI tools (ChatGPT, CapCut)



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)

Note: More experienced CSMs earn between $1,800 and $2,500 after 6-12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $900+ additional monthly based on:

- Client retention rates

- Task completion metrics

- Quality of feedback

- Team collaboration

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise directly to your bank

- Tools access: We'll cover all the needed tools

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Regular feedback and skill development



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CSM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with client management.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio.



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.

Development and Digital Marketing Specialist

About the Firm:

Our immigration law firm specializes in providing expert legal services to individuals, families, and businesses navigating the complexities of U.S. immigration law. We are a dedicated team of professionals committed to delivering top-quality support and guidance to our clients. 



Position Overview: 

The Business Development & Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for expanding the company’s online presence and driving business growth through digital marketing, networking, lead generation, and sales initiatives. This role focuses on building relationships with potential clients and business partners, managing online platforms and social media, creating advertising campaigns, and converting leads into clients.

• Strong understanding of online marketing platforms, social media management, and digital advertising (e.g.,
, LinkedIn, Google Ads, or similar platforms).

• Demonstrated ability to generate, track, and convert leads into clients or business opportunities.

• Excellent communication skills. 

• Ability to manage multiple campaigns, leads, and priorities in a fast-paced environment.

• Experience working with professional services, legal, immigration, or consulting firms is an advantage but not required.



Duties:

• Create, manage, and optimize digital advertisements across online platforms, websites, and social media channels.

, social platforms, and other outreach channels.

title: Assistant Accountant, US Property Management (Remote)
description:
About Us

Streamline Property Management is one the largest and fastest-growing  professional property management firms located in the Washington DC area. We manage over 1,000 residential properties, delivering a seamless experience for both owners and tenants. As a fast-growing, entrepreneurial company, we move quickly and value tea
mbers who take initiative. We don’t just manage properties; we manage our clients' most valuable assets, and we pride ourselves on financial precision and transparency.



About the Role:

We are seeking a detail-oriented Trust Accountant / Assistant Accountant to join our finance team. Reporting directly to the Accounting Manager, you will handle the day-to-day tactical accounting operations for our residential portfolio. Your primary focus will be maintaining the accuracy of tenant and owner ledgers, processing move-in/move-out financials, and ensuring all daily transactions are recorded correctly within AppFolio.



This is a specialized Trust Accounting role that requires a high degree of accuracy and a deep understanding of how funds flow between owners, tenants, and the property management firm.



Key Responsibilities:

- Move-In/Move-Out (MIMO): Execute the financial move-in process for new tenants and prepare security deposit dispositions and refunds for departing tenants within strict timelines.

- Tenant Accounting: Post rent receipts, apply late fees, and process credits or charges to tenant accounts accurately and timely.

- Owner Ledgers: Review individual owner ledgers to ensure all income and expenses are correctly categorized.

- Accounts Payable: Review and enter vendor invoices, ensuring they are coded to the correct property and general ledger account.

- Bank Reconciliations: Assist the Accounting Manager with daily and monthly bank reconciliations to ensure the "book balance" matches the bank.

- Chargebacks: Apply utility bill-backs and maintenance chargebacks to tenant ledgers as directed by Property Managers.

Assist in clearing AppFolio diagnostics and preparing files for monthly three-way reconciliations.

Communication: Coordinate with the Property Management team to resolve ledger discrepancies or tenant billing questions.



Requirements:

- Experience: 1–2+ years of accounting experience specifically within Residential Property Management. Candidates with no prior experience in property management will not be considered

- Software: Intermediate to Advanced AppFolio skills are required. You must be comfortable navigating ledgers, processing move-outs, and running reports within the platform.

- Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

- Strong understanding of debits/credits and the basics of accounting 

- Communication: Excellent written and verbal English skills; you will be communicating with US-based tea
mbers daily.

- Environment: Must have a reliable home office setup with high-speed internet and a "can-do" attitude.



Compensation & Schedule

- Full-time, 40 hours per week, remote contractor position

- Must be available to work US Eastern Time hours



Perks & Benefits

- Paid local public holidays (12+ days per year, depending on the official calendar)

- 10 paid vacation days annually (with potential to increase based on tenure)

- Opportunities for growth in both pay and responsibilities

- Be part of a supportive and friendly small team

- Stability and consistency - we are a long-term employer

title: CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE COORDINATOR (FAMILY EXPERIENCE TEAM | HEALTHCARE & MENTAL HEALTH)
description:
ABOUT RELATIONAL MINDS



Relational Minds is an Australian child and family mental health organisation delivering relationship-focused, evidence-informed programs to parents, children, educators, and leaders. Our philosophy is grounded in relationship-first approaches, compassionate communication, and trauma-informed, evidence-based practice.



The Operational Context



We manage complex assessment and treatment pathways involving multiple clinicians and strict timelines. Our Family Experience Team ensures that every family’s journey is coordinated, tracked, and followed through using a centralised Microsoft 365 architecture.



Why work with us?

 

* Values: We value kindness, clarity, and reliable teamwork.

 * Culture: We offer a calm, respectful, and emotionally intelligent work environment.

 * Leadership: You will work with supportive Australian leadership that appreciates initiative.

 * Growth: This is a meaningful, long-term role with opportunities for professional growth.



THE ROLE



You will manage the end-to-end journey for families, acting as the primary coordinator for their progress through our service. This is a coordination role requiring assertive communication and meticulous data management.



You will work within our Microsoft 365 ecosystem, responsible for maintaining a "single source of truth" in our trackers, ensuring clinicians meet deadlines, and identifying risks to a family’s progress before they become problems. You report to the Customer Experience Manager.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 

* Manage the family journey: Track every stage from intake to completion using Excel Online trackers hosted on SharePoint.

 * Maintain Data Integrity: Ensure our Excel dashboards act as a live "Mission Control," keeping data accurate across internal databases for bookings, assessments, and reports.

 * Assertive Coordination: Monitor clinician and administrative timelines and provide active follow-up for overdue work.

 * System Optimization: Use Excel formulas and formatting to create seamless workflows (e.g., "click-to-dial" links) that reduce friction for the team.

 * Risk Management: Identify delays or gaps in the process and escalate these to the Customer Experience Manager.

 * Documentation: Ensure all consents and clinical files are correctly filed in SharePoint.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

 

* Advanced Excel Online Proficiency: We do not just want "spreadsheet data entry." You must have experience using Excel in the browser (Excel Online) for real-time co-authoring.

 * Dashboard & Formula Logic: Experience creating "Actionable Dashboards" using formulas (specifically HYPERLINK for VoIP integration), conditional formatting, and data validation to create a seamless user interface.

 * Microsoft 365 Ecosystem: Comfort working within SharePoint and OneDrive environments, ensuring version control and correct file permissions.

 * Assertive Follow-up: Proven ability to chase busy professionals (clinicians/managers) to ensure deadlines are met.

 * Australian Context: Experience working with Australian companies is essential.



HIGHLY REGARDED

 

* Experience in Australian healthcare, allied health, or NDIS-related services.

 * Knowledge of Microsoft Lists or Power Automate for workflow automation.

 * Background in operations or project coordination.



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT

 

* Not a general Virtual Assistant role.

 * Not a passive data-entry position—you must actively drive the workflow.

 * Not for someone who prefers working in Google Sheets—we are a strict Microsoft 365 environment.



WORK DETAILS



 * Remote position (Work From Home).

 * Full-time, long-term role.

 * Work aligned with Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST) business hours.

 * Direct collaboration with an Australian leadership team.



HOW TO APPLY



Please include in your application:

 * A brief summary of your experience managing shared trackers in Excel Online (specifically mentioning real-time co-authoring).

 * An example of a time you used Excel formulas to improve a workflow (e.g., creating clickable links, automated status flags, or dashboards).

 * Your experience working with Australian companies.

 * One example of how you followed up with a professional to keep work on track.

Shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a practical Excel Online assessment demonstrating their ability to build a functional tracking dashboard.

title: Contract Web Developer (Project-Based)
description:
ABOUT DISPENZA

Dispenza has quickly become one of the largest marketing agencies in the rapidly-growing emerging market of cannabis as it quickly legalizes state by state in the Americas. As the market matures, we are on a mission to help change how the market operates, leaving the more questionable activities done by current market leaders and emerge as the first marketing agency and platform that values our customers while simultaneously delivering business-changing results to our clients.



JOB OVERVIEW

We’re hiring contract web developers for ongoing project-based website builds / conversions (typically 5–10 pages per site). This is not a full-time role - work is assigned per project.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

- Build pages in WordPress using Elementor / Elementor Pro (page builder experience required)

- Build pages in SGEN using its page builder (Elementor-like)

- Convert existing sites/designs into clean, responsive page builds (Figma/PSD/reference site ? live pages)

- Basic setup + polish: mobile responsiveness, spacing/typography consistency, speed-minded builds



TEAM COLLABORATION

- Working alongside project managers to complete tasks as part of the team’s development process.

- Participating in team meetings to discuss project progress and suggest new tools or techniques.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Strong portfolio of live sites (page-build focused)

- Comfortable learning a new builder quickly (SGEN builder is similar to Elementor)

- Detail-oriented, reliable, deadline-driven

- Clear communication (quick updates, asks good questions)



DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- WP builders: WPBakery, Divi (Elementor is primary)

- ACF, CPT, basic theme/plugin troubleshooting

- Shopify ? WordPress migrations or landing page builds



COMPENSATION

Project-based pay (per site / per batch of pages).



SCHEDULE

- 8 hour shift, Tuesday to Saturday, 7:00am to 4:00pm Manila Time.

- Minimal overtime during weekdays and weekends will be expected as part of salary



Dispenza is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, wordpressage, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.





HOW TO APPLY

- Please fill out the following form in order for your application to be considered: 

- Must complete a paid test task (small page build).

- Passing the test = eligible for ongoing paid projects.



Good luck!

title: COMMISSION-BASED vending location acquisition role
description:
About the Role



We are a U.S.-based vending company expanding nationwide.



This is NOT appointment setting.



Your responsibility is to contact business owners, present our vending placement program, overcome objections, and secure a signed agreement allowing placement of a vending machine at their location.



The job is complete only when the agreement is signed.



This is outbound closing.



If you are not comfortable closing deals directly with business owners, this role is not for you.



What You Will Be Doing



Cold call business owners and decision makers



Clearly explain our vending placement offer



Handle objections confidently in real time



DocuSign PDF agreement



Follow up consistently until agreement is signed



Log call activity and notes accurately



Submit signed agreements as proof of completion



? Success = Signed Agreement

? “Interested” is not success

? “Call me later” is not success



Compensation Structure (Commission-Only Trial)



This position begins with a 14-Day Performance Trial (Commission Only).



There is no hourly pay during the trial.



You are paid $50-$75 per signed vending location agreement.



The trial is considered successfully completed once 3 signed agreements are secured within the 14-day period.

Performance determines income.



Trial Expectations



During the 14-day trial, you are expected to:



Make high outbound call volume.



Speak directly with decision makers.



Overcome objections professionally.



Follow up persistently.



Secure a minimum of 3 signed agreements.



Top performers will be offered:



Long-term commission structure



Higher per-deal payouts



Potential leadership role as team grows



We are building a serious outbound closing team.



You Are a Strong Fit If You:



Have closed sales before



Thrive in commission-based roles



Are confident speaking with U.S. business owners



Understand that follow-up closes deals



Are disciplined and self-motivated



Bonus Experience



Real estate cold calling



Merchant services



Solar / insurance sales



B2B contract sales



Commission-only roles



Requirements



Excellent spoken English



Stable internet connection



Quiet workspace



Ability to work U.S. business hours



Comfortable with:



Google Sheets



CRM tools



DocuSign or similar e-signature platforms



Application Process



Shortlisted candidates will:



Review our script



Record a mock closing call



Explain their follow-up strategy to secure signed agreements



Only serious closers should apply.



Thank you for your time and attention.

-Lorenzo

title: Real Estate Photo Editor
description:
Per-Project • Remote • Opportunity For Full-Time



We’re a growing marketing and media company working with real estate agents, builders, and construction companies across the U.S. We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Photo Editor to handle real estate listing photos, HDR bracketed images, and construction project photos on a per-project basis, with the opportunity to move into full-time as volume increases. This will be consistent project work.



What You’ll Be Editing



Real estate MLS listing photos



HDR bracketed photo sets (interior & exterior)



Construction & job-site photos (before / after, progress, detail shots)



Interior and exterior images



Daytime edits (no luxury compositing or heavy retouching)



Responsibilities



HDR blending and natural exposure balancing (no over-processed looks)



Color correction for accurate, neutral tones



Straightening verticals and correcting perspective



Exposure, contrast, white balance, and sharpness adjustments



Light, realistic sky replacements when needed



Removal of minor distractions (cords, trash bins, blemishes)



Maintain consistency across full photo sets



Deliver projects on time (usually 24–48 hours)



Required Skills



Strong experience with Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop



Proven ability to blend HDR images naturally



Understanding of MLS-ready real estate standards



Experience with batch workflows and presets



Strong attention to detail and consistency



Reliable communication and availability



Nice To Have



Construction or contractor photo editing experience



Experience editing high-volume MLS listings



Ability to match a reference style quickly



Comfortable with revisions when needed



Pay (Per Project)



Our current per-project rates are:



Up to 30 photos – $6 USD



31–50 photos – $10 USD



51–80 photos – $15 USD



Payment is per completed project.



Growth Opportunity



This role starts per project, but editors who are consistent, fast, and reliable will have the opportunity to receive ongoing weekly work and potentially move into a full-time role as our volume grows.



How To Apply



Please include:



A short introduction about your photo editing experience



Before/after examples, including HDR samples if available



Your typical turnaround time for a 30–50 photo HDR project



Confirmation that you’re comfortable with the listed project rates

title: Operations Manager (Ecommerce) – Remote
description:
E-Commerce Operations Manager (Inventory & Systems Focus)

Remote | Southeast Asia / Eastern Europe

Rate: USD 2,000 – 4,000 per month, depending on experience 





Role Overview



We are hiring an E-Commerce Operations Manager to build, fix, and own operational systems, with a strong emphasis on inventory management and process design.



This is not a coordinator role and not a task-only execution role.



You will be responsible for turning fragmented operations into clear, reliable systems, especially around inventory flow, forecasting, and cross-channel allocation. The right candidate is comfortable working in ambiguity, identifying what’s broken, and designing solutions without needing constant direction.





Core Responsibilities

Inventory & Operations Ownership (Primary Focus)

Design and own the end-to-end inventory flow, including:

Supplier / inbound stock

Warehouse or storage

Allocation across sales channels

Order fulfillment

Reconciliation and reporting

Diagnose broken or fragmented inventory setups and implement preventive systems to avoid:

Overselling

Stockouts

Dead or aging stock

Mismatched channel inventory

Build and maintain forecasting and buffer logic based on:

SKU velocity

Lead times

Promotion periods

Demand variability

Create inventory SOPs covering:

Allocation rules

Replenishment triggers

Exception handling

Reconciliation checks

Translate inventory data into clear operational decisions that protect revenue and cash flow





Marketplace & Day-to-Day Operations

Own daily e-commerce operations across marketplaces and/or DTC platforms

Ensure accurate SKU setup, pricing, and inventory sync across channels

Coordinate with fulfillment partners or 3PLs to ensure reliable order execution

Identify operational bottlenecks and resolve them directly

Support campaign and promo periods by adjusting inventory and allocation logic



Experience with Shopee and Lazada is preferred but not required.

 



What matters most is how you think about inventory and operations, not just the platforms you’ve used.





Process Building & Internal Structure

Build structure where none exists — especially in fast-moving or fragmented environments

Document workflows and SOPs so operations are repeatable and scalable

Establish basic reporting to track:

Inventory health

Order accuracy

Fulfillment performance

Work closely with leadership to surface operational risks early and propose solutions





What We’re Looking For

You are likely a fit if you:

Have hands-on experience owning inventory operations, not just supporting them

Can clearly explain an inventory flow from inbound to sale

Have fixed a broken inventory or fulfillment system before

Understand forecasting and buffer logic, not just tools or dashboards

Are comfortable making operational decisions with imperfect data

Prefer execution, ownership, and accountability over meetings and coordination





What This Role Is NOT

? Not a purely administrative or coordination role

? Not limited to “updating inventory in the system”

? Not a role where everything is already structured for you





This role requires thinking, designing, and owning systems.





Tools & Platforms (Experience Helpful, Not Mandatory)

Marketplaces: Shopee, Lazada, Amazon, TikTok Shop (any combination)

Platforms: Shopify, WooCommerce, or similar

Inventory tools, spreadsheets, or WMS — logic matters more than tools





Work Setup

Remote

Flexible working hours (operations-driven, not fixed shifts)

Occasional weekend availability may be required during peak periods





Compensation

Rate: Depends on experience

We value operators who prevent revenue loss and operational failures





How We Evaluate Candidates

During interviews, candidates will be asked to:

Explain or draw an inventory flow

Describe a broken inventory system they fixed

Walk through their forecasting and buffer logic





If you enjoy building structure, fixing what’s broken, and owning outcomes — this role is for you.



Interested applicants may apply directly through this link:

title: Credit Repair Virtual Assistant
description:

Are you detail-oriented, organized, and experienced in credit repair? BP Credit Shield is looking for a reliable Credit Repair Virtual Assistant to support our growing client base and ensure every file is handled with precision and care.

Complaint Filing: File and manage complaints with relevant agencies (CFPB, FTC, Attorney General, etc.) when necessary.



Client Updates: Communicate progress updates and respond to client inquiries professionally.



Progress Tracking: Monitor dispute timelines, results, and reinsertions while keeping records up to date in our systems.



Administrative Support: Handle task tracking, documentation, and internal updates with accuracy.



Requirements:



Prior experience in credit repair or a closely related field (required).



Strong understanding of credit reports, dispute strategies, and compliance.



Excellent written English and clear professional communication.



Highly organized, detail-focused, and able to manage multiple files efficiently.



Ability to work independently within structured SOPs and systems.



High integrity and confidentiality when handling sensitive financial data.



What We Offer:



Stable, long-term remote position.



Training on our systems, workflows, and dispute processes.



Opportunity to grow within a fast-scaling credit repair and funding company.



Work with a team that genuinely helps clients change their financial lives.



Please do not apply if you are currently working with multiple credit repair companies

What You Get:

eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

title: Construction Assistant (Cost-Focused)
description:
About Us

We are a rapidly growing construction builder and developer based in the San Jose / South Bay Area, backed by AlphaX RE Capital. Our projects range from single-family homes and ADUs to larger community developments. We emphasize precision, efficiency, and strong cost management across every stage of the construction process.



Core Responsibilities (Cost Management Emphasis)

- Assist in preparing project cost budgets, including preliminary estimates, detailed budgets, and cost baselines.

- Perform cost control and dynamic cost tracking, monitoring actual expenditures against planned budgets.

- Prepare regular cost forecasts, variance analyses, and financial reports for project and executive teams.

- Review and analyze bids, subcontractor proposals, and material quotations, supporting cost comparison and value engineering efforts.

- Track and document the cost impact of change orders, maintaining accurate and up-to-date cost logs.

- Support remote coordination of project schedules, budgets, procurement activities, and contract documentation.

- Collaborate virtually with architects, engineers, designers, and contractors to maintain alignment on cost and schedule impacts.



Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

- Strong understanding of construction budgeting, cost control, forecasting, and cost monitoring methodologies.

- Proficient with project management software and remote collaboration platforms.

- Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

- Ability to interpret construction drawings and support bid reviews, procurement, and contract management.

- Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architecture, or a related field.

- 2 years+ of experience in construction cost control, estimating, or project coordination.

- Professional certifications (e.g., PMP, OSHA, cost-related credentials) are a plus.



Preferred Qualifications (not required):

- Familiarity with California building codes, permitting requirements, and construction standards

- Experience using Procore or similar construction management platforms

- Working knowledge of MS Project for cost tracking, reporting, and workflow management

- Chinese language skills



Job Overview

-Remote

-Shift/Schedule:

1) 9:00 am – 5:30 pm (Beijing Time) OR

2) 9:00 am – 5:30 pm (California Time)

Applicants will be asked to indicate which shift they are applying for during the interview process, and the final shift will be determined by the hiring manager.

title: Short-Form & Long-Form Content
description:
About the role: Full-time video editor for tech/creator content 
 - 34K+ followers). I need someone who can deliver consistent “lofi premium” aesthetic across ALL formats - think Ali Abdaal meets Peter McKinnon.

What you’ll edit monthly: 15-25 short-form videos (Reels/TikToks) and 2 long-form YouTube videos (5-12 minutes). Key requirement: Same brand identity across all content. Your YouTube edits should feel like extended versions of the Reels.

Must have: Portfolio with 10+ short-form examples AND 2-3 long-form videos (5-12 min), Expert in Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve, Experience with tech/AI/creator content, Hook-first editing, trending formats, captions, sound design, Good English communication, Fast turnaround: 24-48hrs short-form, 3-5 days long-form.

My style - YES: Clean, cinematic, authentic, smooth cuts, strategic b-roll, consistent branding. NO: Over-edited guru style, excessive zooms, generic stock music, flashy graphics.

What I’m looking for: Someone who learns my aesthetic quickly and delivers publish-ready content WITHOUT constant revisions. Once you nail my style, edits should need minimal feedback.

Compensation: $
USD/month (40 hrs/week). Rate based on experience, portfolio quality, and how fast you understand my vision.

To apply: Subject line “Editor - [Your Name]”. Include: 1) Portfolio links (REQUIRED - no portfolio = no review), 2) Brief intro about yourself, 3) Editing software you use, 4) Favorite YouTube creator and why. Shortlisted candidates get paid test project ($50 USD).

mbers.

title: Finance/Admin Manager
description:
Nuview Landscapes is a trusted landscaping and outdoor construction business delivering high-quality hardscaping and softscaping solutions across the Sutherland Shire, St George, and greater Sydney Metro region in Australia. We specialise in transforming outdoor spaces with custom features such as pergolas, pool surrounds, retaining walls, fencing, and more, all built with premium materials and expert craftsmanship. At Nuview, we pride ourselves on professionalism, clear communication, and delivering projects on time that exceed client expectations.



Monday - Friday 9am - 6pm AEDT/AEST time.



POSITION PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES

The primary responsibility for this position is to oversee the company’s financial and administrative functions to ensure

accurate record-keeping, compliance, and effective operational support. This role ensures financial processes are efficient

and administrative requirements are completed accurately and on time.

This role is responsible for, but not limited to:

1. Ensuring supplier price lists are accurate, up-to-date, and communicated to relevant teams.

2. Liaising with suppliers to obtain updated pricing and product information.

3. Coordinating with the bookkeeper to ensure timely and accurate financial records.

4. Processing wages, ensuring timesheet approvals are obtained from Project Managers.

5. Performing financial reconciliations, accounts payable/receivable oversight, and assisting with budgeting and

reporting.

6. Providing administrative support as a virtual assistant, including taking incoming calls, managing

correspondence, and booking onsite schedules for the Sales Manager.

7. Managing general administrative duties, including data entry, document preparation, and ad hoc tasks as

required.

8. Providing guidance and support to management and staff on HR, finance, and administrative matters.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

Finance:

• Maintain accurate financial records and perform reconciliations as required.

• Liaise with the bookkeeper to ensure timely financial reporting.

• Process wages, superannuation, and other payroll-related tasks.

• Monitor budgets, financial transactions, and project costs.

• Ensure supplier invoices are correct, coded accurately, and processed on time.

• Prepare reports and financial summaries for management.



Administration/Virtual Assistant:

• Take incoming calls, respond to queries, and manage
 correspondence.

• Book onsite schedules for the Sales Manager and assist with calendar management.

• Maintain accurate data entry across systems and project records.

• Prepare business documents, correspondence, and reports as required.

• Assist with ad hoc administrative tasks to support operations.

• Ensure records, files, and systems are organised, up-to-date, and accessible.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

• Strong experience in finance and administration, ideally within the construction or landscaping industry.

• Excellent organisational and time management skills.

• Strong understanding of payroll, financial reporting, and accounting principles.

• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

• High attention to detail and accuracy.

• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

• Proficiency in MS Office and accounting software.

• Professional, approachable, and reliable.

• Experience in virtual assistant duties, including managing calls, schedules, and
s.



GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

• Represent Nuview Landscapes professionally and uphold company values.

• Ensure compliance with internal policies, OH&S regulations, and external legal requirements.

• Identify opportunities to improve financial and administrative processes.

• Support management in decision-making by providing accurate and timely information.

• Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.

• Provide virtual support to staff, ensuring smooth communication and coordination across teams

title: Video Editor
description:
Graphic Designer



1. Is This You?



Do you love turning briefs into scroll-stopping ad creatives?

Do you enjoy designing clean, high-converting static images for Meta ads?

Do you feel confident taking a concept (copy, angle, theme) and translating it into polished, premium visuals?

Do you obsess over layout, typography, colors, and small details that make an ad stand out?

Do you enjoy being part of a team where everyone collaborates, learns, and contributes?

Do you enjoy clear direction and creative execution without handling copy, strategy, or media buying?



If yes, you might be the Graphic Designer we are looking for.



2. About Nordic Ritual



Nordic Ritual is Denmark’s fastest-growing skincare brand against acne, founded in Scandinavia in December 2023. We specialize in science-backed skincare solutions designed to deliver clinic-level results at home, without high costs or hassle.



We are currently in a scaling phase and expanding into the US, Canada, Australia, and the UK, building on our rapid growth in Europe.



In less than a year, we have built a loyal community that trusts us to deliver visible results. Our growth is driven by innovation, integrity, and a strong commitment to customer satisfaction.



Our vision is to redefine acne care globally and become the most trusted skincare brand against acne.



3. Role Summary



We are hiring a Graphic Designer focused on static creatives for Meta ads 
 and Instagram).



Your primary focus is simple:

Execute ads visually based on the briefs we provide.



We handle copy, angles, hooks, concepts, and messaging. You bring everything to life through clean, high-performing design.



One day per week, the team will spend a few hours on:



Customer understanding and empathy research

Analyzing what is working in the ad account

Identifying new angles and opportunities

Reviewing winning creatives

Brainstorming new concepts, visual styles, and formats

This ensures alignment, learning, and continuous creative improvement.



You will work primarily in Figma with a structured and easy-to-follow workflow.



4. Responsibilities



Turn briefs (copy, angle, offer, theme) into finished static ad creatives in Figma

Create clean, premium, on-brand layouts optimized for Meta ads

Deliver multiple visual variations when needed

Ensure all creatives follow Nordic Ritual’s visual identity

Prepare and organize Figma files for easy reuse and updates

Collaborate with the marketing team for feedback and improvements

Join weekly creative review and customer insight sessions

Occasionally design related assets (simple banners,
 graphics, thumbnails)

5. Qualifications



Must-Haves



Proven experience designing static creatives for Meta ads

Strong skills in Figma (primary tool)

Portfolio showing e-commerce or direct-response ad creatives

Strong understanding of layout, typography, color, and visual hierarchy

Ability to execute briefs quickly and accurately

Reliable communication and ability to meet deadlines

Comfortable giving and receiving feedback in a team environment

Nice-to-Haves



Experience with TikTok, YouTube, or Google Display creatives

Basic photo editing (skin, product, background cleanup)

Light motion or animation skills (not required)

6. Success Metrics (KPIs)



(To be discussed and agreed upon together)



Number of quality ad creatives delivered weekly

Turnaround time from brief to final delivery

Visual consistency across campaigns

Ad performance indicators (CTR, TSR, CPR)

Contribution in weekly creative review sessions

7. What We Offer



Competitive pay (approximately $4 to $7 per hour, depending on experience) plus performance bonuses

Clear creative direction (you design, we handle strategy)

Weekly team sessions to grow your skills

Long-term, stable role

Flexible working hours

100 percent remote

Supportive, fast-growing, ambitious company culture

8. How to Apply (Follow Exactly)



You must write an X in the subject line.



In your application, please:



Tell us what you specifically love about this Graphic Designer (Meta Ads) position

Attach your portfolio with Meta/static ad creatives (mandatory)

Attach a short video introducing yourself (30 to 90 seconds)

Attach your CV (with photo)

Attach a screenshot of your internet speed

Please only apply if you are serious about a long-term opportunity and meet the requirements.



Applications written by ChatGPT or AI will be disregarded.



We look forward to seeing why you are the perfect fit for this role.



Job Type: Full-time

title: B2B Cold Calling Appointment Setter  $3–$5/hr Base + Performance Bonuses
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

We are hiring a B2B Cold Calling Appointment Setter to book qualified appointments with business owners for our AI automation and digital marketing services. This is a performance-based, full-time role for experienced callers who can prospect leads, cold call, qualify decision-makers, and consistently book appointments.



IMPORTANT – PLEASE READ

• This role is not for candidates looking only for a fixed hourly job

• This role is for performance-driven individuals who want to earn more through bonuses and commissions

• Top performers can earn $10–$15+ per hour combining base pay and bonuses



WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

• Prospecting and sourcing leads (light lead generation)

• Cold calling B2B business owners

• Qualifying prospects based on need, fit, and decision-maker status

• Booking qualified appointments directly into our calendar

• Following scripts while sounding confident and professional

• Logging call results and notes in our CRM



DAILY PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

• 150–200 cold calls per day

• 3–4 qualified appointments booked per day



A qualified appointment means a real business owner, real need, and genuine interest.



REQUIREMENTS

• Proven experience in cold calling or appointment setting

• Experience working with B2B, AI, SaaS, or digital marketing services

• Comfortable speaking with business owners

• Understanding of the following concepts:

  • AI automation

  • AI or smart websites

  • SEO and online presence

  • CRM systems (GoHighLevel experience is a plus)

• Well-spoken in English with clear pronunciation and professional tone

• Confident handling objections and business-level conversations

• Goal-driven, disciplined, and performance-focused



PAY AND EARNING POTENTIAL

• $3–$5 per hour base pay (based on experience and performance)

• Performance bonuses per qualified appointment

• Commission opportunities per closed deal

• High performers earn $10–$15+ per hour



GROWTH AND ADVANCEMENT

High-performing setters may advance into the following roles:

• Senior Appointment Setter

• Team Lead or Appointment Manager

• Training or Quality Control roles



Growth is based on performance, consistency, and leadership.



SCHEDULE

• Full-time only

• Monday through Friday

• U.S. business hours preferred



HOW TO APPLY

Please include the following in your application:

• Your cold calling or appointment-setting experience

• Industries you have worked in

• Tools you have used (dialers, CRM, GoHighLevel if applicable)

• Your average daily call volume in previous roles

• A voice sample (strongly preferred)



FINAL NOTE

This is a results-driven role with clear expectations, strong earning potential, and real career growth. If you can hit the numbers and communicate professionally, you will be rewarded.

description:

- Lead handling and appointment scheduling

- Sales coaching and business guidance to ensure they win

In the first 3 months, our average client generates an 11.2x ROAS (50?ove market average), and I need YOU to help us continue delivering these amazing results!



**Your Role**

Your role is to support a marketing strategist by executing their strategies with accuracy and attention to detail so campaigns run smoothly, data stays clean, and clients get consistent results.

If you love structured tasks, clear expectations, and being the person everyone can count on, you’ll love this job.

Your main day-to-day tasks will be:

- Launch and manage Meta campaigns.

- Set up new clients inside our systems (GoHighLevel, Google Sheets, ClickUp)

- Handle the creative process from requesting client content to collaborating with the creative editor to turn the content into converting creatives.

- Analyze all sorts of data (lead quality, geographic data, engagement, cost per appointment, cost per sale, ROAS) and generate reports.

- Documenting test results and other client information.



**Requirements (Deal Breakers)**

- Flawless spoken & written English. (Improper written English is a deal breaker)

- Great process adherence. Can reliably follow SOPs and procedures without mistakes.

- Excellent communicator & team player.

- Extremely fast learner.

- Strong time management & prioritization.

- 1y+ experience of
 ads (Knows how to set up campaigns, launch ads, run split tests, spot ad fatigue, spot performance issues, etc.)



**Details**

- Schedule: 40 hours, Monday to Friday, 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern time

- Unlimited paid time off: Take vacations anytime, as long as your work is covered.

title: Social Media Strategist & Content Creator for Online Fitness Brand (Growth-Focused)
description:
I’m an online fitness coach building a scalable personal brand and coaching business. I’m looking for a Social Media Strategist & Content Creator who can help take my online presence to the next level — strategically, creatively, and structurally.



This is not a basic VA role.



I need someone who understands brand growth, content strategy, and lead generation, not just posting for the sake of posting.



You will play a key role in helping shape my content direction, refine my messaging, and build systems that support long-term business growth.





What You’ll Be Responsible For

 • Developing a clear social media strategy aligned with business growth

 • Planning and creating high-performing content (Reels, TikToks, posts, captions)

 • Helping position me as an authority in the fitness & coaching space

 • Creating content systems, calendars, and workflows

 • Bringing proactive ideas to grow reach, engagement, and leads

 • Supporting launches, offers, and marketing campaigns

 • Tracking what works and adjusting strategy accordingly





This Role Is FOR You If

 • You think strategically, not just creatively

 • You understand Instagram & TikTok growth (especially short-form video)

 • You’re confident making suggestions and leading content direction

 • You enjoy helping businesses scale, not just “doing tasks”

 • You want a long-term role and to grow with a brand





This Role Is NOT For You If

 • You only follow instructions and wait to be told what to post

 • You don’t understand how content leads to sales

 • You’ve never worked on a brand’s growth before

 • You’re looking for a short-term or one-off gig





Preferred (But Not Required)

 • Experience working with fitness coaches, personal trainers, or online brands

 • Strong understanding of hooks, storytelling, and conversions

 • Video editing skills (CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, etc.)

 • Copywriting or sales-driven content experience





To apply, please answer the following:

 1. Briefly describe your experience with social media growth

 2. What makes content convert into leads or sales?

 3. Share 1–2 examples of accounts you’ve helped grow (or content you’re proud of)

 4. If you were growing an online fitness coach’s brand, what would you focus on first?



Applicants who do not answer these questions will not be considered. Start your application with the word “GROWTH” so I know you’ve read the full post.

title: Customer Support Officer I (Remote-Singapore)
description:
The Customer Support Officer (CSO) is the most important first point of contact with the customers. As the reputation of My Drum School is first perceived by the customer on the phone or
, the CSO needs to be equipped with the relevant knowledge of the Company’s procedures, processes, and it is important that we accommodate our customers' needs accurately so as to ensure that the issue/query is resolved timely.



The CSO also works in a supporting role by partnering with the Managers to enhance our programs and services. As a leading brand in the industry, he/she has a critical role in ensuring that our brand maintains its service standards.



===============

Responsibilities:



• Availability to work on weekends (Saturday and Sunday) as required, 6-day work week. 

• Deliver exceptional customer support to a student base of 900+ at My Drum School.

• Demonstrate a friendly and engaging personality for effective over-the-phone communication.

• Address customer inquiries and questions regarding drum lessons through various channels, including Zendesk, WhatsApp, and phone calls, on a daily basis.

• Initiate daily service calls to welcome and assist new customers who have recently signed up.

• Foster positive relationships with customers, addressing and resolving complaints to build brand loyalty.

• Provide timely support to educators on leave by coordinating with customers and arranging alternative relief educators.

• Efficiently manage studio make-up bookings, rental bookings, and educator bookings with professionalism and promptness.

• Prepare and maintain customer-related reports, such as Enquiries Tracking, Leave Tracking, and Daily Reporting.

• Establish effective communication with all educators to ensure a comprehensive understanding of operational processes, contributing to a seamless customer experience.

• Acquire an in-depth knowledge of the organization's programs and services.

• Perform additional CSO-related duties and tasks, or adapt to changes in services, as mutually agreed upon by the Parties.



===============

Working Hours:

Mon, Wed, Thur, Fri: 9am to 5.30pm

Sat, Sun: 11am to 5pm

Rest day: Tuesday



- Follow Singapore Calendar

- 1 year re-newable contract

- 6 day work week including sat and sun

title: Real Estate Cold Caller – Wholesale Lead Gen (Base + Bi-Monthly Raises)
description:
We are a fast-growing Real Estate Wholesaling firm looking for two (2) relentless Cold Callers to help us find our next off-market deals. We are looking for "A-players" who understand how to talk to homeowners and identify motivation.



???? Compensation & Longevity

We value loyalty. We don’t want to retrain new people every month, so we reward those who stay:

Starting Pay: $4.00/hour - 5.00/hour

Guaranteed Raises: +$0.50/hr every 3 months of active employment.

Pay Ceiling: $10.00/hour.

Call Hours: 11am - 7pm EST

Closing Bonus: You will receive a cash bonus for every lead you generate that results in a closed wholesale deal. (5% of the deal)



???? Your Role: Finding the Deals

The Mission: Cold call distressed property owners, out-of-state landlords, and motivated sellers.

The Goal: Qualify leads based on Condition, Timeline, Motivation, and Price (4 Pillars).

The Volume: 8 hours per day. We provide a multi-line dialer and high-quality skip-traced lists.

Data Management: Accurately update lead status in our CRM.



? Requirements

Fluent English: You must be able to build rapport and sound conversational, not robotic.

Wholesale Knowledge: Previous experience with Real Estate Wholesaling (Podio, Mojo, BatchDialer, etc.) is a huge plus.

Thick Skin: You will hear "No" often. You must be able to stay positive and move to the next call.

Hardware: A noise-canceling headset and high-speed internet are mandatory.

title: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant

Reports To:  CEO

Work Hours:  Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field.  We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact.  You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.  

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides.  Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products.  We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That’s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

Own, track, and optimize every cost that impacts Amazon unit economics, so leadership always has a clear, accurate, and optimized view of true ASIN-level profitability.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in this role means true Amazon profitability is no longer a guessing game. Every ASIN has a fully loaded cost that includes product cost, shipping, duties, Amazon fees, affiliate commissions, and ranking-related marketing spend. Leadership can confidently d
 which products to scale, reprice, suppress, liquidate, or discontinue based on real data — not blended averages or assumptions.



A top performer in this role consistently reduces total Amazon unit costs while improving cost visibility. Through tight auditing, proactive fee recovery, smarter shipping and duty tracking, and disciplined attribution of affiliate and ranking spend, this role directly increases contribution margin without increasing ad spend or revenue risk.



Primary Objectives

•  Amazon Fee, Shipping & Cost Auditing

Own end-to-end auditing of all Amazon, logistics, and ranking-related costs.

•  Fully Loaded ASIN-Level Unit Economics

Maintain accurate per-unit costs including shipping, duties, fees, affiliates, and marketing.

•  Cost Optimization & Reduction

Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities across fees, logistics, and promotional spend.

•  Profitability & Decision Support

Provide leadership with clean, reliable Amazon cost and margin reporting.  



Regular Work Activities

•  Audit all Amazon FBA fees (pick/pack, weight, storage, returns)

•  Track short-term and long-term storage fees by ASIN

•  Monitor aged inventory fees and cost exposure

•  Track AWD inbound, storage, and handling fees

•  Reconcile inbound placement fees

•  Track removal, disposal, and liquidation costs

•  Track international shipping costs (factory ? port ? Amazon)

•  Allocate shipping cost per unit by shipment and ASIN

•  Track duties, tariffs, customs, and brokerage fees

•  Maintain landed cost per unit calculations

•  Track affiliate commissions tied to Amazon sales

•  Attribute affiliate spend at ASIN or product-group level

•  Track ranking, launch, and promotional marketing costs

•  Identify unprofitable or fee-heavy SKUs

•  Submit and track Amazon reimbursement claims

•  Create monthly Amazon cost & margin reports

•  Monitor fee and cost trend anomalies

•  Maintain SOPs for Amazon cost tracking and audits



Key Skills Required

•  Understanding & ability to learn Amazon FBA fee structures

•  Strong grasp of landed cost accounting

•  Advanced spreadsheet skills

•  Experience with SKU-level profitability modeling

•  Strong analytical and investigative mindset

•  High attention to detail

•  Ability to reconcile complex datasets

•  Process-driven 

•  Cost-reduction oriented thinking

•  Clear written & verbal communication



People Contacts and Interactions – What are the primary people contacts in this job (who, why, and how often)?

•  Direct report to the CEO

•  Frequent communication with

• Operations Team

• Logistics Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education 

•  2+ years working with Amazon Seller Central data

•  Experience tracking shipping, duties, and landed costs

•  Familiarity with FBA, AWD, and storage fee structures

•  Advanced spreadsheet proficiency required

•  E-commerce or marketplace finance experience preferred

•  Experience submitting Amazon reimbursement claims preferred

•  Comfortable owning ASIN-level economics end-to-end

•  Strong personal accountability

•  Not responsible for tax, payroll, AR/AP, or general bookkeeping     



How to Apply:

Click the link - 

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
MyStudio is a SaaS (software-as-a-service) suite of products that gives fitness, martial arts, and other membership-based business owners the freedom that comes from automating and simplifying how customers buy from them — making them more money at all hours of the day, saving them money, and granting them more time. We currently partner with over 2,000 fitness and children’s education studios across the world. Learn more about us here: 
.



Are you passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences? Do you thrive on solving challenges and ensuring customer satisfaction? Join our dynamic team as a Technical Customer Support Specialist and be the front line of our commitment to excellence. As a key player in our customer support team, you'll have the opportunity to engage with customers, address their inquiries, and provide solutions with enthusiasm and expertise. If you're ready to be a pivotal part of a company that values outstanding service, teamwork, and growth, we invite you to apply today.



This is a remote position to work from the Philippines.



Key Responsibilities:



- Receive, prioritize, and manage customer support inquiries via multiple channels such as chat, phone and
.

- Ensure accurate documentation of customer interactions and resolutions.

- Understand the product and client well so that you can provide accurate, timely, and friendly responses to clients contacting us.

- Work closely with the ticket and technical support team to troubleshoot and resolve software-related issues.

- Escalate complex issues to the appropriate teams and follow up to ensure timely resolution.

- Communicate with customers to gather necessary information and provide updates on their inquiries and issues.

- Respond promptly to customer inquiries and issues with a high level of professionalism and customer service.

- Evaluate our current customer support system and work with your team to strategically improve the process to better serve our customers.

- Contribute to the development and maintenance of a comprehensive knowledge base for common customer queries and issues.

- Provide input on improving documentation and support processes.

- Gather customer feedback and insights to identify areas for improvement in our products and services.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement improvements based on customer input.



Effectiveness in this role will be measured by key performance indicators such as:

- Customer satisfaction ratings, including CSAT and NPS

- Average time to resolve customer issues

- Average number of issues resolved



Role Requirements:

- 3+ years of experience in a technical support or similar role

- High school diploma or equivalent; bachelor's degree preferred

- A heart for customers, empathy and a go-getter attitude to help them resolve their issues

- Proficiency in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills

- Basic grammar skills and average typing 40 - 60 WPM

- Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution skills

- Proficient in using customer service software and databases

- Passion for designing and enhancing systems and organizing

- Proficiency in managing and interpreting data

- A stable, high-speed internet connection with a reliable backup

- Ability and availability to work during US working hours - Eastern Time

- Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively

- Ability to collaborate with other tea
mbers and departments

- Attention to detail and strong organizational skills

- A positive demeanor - we work hard, but need to have fun

- Comfort with change - we are rapidly scaling as a company, and things are dynamic and exciting - are you okay with that?



Why Work For MyStudio?

- The chance to get in on the “ground floor” of a tech company with startup energy

- The ability to make a difference from day one

- The power to make a positive difference in fitness, children’s education, and other membership-based industries doing admirable work

- A competitive salary



Compensation: $
per month



Working hours:



40 hour work week with a shift between 8 am and 8 pm EST (alternating across tea
mbers)

Must be able to work Saturdays 9 am - 5 pm EST (will rotate)



The total working hours would be 45 hours per week: 40 working hours and 5 hours of unpaid lunch breaks.

We will be using Hubstaff to track time and activity.

title: HVAC Dispatcher (ServiceTitan Experience Required)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented HVAC Dispatcher / Service Coordinator to manage daily service schedules, technician communication, and job documentation. This role is critical to keeping jobs on track, parts accounted for, and customers properly informed. Accuracy, organization, and follow-through are essential.



Key Responsibilities

 • Dispatch and schedule residential HVAC service and install calls

 • Manage technician schedules and adjust routes throughout the day as conditions change

 • Monitor job progress and update statuses accurately in ServiceTitan

 • Communicate clearly with technicians regarding job details, priorities, and changes

 • Track parts used, ordered, and needed for each job and ensure proper documentation in ServiceTitan

 • Coordinate with technicians and the office to ensure required parts are available before scheduled work

 • Follow up on backordered or special-order parts and update job timelines accordingly

 • Debrief technicians after every call and accurately update job notes, parts usage, and internal trackers

 • Coordinate with CSRs to ensure customers receive accurate updates

 • Handle same-day changes, reschedules, and time-sensitive issues calmly and efficiently

 • Ensure all jobs, notes, and parts are properly documented before closing



What We’re Looking For

 • Prior HVAC, home service, or dispatch experience preferred

 • Strong attention to detail — accuracy matters in scheduling, documentation, and parts tracking

 • Comfortable working in ServiceTitan or similar dispatch / CRM software

 • Organized and proactive communicator with technicians and office staff

 • Ability to manage multiple moving pieces in a fast-paced environment

 • Takes ownership of mistakes and works to prevent repeat errors

 • Team-first mindset with a strong sense of accountability



This Role Is NOT For Someone Who

 • Skips documentation or leaves notes incomplete

 • Struggles to track parts, job details, or follow-ups

 • Avoids accountability or blames systems or others for errors

 • Needs constant supervision to maintain accuracy

title: Data Scientist/Analyst
description:
Location: Remote (U.S.-based and Pacific Time hours GMT-8)

Position Type: Full-time PST hours required

Department: Data & Analytics

 

About Us

Power Direct Energy (PDE) and the Power Direct Community Foundation (PDCF) work hand-in-hand to deliver high-impact energy-efficiency and community-outreach programs across the country. PDE is a woman-owned, data-driven field engagement company specializing in precision mapping, door-to-door outreach, and Energy Ambassador programs. PDCF is our sister 501(c)(3) nonprofit Community-Based Organization focused on larger community education, equity, and workforce development—leveraging the same hyper-targeted data and analytics that power PDE’s results.

Together, we use data to improve energy efficiency, expand access to clean energy programs, and support utilities and energy companies nationwide. We are seeking a Data Scientist who thrives at turning complex data into insights that drive strategy, outreach effectiveness, and real-world impact.

About the Role



The Data Scientist will lead analytics across both entities—supporting PDE’s operational and field-level insights, while also driving PDCF’s community and equity-focused analytics. This role combines technical depth, creativity, and strategic thinking. You will be building models, dashboards, forecasts, GIS overlays, and predictive insights that directly inform where teams go, which households need the most help, and how programs can achieve maximum impact.



What You’ll Do

Data Collection & Preparation

• Integrate and clean data from field apps, GIS systems, APIs, surveys, utility datasets, and partner platforms.

• Ensure consistency, quality, and reliability across large program datasets.



Analysis & Business Insight Development

• Identify trends and patterns to support targeting, segmentation, yield modeling, and program optimization.

• Build dashboards and visualizations for leadership, client partners, and nonprofit stakeholders.

• Provide clear, actionable recommendations based on your analysis.



Predictive Modeling & Machine Learning

• Develop models around outreach yield, participation likelihood, building characteristics, energy inefficiency, and community need.

• Train, test, and deploy algorithms; validate accuracy and improve performance over time.



GIS & Outreach Targeting

• Create census-tract, LIDAC, and neighborhood-level overlays to support precision outreach.

• Map demographic, building, and income characteristics to identify high-impact zones.

• Support both PDE’s door-to-door strategies and PDCF’s community-wide efforts.



Thermal & Building Performance Analytics (PDE/PDCF field programs)

• Analyze FLIR thermal-imaging data to detect building-shell deficiencies and household energy loss.

• Identify common leak patterns and translate results into actionable homeowner insights.



Program Reporting & Automation

• Build automated pipelines for ongoing program reporting, forecasting, and performance dashboards.

• Help develop tools that streamline internal operations, pricing models, field planning, and community impact reports.



Cross-Functional Collaboration

• Work closely with leadership, field operations, program managers, nonprofit partners, energy companies and client utilities.

• Translate complex data into easy-to-understand takeaways that influence outreach strategy, budget allocation, and program design.



What You’ll Bring

• Solid proven excellence in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Analysis, or related field.

• Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, Mapinfo, ArcGIS, Power BI, and data science libraries.

• Experience with dashboards (Tableau, Power BI, Looker), cloud environments, and GIS tools.

• Ability to translate analytical findings into practical business or community recommendations.

• Experience with large datasets and predictive modeling.

• Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.

 

Bonus Points

• Experience in energy efficiency, utilities, clean energy

• Background with thermal imaging, FLIR devices, or building performance data.

• Experience working with field data collection.

 

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

• Mission-driven impact: The data you build will directly help households save energy and money, and support underserved communities.

• Innovation-forward culture: We leverage real-time field intelligence, mapping, and technology to solve real problems.

• Dual experience: Support a fast-moving, woman-owned energy outreach company (PDE) and a nonprofit CBO (PDCF) dedicated to broader community impact.

dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

title: WordPress Website Specialist (Koala Booking System Experience Preferred)
description:
We are a growing residential cleaning company looking for a reliable, detail-oriented WordPress Website Specialist to help update, optimize, and maintain our website.



Our website is built on WordPress and integrated with a cleaning-business booking platform called BookingKoala for online booking, scheduling, and payments. While prior BookingKoala experience is not required, experience with any online booking or scheduling system is strongly preferred.



We already have a clear, detailed list of website updates and improvements that need to be completed (attached), and we are looking for someone who can confidently handle all items on that list.



This role may begin as a project-based engagement, with the opportunity for ongoing monthly website support if it’s a good fit.



Primary Responsibilities

-You will be responsible for completing all items outlined in the attached task list, including but not limited to:

-Updating and optimizing WordPress pages (content, layout, formatting)

-Improving website usability and customer booking experience

-Fixing broken links, formatting issues, and layout inconsistencies

-Ability to follow instructions and complete tasks accurately

-Clear written English communication

How This Project Will Work

-A detailed task list outlining all required website updates



You will:

-Review the task list and confirm understanding (below)

-Test all booking-related functionality before final delivery



Compensation

-Your estimated timeline to complete all tasks



Opportunity for ongoing monthly work after the initial project



To Apply (Important)

Please include the following in your application:

-Your experience with WordPress

-Any experience with booking or scheduling platforms (name the tools you’ve used)

-Have you worked with any booking, scheduling, or form-based systems before? If yes, which platforms and what tasks did you handle?

-Examples of WordPress websites you’ve worked on

-Confirmation that you reviewed the below task list

-Your estimated cost and timeline



Applications that do not address these points may not be considered.



Tasks for 

Ensure "contact us" form is sent to admin

Update area of business (currently inaccurate)

Import Google Reviews into "Live Reviews" carousel

Update icons on booking page (have definitions when hover over the icons)

Allow people to complete booking/check-out on booking page (currently no way to finish booking, pay, etc.)

Allow people to select days/times on booking page (ideally they can select 2-3 preferred days/times)
