Update second "Book Now" button to redirect to Booking page (currently goes to "about" page)

List "Vacation Rental" option on booking page

Update "House Cleaning" thumbnail to read "Standard Cleaning"

List "Household Help" option on booking page

Line up icons with contact info on bottom of page/footer

separate out "move-in/move-out" cleaning from "deep cleaning" as different options on booking page

Remove "Home Organization" thumbnail

Update "Household Help" thumbnail to read "Household Help & Home Organization"

Update FAQs "How do I book a cleaning service ?"

Update FAQs "Are your cleaners trained and insured?"

Update testimonials section at bottom of the page (use google reviews)

Update "House Help & Home Organization" to say "Household Help & Home Organization"

Update "Services" menu at page footer to combine "Household Help" and "Home Organization" into "Household Help & Home Organization"

Update "Testimonials" page by importing google reviews

"Update booking page to include:

-confirm whether house is more/less than 2,500 sq ft (can we automate this by pulling from 
 data and/or county data)?

-if its a first time clean/new customer recommend doing a deep clean initially and then a standard/maintenance clean afterwards

-ask for condition of house if customer selects deep clean (is there heavy build-up) select ""yes""/""no"" ->add note that if cleaner evaluates that there is heavy build-up when onsite there will be a surcharge."

Update pricing page to include Vacation Rental Restocking add-on

Update vacation rental services page content

Create City-Targeted Service Pages 

Add Local Structured Data (Schema) to all site pages

title: Senior Next.js/TypeScript Developer for Training SaaS (UI Implementation & Logic Refinement)
description:
About the Project:

We are looking for a skilled Full Stack Developer to jump into an existing, production-grade SaaS application ("Your Safety Partners Portal"). The app is a multi-tenant safety management platform with a focus on Training/LMS features.

We have an existing codebase and a fresh set of designs. We need you to bridge the gap: implement the new UI designs pixel-perfectly and modify the existing logic to support these changes.

The Tech Stack (Must Have):

This is NOT a beginner role. You must be comfortable with:

• Next.js 15 (App Router): We use Server Actions extensively.

• TypeScript (Strict): No any types. We prioritize type safety.

• Styling: Tailwind CSS, Radix UI, and Shadcn UI.

• Database: PostgreSQL with Kysely query builder (connected via Neon).

• State: React Context & React Hook Form (with Zod validation).

What You Will Do:

1. UI/UX Implementation: Take our new designs (Figma/Mockups) and implement them into the existing Next.js application, focusing specifically on the Training & Course Management modules.

2. Logic Modification: Refactor existing Server Actions and Components to match the new workflows. You won't be rewriting the whole app, but you will be modifying how Courses, Modules (SCORM/Documents), and User Assignments work.

3. Clean Code: We follow a "Minimal Abstraction" philosophy. We prefer readable, locatable code over over-engineered patterns. You must be able to read existing code (Middleware, RBAC, etc.) and follow the established patterns.

4. Bug Fixing: identifying and fixing UI regressions or logic errors introduced during the redesign.

Nice to Have (Bonus):

• Experience with SCORM or LMS platforms.

• Experience with Replicache or Local-First sync strategies.

• Experience with file uploads to AWS S3 via presigned URLs.

Who You Are:

• You pay attention to detail. If the design has 16px padding, you don't make it 20px.

• You are comfortable working in a large, existing codebase without breaking unrelated features.

• You communicate clearly and flag issues early.

How to Apply:

To ensure you have read this post, please do the following:

1. Send a message/email with the subject line: "Next.js Training Update - [Your Name]"

2. Include a link to your portfolio or GitHub profile.

3. Answer this specific question in your cover letter: "What is your preferred method for handling form validation in Next.js Server Actions?"

4. Tell me your availability (immediate start preferred).

Note: Generic copy-paste applications will be ignored. We are looking for a human who knows their code.

You will collaborate with our marketing team to create and iterate performance creatives, including AI-assisted UGC styles, dynamic edits, hooks, motion graphics, and more.

Edit short-form videos for paid ads 
, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube)

What We Offer

title: Bilingual Phone Representative (Remote, Full-Time)
description:
We seek a Bilingual Phone Representative with a medical background to join our remote team. The ideal candidate will be courteous, empathetic, and patient, with excellent communication skills in both English and Spanish. This role involves interacting with patients and addressing their inquiries related to cardiac device software and hardware.

, and other communications from users with inquiries regarding software programming,

title: Patient Collection Specialists
description:
We are searching for Patient Collection Specialists - In this position you will follow-up on aged accounts receivable to help ensure continuity of cash flow and to help secure resolution of account balances. We need someone who has knowledge of government, commercial and managed care reimbursement guidelines.



Responsibilities:



Performs audits of patient accounts to ensure accuracy and timely payment.

Evaluates patient accounts to determine appropriate responsibility

Contact patients regarding delinquent accounts and arrange mutually acceptable payment schedules.

Demonstrates the ability to deal with patients regarding sensitive financial matters and recaptures unpaid balances.

Receives and resolves patient billing complaints and questions.

Performs reconciliation of refund accounts; attaches documentation and forwards to Billing Manager to process refund checks.

Identifies problems on accounts and follows through to the conclusion.

Makes appropriate financial arrangements for payment of patient accounts; follows up to determine if payment arrangements are being met; contacts patients to resolve problems; responds to correspondence or telephone calls from patients about accounts.

Prepares write-off requests with appropriate documentation and submits to supervisor and/or Billing Manager.

Processes patient correspondence, including denial follow-up within 48 hours of receipt.

Works with provided aging to monitor patient account aging and follow up appropriately.

Maintains confidentiality in regards to patient account status and the financial affairs of clinic/corporation.



Qualifications: 

A minimum of two (2) years in collections and/or insurance follow-up.

Knowledge of government, commercial, and managed care reimbursement guidelines

Familiarity with all federal, state, and local legal aspects of collection activities

Ability to communicate effectively both oral, written and good interpersonal skills

Decision-making skills

Professional courtesy

Eclinicalworks software experience is a plus.



Skills: 

Access to a quiet workspace, your computer, high-speed internet, and a hands-free headset/noise cancelation for receiving calls and making calls.

Clear English Communication.  Strong communication skills are essential for collaborating with colleagues and patients.

Organizational Skills.  Be well-organized and detail-oriented, with excellent problem-solving abilities.

Self-Regulation. Prioritize tasks independently and manage your responsibilities effectively.

Data Entry Proficiency: Accurate data entry is crucial for successful billing and collections.

Comfort with Direct Communication:  Interact confidently with patients, managers, and tea
mbers.

Previous experience working from home is required.

Proficiency in medical billing and collections processes.

Compliance with HIPAA privacy regulations.



If you are interested in this position, please send us a message with the link to your CV and
 it to 
 you

title: Virtual Customer Experience Officer for Australian Business (Receptionist, Admin + Project Work)
description:
Virtual Receptionist / Administrator

Full-time (30hrs/week) | $5-8 AUD/hour | Sydney AEST Hours | Long-Term Role



We are hiring a confident, caring, and detail-oriented Virtual Customer Experience Officer to support two thriving Australian Businesses:



Carte Blanche Hair – a luxury salon delivering exquisite, high-touch experiences for self-expressed clients

Fixio Physiotherapy – a progressive clinic offering intelligent, empathetic care with clinical excellence



We are seeking a Virtual Receptionist / Administrator to become a long-term part of our operations team. This is a key role where you are the front line; the voice, the organizer, and the calm hand that ensures our client journey is flawless. You will support our in-salon and in-clinic teams by keeping bookings smooth, clients, informed, and back-end tasks running efficiently. 

It is best suited to someone who values structure, consistency, and professional growth in a stable remote role. It also requires uninterrupted availability during scheduled hours so we prefer applicants with minimal personal obligations during work time.



About the Role



This position combines front-line receptionist duties, administrative support, and light project management. You will be a key point of contact for our clients and an essential support for our internal team. You will be working closely with the business owners and 1–2 other admin tea
mbers in a professional, fast-paced environment.



3 Key Components of the Role



1. Receptionist Duties

You will be responsible for managing two phone lines throughout your shift.

Answering and making calls using DialPad

Booking and managing appointments via Fresha (Salon) and Cliniko (Clinic)

Responding to phone, SMS, and
 enquiries with clarity, warmth, and confidence

Guiding clients toward the correct services and practitioners

Maintaining a calm, professional tone at all times



2. Administration

Inbox and
 management

Calendar coordination and scheduling

Data entry and record management

Strong daily use of Google Workspace

Team communication via Slack, WhatsApp, and Outlook

Handling sensitive client and HR information with discretion and confidentiality

Reporting directly to the business owners



3. Project Management (Ad Hoc)

Supporting operational projects as needed

Creating or improving internal resources

Identifying efficiencies in workflows and systems

Assisting with the creation of policies and procedures

Taking initiative and thinking critically without constant supervision



We are looking for someone who is:



A confident and kind communicator with a clear phone manner

Experienced in reception, admin, or client-facing roles (bonus if in hair/healthcare)

Fluent in English with strong conversational, writing, and spelling skills

Highly competent with Google workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides, Gmail, etc.)

Comfortable learning and navigating systems like Fresha, Cliniko, Cliniqflows, and DialPad

Emotionally Intelligent, organised, and able to multitask

A proactive team player who values both excellence and warmth



Work Requirements



Must be available during Sydney (AEST) Timezone. You will need to be available for ALL of the hours below:

Monday to Friday at 1:00pm – 6:00pm AEST

Saturday at 8:00am – 3:00pm AEST

Starting at 30 hours per week (with potential to grow to 40 hours per week)

Flexibility to cover other shifts when required

Stable internet connection (backup preferred)

Reliable power supply

Professional, quiet work setup

Ability to remain online and responsive throughout the shift



What We Offer



Stable, long-term remote role

Clear expectations and structured workflows

Supportive team environment

Work with premium, established Australian brands

Potential for career growth into a leadership/practice manager role encompassing invoicing, billing, additional project work, and training of other tea
mbers.

Contract & Compensation

Rate: $5-8 AUD/hour (This will depend on experience and proficiency in required skills)

Initial 3-month Trial Contract

Role begins within 1 week with training to start

Long-term role with increasing hours and potential to grow full-time (40 hours)



**Please note that no other work is permitted during rostered hours due to workload. This role requires consistent daily presence and uninterrupted availability during scheduled hours. Please apply only if this aligns with your current lifestyle and work environment.**



How to Apply



All applications must be submitted exclusively via our Google Form. We do not accept applications or CVs through OnlineJobs.ph messages. 

To apply:

Carefully read the role description to ensure it aligns with your availability, work environment, and long-term goals

Complete the Google Form in full, providing clear and thoughtful responses

Access the Link Here: 



Only applications submitted through the Google Form will be reviewed. Incomplete or rushed responses will not be considered. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next stage, which may include a trial task.

We're looking for somebody who is teachable and can work very fast, so if you are a quick learner and can perform the tasks that we ask, you will be compensated very well. What are you waiting for? title: Executive Assistant & Operations Coordinator (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote|Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Part-Time Recipe Content & Instacart VA (Canva + Grocery Cart Setup)
description:
About the Brand



My Body, My Temple is a concierge-style telehealth wellness practice serving women in midlife. We focus on hormone balance, heart health, anti-inflammatory living, and personalized wellness — no cookie-cutter plans.



We provide high-touch, premium care and want every resource we share with our clients to reflect that same excellence.



Position Overview



We are looking for a detail-oriented, creative, and highly organized Virtual Assistant to help build our digital recipe library.



This role involves:



• Creating beautiful recipe cards in Canva using our brand template from recipes that I will source and provide from recipe books

• Organizing recipes by category (heart-healthy, anti-inflammatory, vegetarian, vegan, etc.)

• Building corresponding Instacart shopping carts

• Generating shareable Instacart links for clients

• Maintaining a structured digital recipe database

I will need approx 150 recipes



This is a part-time or PRN role with flexible hours.



What You Will Be Doing



Each week, you will:



Receive:



Recipe source



Full ingredient list



Instructions



Category (anti-inflammatory, vegetarian, etc.)



Create:



A polished recipe card in Canva (using brand template)



Clean, easy-to-read formatting



Ingredient checklist style layout



Cooking time + serving size formatting



Build:



An Instacart cart with all ingredients



Ensure correct quantities



Generate a shareable link



Deliver:



Final Canva file (PDF + editable)



Instacart shareable link



Organized folder structure in Google Drive



 Required Skills



• Strong Canva experience (portfolio required)

• Ability to follow brand guidelines

• Extremely detail-oriented (ingredient quantities must match recipe exactly)

• Experience using Instacart

• Strong written English

• Organized and deadline-driven

• Comfortable working independently



Bonus Skills (Not Required but Ideal)



• Nutrition or wellness interest

• Experience creating digital products

• Familiarity with anti-inflammatory or heart-healthy eating

• Experience building Notion or Airtable databases



Deliverables Per Recipe



For each recipe, we expect:



 Canva recipe card

 downloadable PDF version

 Instacart shopping cart link

 Proper file naming + categorized folder placement



 Compensation



Please include:



• Your hourly rate

• Your availability per week

• Your Canva portfolio

• A short description of your experience creating formatted content



This role may start at 5–10 hours per week and grow as our recipe library expands.



To Apply



Please begin your application with the word TEMPLE so we know you read the full description.



Also include:



A link to your Canva portfolio



A screenshot of a formatted recipe you’ve created (if available)



Confirmation that you are comfortable creating Instacart carts



Why This Role Matters



Our clients are busy, high-achieving women.

We want to remove the stress of meal planning and grocery shopping.



Your role helps make wellness simple, elegant, and actionable.

title: Influencer Program Manager & Social Scheduler
description:
About Pivyt



Pivyt is a fast-growing U.S. marketing agency. We manage a diverse portfolio of clients, and we pride ourselves on precision, speed, and high-level strategy. We are looking for a Remote Influencer Program Manager & Social Scheduler who can handle the fast-paced nature of agency life.



The Role



In this role, you aren’t just managing one brand—you are managing several. You will be the engine behind our clients' influencer programs and social media calendars. You’ll need to switch "brand voices" seamlessly and stay incredibly organized to ensure every client’s campaign is executed flawlessly.



Key Responsibilities



Influencer Campaign Management: Identify, vet, and outreach to influencers on behalf of our various clients.



Contract & Logistics: Manage the "nitty-gritty"—sending briefs, tracking shipments/product seeding, and ensuring influencers hit their deadlines.



Multi-Account Scheduling: Manage the content calendars for multiple clients. You will be responsible for the perfect staging and scheduling of all posts.



Client-Ready Reporting: Use tools to pull data and help create reports that show our clients the ROI of their influencer and social programs.



Quality Assurance: Ensure every caption, link, and tag is error-free before going live. In an agency, there is zero room for typos.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Elite English Proficiency: You will be representing our agency and our clients. Your written communication must be "on point," professional, and highly persuasive.



The "Agency Mindset": You must be able to multitask, prioritize urgent requests, and manage multiple projects simultaneously without getting overwhelmed.



Attention to Detail: If you are someone who misses the "small things," this is not the role for you.



Full-Time Commitment: This is a dedicated 40-hour-per-week position.



Bonus Points



Tool Experts: Experience with Metricool or Impact is a major plus.



Agency Experience: Previous experience working in a marketing or talent agency setting.



Project Management: Familiarity with Slack, ClickUp, or similar agency tools.



What We Offer



Salary: $800 – $1,000 USD per month.



Stability: Full-time, long-term remote work.



Growth: Exposure to a wide variety of industries and U.S.-based marketing strategies.

title: LinkedIn Research & Outreach Assistant (Part-Time, Contractor)
description:
We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented LinkedIn Research & Outreach Assistant to support professional networking and relationship-building activities.



This is not a sales role. You will not be pitching, closing, or negotiating. Your role is to research, organise, and assist with first-touch LinkedIn outreach using pre-written scripts and clear instructions.



This role is ideal for someone who is organised, professional, and comfortable following systems.



Key Responsibilities



*Research and build targeted LinkedIn lead lists (by industry, role, location)

*Send LinkedIn connection requests using approved messaging

*Track responses and organise contacts in a spreadsheet or CRM

*Book calls or introductions when instructed

*Maintain clean records and weekly activity reports

*Follow strict confidentiality and professionalism standards



What You Will NOT Be Doing



*No sales calls

*No cold calling

*No negotiating or representing authority

*No posting content on LinkedIn

*No improvising messages without approval



All messaging templates and workflows are provided.



Requirements



*Strong written English (professional, clear, polite)

*Experience with LinkedIn (personal or work use)

*High attention to detail

*Reliable internet and computer

*Comfortable following step-by-step instructions

*Able to work independently and communicate clearly



Experience as a VA, admin assistant, or outreach assistant is preferred but not required.



Hours & Pay 



*2 Days per week (16 Hours)

*AUD $7-$9 per hour, depending on experience

*Flexible schedule (task-based, not fixed shifts)

*Paid weekly or fortnightly

*Independent contractor role



Important Notes

*This is a long-term contractor role for the right person

*You will be required to sign a confidentiality agreement

*Professional conduct is essential at all times



Please include:



*A short introduction about yourself

*Your LinkedIn experience (if any)

*Your internet speed

title: EXPERIENCED GENERAL VIRTUAL ASSISTANT
description:
About Dreambound Inc.



Dreambound Inc. is a platform dedicated to facilitating upward mobility in America. Our mission is to help prospective students find the right educational programs across Healthcare, Technology, Business, and Trade and Industry so they can achieve their career goals. We connect students with 300+ schools, offer personalized coaching, and provide the support needed to take charge of their future. We are a fast-paced, mission-driven team committed to making education accessible and impactful.





The Opportunity

We are seeking a highly organized, experienced, and versatile General Virtual Assistant (VA) to join our team.

This role is best suited for a seasoned professional who thrives in dynamic environments, can manage multiple priorities independently, and brings a strong track record of administrative and operational support. You should be a proactive self-starter with excellent organizational skills, high accuracy, and the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new tools and systems.





This is a full-time, long-term role (40 hours per week).

Please use the code DreamTeam when applying through the link below.





Key Responsibilities

- Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

- Provide administrative and organizational support across multiple teams and stakeholders.

- Handle evolving assignments and projects with minimal supervision.

- Anticipate needs, take initiative, and contribute to process improvement and problem-solving.

- Conduct internet research and data collection to support strategic initiatives.

- Maintain accurate and organized records in internal databases and spreadsheets.

- Support tasks related to lead generation, demand generation, and basic SEO maintenance.





Requirements

- Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant, Executive Assistant, Operations Assistant, or similar role.

- Full-time availability (40 hours per week) with no other work commitments.

- Ability to work during Philippine day shift hours.

- Exceptional attention to detail and ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

- High level of autonomy, accountability, and problem-solving skills.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

- Comfortable working with spreadsheets, databases, and productivity tools.





Highly Valued

title: Social Media Graphic Designer
description:
Pivyt is a U.S. marketing agency that moves fast. We work with a variety of brands that require high-quality, high-frequency social media content. We are looking for a Graphic Designer who doesn't just make "pretty" things, but understands how to design for conversion and engagement on social media.



The Role



This isn't about spending 10 hours on a single illustration. This is about speed, systems, and style. You will be responsible for creating social-first assets (Instagram Carousels, Stories, Reels covers, LinkedIn graphics) that look premium and "American-made."



Key Responsibilities



Rapid Content Creation: Design high-quality social media posts across multiple client accounts with quick turnaround times.



Template Systems: Build and maintain easily duplicatable templates (in Canva or Adobe Suite) to ensure brand consistency and efficiency.



Adherence to "US Aesthetic": Execute designs that align with American design trends—clean layouts, modern typography, and strategic use of white space.



Light Copywriting/QA: Assist with placing captions and headlines into designs. Your English must be sharp enough to catch typos and ensure the text makes sense within the layout.



Brand Adaptation: Switch between different brand identities effortlessly, following established brand guidelines for various agency clients.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Keen Eye for American Design: You understand the U.S. market’s aesthetic—clean, professional, and modern. No cluttered or dated layouts.



Elite English Skills: You must be able to read briefs and integrate copy into designs without making grammatical errors.



Speed & Efficiency: You are a pro at using tools to work faster. You prioritize "done and high-quality" over "perfect and late."



Social Media Native: You know the correct dimensions, safe zones, and trends for IG, TikTok, LinkedIn, and
.



Technical Skills



Expert in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop/Illustrator) and/or Canva.



Experience with "Social-First" design (carousels, static posts, story layouts).

title: Operations & Automation Manager (Web, CRM & Systems Architecture)
description:
**IMPORTANT – READ FIRST**

To apply, start your application with the phrase:

**“Systems scale businesses.”**

Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.



---



## About the Role



We are building the operational backbone for a growing financial services business and related ventures. We are looking for an **Operations & Automation Manager** to design, connect, and optimize the systems that power our lead flow, sales process, and internal operations.



We currently use multiple tools (WordPress/Elementor, CRM platforms, scheduling tools, automation software, AI communication tools, etc.) and need a strong operator to centralize everything into one clean, scalable system.



Your job is to turn disconnected tools into a unified engine that supports growth.



---



## What You Will Own



### 1. Systems Architecture & Integration



* Connect website, CRM, scheduling, and communication tools into a seamless workflow

* Build and manage automations using platforms such as n8n, Make, or Zapier

* Ensure leads from web forms, outreach, and AI voice tools flow correctly into pipelines

* Reduce tool overlap and create a "single source of truth"



---



### 2. CRM & Sales Pipeline Infrastructure



* Design and optimize CRM pipelines (lead ? booked ? sold ? retention)

* Build automations for follow-up, reminders, no-shows, and re-engagement

* Maintain clean data and clear ownership of every stage

* Ensure the system supports increasing lead volume without breaking



---



### 3. Website & Conversion Infrastructure



* Build and maintain WordPress (Elementor) pages focused on conversion

* Optimize lead capture flows and booking systems

* Ensure technical stability when integrating plugins, video tools, or AI systems

* Implement SEO and FAQ/AEO structures that support growth



---



### 4. Automation & AI Communication Systems



* Integrate AI voice and communication tools into CRM workflows

* Ensure calls, texts, and
s trigger the correct automations

* Build logic that supports both inbound and outbound lead flow



---



### 5. Business Intelligence & Leadership Dashboards



* Build and maintain a leadership dashboard (CRM-based or Airtable/Looker Studio)

* Track key KPIs such as:



  * Leads generated

  * Appointments booked

  * Conversions

  * Revenue

* Provide clear visibility into operational health



---



### 6. SOPs & Scalability Planning



* Document all systems clearly

* Prepare processes for delegation to future hires

* Identify bottlenecks before they become problems

* Recommend future role structures as the business grows



---



## Required Experience & Skills



* Strong experience with automation platforms (n8n, Make, Zapier, or similar)

* Proven CRM pipeline design and automation experience

* WordPress/Elementor proficiency

* Comfortable working with APIs, webhooks, and integrations

* Strong systems thinking and problem-solving ability

* Clear written English and documentation skills



---



## Work Details



* Full-time (40 hours per week)

* Long-term role

* Must overlap with U.S. Eastern Time for at least 4 hours daily



---



## Compensation



* $1,000 – $1,600 USD per month (based on experience)

* Performance-based increases tied to operational efficiency improvements



---



## This Role Is Ideal For



* Technical operators who enjoy connecting tools into clean systems

* Strategists who think in workflows, not tasks

* Professionals who want ownership over a company’s infrastructure



---



## This Role Is Not For



* Designers only

* Entry-level VAs

* People uncomfortable with automation logic

* Short-term freelancers

title: AI Search Optimization Specialist
description:
About Us



We are a growing home service company looking to increase visibility inside AI platforms like ChatGPT, Google AI results, Perplexity, and other AI search engines.



We want our business to be recommended when people ask AI tools for local service providers.



Role Overview



We are hiring someone who understands how AI engines choose and surface businesses.



This is not traditional SEO.

This is AI Optimization, AEO, AIO, GEO, LLM visibility, or whatever you call it.



Your job is simple:

Help AI tools confidently recommend our business.



Responsibilities

title: Cold Email & Cold Calling Specialist — Web Design Agency
description:
Hi!



We're looking for a hungry, self-driven Cold
 & Cold Calling Specialist to help our web design agency land clients in the US market.



You'll be reaching out to small and medium businesses (dental clinics, law firms, construction companies, home service companies) that need a professional website. These are warm-ish leads — we find businesses with bad or missing websites, and you reach out to offer our services.



This is NOT spam blasting. This is targeted, personalized outreach to real businesses.



What you'll do:



• Send 20-40 personalized cold
s per day using our templates and lead lists

• Make 20-30 cold calls per day to US-based small and medium businesses

• Follow up with leads who don't respond (Day 3, Day 8, Day 15 sequences)

• Log every touchpoint in our CRM (Convex dashboard)

• Book discovery calls for the founder

• Report daily results 
s sent, calls made, replies, calls booked)



You MUST have:



• Excellent spoken English (you'll be calling US business owners)

• Experience with cold calling OR cold
 outreach

• Comfortable talking to dentists, lawyers, and contractors on the phone

• Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace

• Available during US business hours (8 AM - 4 PM EST, at least 4 hours overlap)

• Self-motivated — you won't be micromanaged



Nice to have:



• Experience with Instantly.ai, Smartlead, or similar cold
 tools

• Experience selling web design, marketing, or SaaS services

• Familiar with Google Maps for lead research

• Experience with CRM tools



What we provide:



• Qualified lead lists (you don't have to find the leads yourself but good if you do also)

• Proven
 templates and call scripts

• Training on our services and pricing

• Simple CRM dashboard to log everything

• Commission on every closed deal



About us:



RapidSite Studio is a newly started web design agency that builds modern, mobile-friendly websites for small and medium businesses in the US and Sweden. We deliver in 2-3 weeks at prices that undercut traditional agencies by 80%. We're small, fast, and growing.



This role has huge upside — if you perform well, it becomes a long-term position with increasing base pay + commission.

title: Customer Support & Order Resolution Specialist
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Customer Support & Order Resolution Specialist to manage and resolve customer inquiries related to online orders from major U.S. and European retailers. In this role,  it is not a standard customer service role, where you receive inquires and speak directly to the customer, rather it is about customers who are facing problems with their online orders from globally recognized brands such as Amazon, Apple, Samsung, and other leading e-commerce platforms.



You will act on behalf of the customer, communicating directly with merchants (for example: You will be contacting via live chat or phone call to various online stores, where the customer has placed an order from, and is experiencing a problem with it) and to investigate issues, resolve order concerns, and ensure successful outcomes. This position is ideal for individuals who are familiar with online retail stores, have experience with customer service, detail-oriented, efficient, and capable of handling multiple cases simultaneously.



Key Responsibilities:



- Handle customer issues related to online orders, including delivery problems, refunds, replacements, and order discrepancies



- Communicate directly with merchants and retailers via English phone calls and online chat systems



- Manage and resolve multiple cases concurrently while maintaining accuracy and professionalism



- Document case progress and resolutions clearly and consistently



- Work independently while meeting daily case-resolution targets



- Ensure high-quality outcomes and customer satisfaction on every case



- Work Structure & Flexibility



Each day, you will be assigned a set number of cases to resolve



With flexible working hours, If all assigned cases are completed before the end of your shift, you may take the remainder of the day off while still receiving full pay



Over time, you will develop efficiency strategies that allow you to complete work faster without sacrificing quality, to be able to work less hours but get paid by full time hours





**Work Schedule**



Mandatory Start Time (Flexible): 2:00 PM (14:00) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)



End Time: Flexible, depending on workload and efficiency



Full-time availability is required



**Requirements:**



- Fluent English communication skills



- Ability to conduct professional phone calls / chats in English (Use of AI is permitted during chat/calls, to ease workflow)



- Proven ability to multitask and manage multiple cases simultaneously, to save time and complete your work day faster, while receiving pay as for the full day



- Prior work experience in customer support, call centers, order management, or a related field



- Stable and reliable internet connection



- Full-time commitment only (no part-time availability)



- Salary is paid in cryptocurrency, if you are not yet familiar with cryptocurrency, it is fast, instant transfer and super simple to setup. No more waiting times for funds to unfreeze, become available or to transfer. Guidance will be provided how to setup. 



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Customer Service Rep for Health Clinic
description:
Join Australia’s leading telehealth clinic as our next Customer Service & Patient Experience Coordinator.



We’re looking for a warm, articulate professional who loves helping people and delivering exceptional service.

This full-time work-from-home, day-shift role is perfect for experienced customer support specialists with excellent English and a caring nature.



About the Role



Answer inbound calls and make outbound follow-ups with care, empathy, and professionalism

Respond to
s and messages from patients, guiding them through next steps

Manage appointments, confirmations, and reschedules using our CRM and scheduling platforms (Acuity, Pipedrive, Keap)

Run our Quality Control (QC) and retention processes to ensure records are accurate and complete

Support with credit control and follow-ups on outstanding payments in a kind, professional manner

Handle feedback and complaints with patience, empathy, and problem-solving focus

Coordinate with the clinical and support teams to ensure seamless patient care

Help maintain our training and SOP documentation for consistency and quality

Call patients to make sure they have all they needed and encourage them to continue to use our products and services



You’ll Love This Role If You…



Have a warm, confident phone manner and a genuine love for helping others

Can stay calm, professional, and kind — even with challenging patients

Take pride in delivering excellent customer service

Are highly organised, detail-oriented, and process-driven

Speak and write fluent English with a neutral or light accent (near-native fluency — C2 level)

Have experience working in customer support, healthcare, or wellness environments

Enjoy learning new systems and improving processes



Requirements



5+ years of experience in Customer Support / Patient Care / Call Centre / Admin

Excellent spoken and written English

Experience managing phone +
 communications

Tech-confident — CRM or scheduling tools (Salesforce, Keap, Pipedrive, Acuity, Zendesk, etc.)

Quiet home office setup with reliable high-speed internet (essential)



Nice-to-Have



Experience in healthcare, wellness, or telehealth

Background in admin, quality control, or credit management

Experience supporting Australian or UK customers



What’s in It for You



Work-from-home stability with a respected Australian health brand

Warm, supportive team that values integrity and kindness

Structured onboarding and ongoing training

Real career growth — potential to progress into Operations or Team Lead roles

The chance to make a genuine difference in people’s lives every day



How to Apply



Apply via OnlineJobs.ph



Include “Patient Experience – TLRC” in your subject line

Record a 1-minute video introduction (Loom or MP4) telling us:

Who you are and your background

What you love about helping people

A time you turned a difficult customer into a happy one

Attach your CV and speed test result (
)

title: DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER / MARKETING AUTOMATION SPECIALIST
description:
DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER / MARKETING AUTOMATION SPECIALIST



(Insurance Agency | Full-Time | Philippines-Based)



About the Company

We are a growing U.S.-based insurance brokerage expanding rapidly in personal and commercial insurance.



We are building long-term systems, not short-term fixes, and we are looking for one dedicated marketing professional, not a general VA.



This is a full-time, long-term position for someone who wants stability, growth, and ownership.



IMPORTANT, PLEASE READ BEFORE APPLYING

This is NOT:



• A social media posting role

• A beginner marketing job

• A task-only VA position This IS:

• A performance marketing role

• A lead generation & automation position

• A job for someone who understands funnels, data, and ROI



If you are comfortable owning results and improving systems, continue reading.



Your Mission

Your role is to design, build, and optimize a complete digital marketing funnel that consistently generates qualified insurance leads and converts them into booked appointments.



You are responsible for results, not just execution.



Traffic ? Leads ? Appointments ? Policies Written

 

Compensation & Long-Term Growth

• Salary based on proven experience

• Stable, long-term employment

• Internal promotions as the company grows

• Performance bonuses after 90 days tied to:

o Appointment volume

o Lead quality

o Cost-per-lead improvement

Core Responsibilities (Keyword Optimized)

Lead Generation & Paid Advertising

•
 / Meta Ads Manager (lead generation campaigns)

• Google Ads (Search & Local Service Ads)

• Retargeting campaigns

• Cost-per-lead optimization

• Ad creative testing



Marketing Automation & CRM

• Build and manage automations

• Lead scoring and tagging

• Automated follow-ups

• Appointment booking workflows

• CRM pipeline management







Funnels, Landing Pages & Conversion Optimization

• Funnel creation

• Landing page design

• Form optimization

• Google Tag Manager

• Tracking pixels and attribution

• Heatmap analysis (Hotjar or similar)



Analytics & Reporting

• Weekly performance reporting

• Cost-per-lead tracking

• Campaign profitability analysis

• Funnel performance reviews

 

• Strategic recommendations



SEO & Local Presence

• Google Business Profile optimization

• Review generation workflows

• Local SEO improvements



Ideal Candidate Profile

You should have hands-on experience in most (not all) of the following areas:



•
 Ads Manager (lead generation)

• Google Ads (Search campaigns)

• Marketing funnels & landing pages

• Marketing automation workflows

• Conversion tracking & analytics

• Performance reporting



Insurance experience is a strong advantage but not required.



If you do not meet every requirement but are confident you can perform at a high level, you are encouraged to apply.







Tools You Should Already Know

(You don’t need experience with every tool listed, but you should be able to work independently

in most of them.)



• Meta Ads Manager

• Google Ads

• GoHighLevel / HubSpot / ActiveCampaign / AgencyZoom

• Zapier or Make

• Google Tag Manager

• ClickFunnels / Webflow / WordPress

• Canva or basic creative tools







What Success Looks Like in the First 90 Days

• Automation pipeline fully built and running

 

• Consistent inbound lead flow

• Reduced cost per lead

• Appointment booking system operating with minimal manual work



HOW TO APPLY (MANDATORY — PLEASE FOLLOW EXACTLY)

Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed. Please submit:

1. A short introduction video

2. Platforms you are strongest in

3. Screenshots of campaigns you personally managed

4. Typical cost-per-lead results you’ve achieved

5. Type PIPELINE at the top of your application



Final Notes

• This is a full-time, long-term role

• We are not hiring freelancers managing multiple clients

• We value ownership, initiative, and improvement



If you are a builder, optimizer, and problem-solver who is confident offering ideas and improvements, we encourage you to apply.



We hire quickly.

title: GHL Expert
description:
GoHighLevel (GHL) Funnel & Website Expert (Remote)



We equip entrepreneurs and leaders with strategic systems, digital infrastructure, and scalable growth solutions. We build streamlined ecosystems that combine automation, marketing, and mission-driven clarity.



We do not build messy tech stacks. We build clean, conversion-focused systems.



Role Overview



We are looking for a GoHighLevel expert who can confidently build high-converting funnels and aesthetically strong websites inside GHL.



This role is not for beginners. You must understand structure, UX, automation logic, and conversion flow. Design should look premium, modern, and clean, not template-heavy or cluttered.



Key Responsibilities



- Build high-converting funnels inside GoHighLevel

- Design clean, modern, mobile-responsive websites

- Set up automations, workflows, triggers, and pipelines

- Connect domains,
 systems, calendars, and integrations

- Optimize pages for performance and user experience

- Troubleshoot technical issues independently

- Collaborate with copy and strategy team for alignment



Requirements



- Proven experience building in GoHighLevel

- Strong understanding of funnel psychology and conversion principles

- Eye for design and layout structure

- Experience with automation workflows and CRM setup

- Ability to work without constant supervision

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Portfolio of live GHL funnels or websites required



Bonus Points



- Experience in faith-based or mission-driven brands

- Knowledge of AI integrations or advanced automation

- Basic understanding of copy structure and marketing strategy



What We Offer



- Remote flexibility

- Long-term opportunity for the right fit

- Clear project scope and structured communication

- Opportunity to build scalable systems, not one-off pages



How to Apply



Please submit:

- Your availability



Thanks and we look forward to meeting you!

title: Marketing Strategist Needed for Digital Marketing Support
description:
We are seeking an experienced Marketing Assistant with a strong background in digital marketing. The ideal candidate will assist in various marketing campaigns, social media management, and content creation. A proactive attitude along with the ability to analyze data and drive results is essential. If you are passionate about digital marketing and have a knack for organization and communication, we would love to hear from you!



We founded Mountaintop Web Design because we were tired of seeing people wasting money on bad marketing. We do digital marketing the right way by providing top tier marketing services combined with amazing customer service, integrity, and an emphasis on bringing our clients a return on their investment. We focus on delivering solutions that produce tangible results for our clients.



We want to ramp up our cold outreach, kick off
 and Social Media campaigns, and begin our own content production, implementation, and optimization.



This role will be responsible for leading the execution and launch of the above items.



Key Responsibilities

Lead Generation & Outreach

o Build and maintain prospect databases

o Develop and manage a “Dream 100” target list of ideal prospects

o Set up and run cold outreach campaigns 
 & social) using Apollo, Instantly, LinkedIn

o Conduct daily outreach to at least 25 targeted leads

o Book at least 15 qualified strategy sessions per month

o Maintain outreach tracking inside our CRM (GoHighLevel)

Marketing & Campaign Support

o Assist with monthly webinar promotions and social media syndication

o Support the internal team on content reviews and light funnel setup

o Help configure landing pages and follow-up sequences

o Collaborate on internal and client-facing marketing strategies

Client and Sales Support

o Act as the first point of contact for incoming client inquiries and new leads.

o Follow up on sales leads and maintain accurate client data in the CRM.

o Assist in coordinating client onboarding and ensuring client satisfaction throughout the sales journey.

o Collaborate with the sales team to optimize lead follow-up processes.

Strategic Support

o Conduct bi-weekly check-ins with the CEO to realign priorities and address ongoing challenges.

o Proactively raise concerns, propose solutions, and implement approved initiatives.

o Support internal process improvement and documentation

o Assist with marketing tasks as needed to keep things moving forward





Needs:

o Monday-Friday

o Regular working hours MST/EST (Ideally 8-5 MST)

o Part or Full time (no agencies)

o Fully Remote



Applications

To apply, please fill out our application here: 
/careers/application/



On our application, do not submit a pre-recorded or generic intro video. Please respond directly to our questions in a single take and do not edit the video, as we want to learn more about how you communicate.
